review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is in a fantastic location, right in the heart of Singapore with easy access to shopping, restaurants, and attractions. The views from the hotel are incredible, especially from the famous infinity pool, which we enjoyed so much and also the friendly service for drinks and food!
The property offers a variety of dining options, high-end shops, a casino, and a connected mall that has everything you need.

Breakfast was excellent with a huge variety of choices, and I really enjoyed the afternoon tea as well. Our room was very spacious, very comfortable, and had everything we needed. The toiletries were high quality, and the room was kept very clean throughout our stay. The staff were very attentive at all times, concierge was so helpful. We felt welcome from start to finish.

It’s the kind of hotel where you can easily spend the whole day without leaving, but it’s also perfectly located for exploring the city. Overall, it was a wonderful stay!

review_text:
We first stayed at Marina Bay Sands 13 years ago, and this time we returned for just one night. Check-in was smooth and efficient — we received a temporary room card that already gave us access to the pool, which was very convenient. We decided to do some shopping first, and when we returned to collect our official room cards, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been given an upgrade. This gesture was truly appreciated.

As always, the pool and the food were excellent. You have the option to enjoy breakfast either by the pool or downstairs. If you're looking for a large buffet and don’t mind a lively atmosphere, the downstairs option is ideal. However, if you prefer a quieter, more refined experience with a set menu, the poolside breakfast is the better choice.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would be happy to return again in the future.

review_text:
While Marina Bay Sands dazzles visitors with its luxury shopping, world-class restaurants, and breathtaking architecture, my lasting memory comes from a group often overlooked: the housekeeping team.

During what was otherwise a very difficult trip, these professionals became the highlight of my stay. The scale of their work is extraordinary—cleaning massive, high-tech rooms with meticulous precision, restocking coolers and amenities, and ensuring no detail is overlooked, all within tight time frames. As someone with severe OCD, I notice everything, and I was genuinely in awe.

One housekeeper, in particular, came to refill my ice bucket—something I didn’t even need—yet she bowed repeatedly and apologized as though she were inconveniencing me. Her humility and dedication were deeply touching. Later, another staff member surprised me with a vegan birthday cake, complete with a candle. I had forgotten it was even my birthday, but that thoughtful gesture nearly brought me to tears. It wasn’t just a dessert; it was a reminder that I was seen and valued.

In a hotel renowned for grandeur, it’s the quiet diligence of the housekeeping team that, in my view, forms the true backbone of Marina Bay Sands. They made me feel special, cared for, and genuinely welcome. I would return not just for the stunning rooms, but to personally thank and see these remarkable individuals again.

Thank you so much for this experience, it made my birthday trip.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most stunning places I’ve visited in Singapore. That day I spent time walking around, enjoying the view, and taking photos. The architecture is so iconic and the whole place feels elegant and beautifully designed. Even just strolling along the promenade was relaxing and memorable.

What made the day truly unforgettable was having dinner at the rooftop bar, right at the highest point of the building. The view was absolutely breathtaking. I watched the sunset paint the sky in warm colors, followed by a full moon rising above the city skyline. It was one of those moments that just takes your breath away. Everything felt magical. The atmosphere, the view, the food, the soft breeze,  it all came together perfectly.

Whether you’re staying at the hotel or just visiting, this is a place you should not miss. It’s a must-see in Singapore and a memory I’ll always keep with me.

review_text:
This is one of the iconic spots I always visit when I’m in Singapore, and it totally lives up to the hype. From the moment I walk in, it feels like I’m stepping into something grand, boujee, and massive. The Shoppes here offer luxury shopping at its finest: sleek, shiny, and filled with high-end brands like Chanel, Gucci, and Louis Vuitton. Basically, it’s window-shopping heaven if you’re not there to splurge.

But it’s not all about designer labels. There are great dining options too, from fancy restaurants to casual cafés with beautiful views of the waterfront. And yes, the indoor canal with gondola rides adds a fun, over-the-top touch. There’s also the casino: sleek, expansive, and brimming with indulgences for those who want a premium gaming experience.

Even if you’re not buying anything, it’s a cool spot to stroll, people-watch, and soak in all the glam.

review_text:
1. The Landscape – Clean, Refined, and Aesthetically Pleasing

What struck me most upon arriving in Singapore was how neatly orchestrated everything felt — as if every corner had been thoughtfully composed. The city is meticulously planned yet still breathes with nature. Green spaces are not just “added in,” they’re woven into the very fabric of the urban environment — from vast parks to rooftop gardens and tree-lined streets.

Each district has its own flavor: Marina Bay is sleek and futuristic, Arab Street is a burst of color and culture, while Gardens by the Bay feels like stepping into a dream where technology and nature intertwine.

2. Singapore at Night – Where the City Truly Shines

If Singapore in the daytime is a pristine canvas, then nighttime turns it into a masterpiece. As the sun sets, the city transforms — illuminated by thousands of lights that reflect off glass towers and gentle waterways.

Key landmarks like Marina Bay Sands, Clarke Quay, Helix Bridge, and the lotus-shaped ArtScience Museum light up in ways that feel almost cinematic. Walking along the Singapore River at night, you can’t help but slow down — not from tiredness, but from awe. The “Spectra” light and water show at Marina Bay isn’t just a spectacle — it’s a moment that stays with you.

3. The Rhythm of Life – Energetic, Yet Graceful

Despite being a hub of finance, tech, and tourism, Singapore doesn’t feel overwhelming. People move quickly, but not anxiously. The city runs with purpose but still feels respectful, clean, and kind.

There’s a deep sense of order and mindfulness in how locals interact with public spaces — how they queue, how they keep the streets spotless, how they balance modern life with cultural roots. It's a quiet discipline that leaves a lasting impression.

review_text:
We booked a stay at Marina Bay Sands to celebrate my son’s birthday — it was his dream to swim in the infinity pool, and we wanted to make it unforgettable. I booked two suites for our family, kids, and nieces so everyone could be part of the celebration.

The rooms and the pool were simply amazing, and the kids had the time of their lives. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service, especially from Erica, who gave us a check-in experience unlike anything I’ve had before.

We were greeted right at the car and taken directly to our suite, where the kids were welcomed with chocolates and apples. While the little ones ran around, excited and full of joy, my family and I completed the check-in formalities in the comfort of our room — no queues, no waiting, just pure ease.

From start to finish, everything about our stay was thoughtful, seamless, and special. Thank you, Marina Bay Sands, for making my son’s birthday a memory we will cherish forever.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is truly a symbol of Singapore, and it’s a place I visit every year.

With so many rooms and guests, compared to other hotels of the same class, it doesn’t give the feeling of personalized care while moving around the hotel. However, the service at the lobby and concierge is excellent.

A few years ago, the hotel underwent a major renovation, and the rooms have been updated to a higher standard, which I’m really happy with. Since COVID, hotel prices in Singapore have risen across the board, and Marina Bay Sands is no exception. It’s now hard to find a room for under $700 a night.

Still, the signature infinity pool is something you just can’t miss :) I often bring guests here, and the growing number of F&B outlets offers a variety of options, which is very satisfying.

review_text: We stayed at the MBS for 2 nights. It was an unforgettable experience: the rooms are very spacious and clean, with the beds being absolutely perfect. review_text:
Staying at Marina Bay Sands was truly a dream come true! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was blown away by the sheer elegance and attention to detail, the grand space, the warm lighting, and the stunning arrangements of pink lilies that filled the air with the most amazing fragrance. It set the tone for an unforgettable stay.

The service was beyond exceptional. Every staff member I met was warm, professional, and genuinely eager to make my experience perfect. The room was a sanctuary, spacious, spotless, and boasting breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline. The bed was so comfortable, it felt like sleeping on a cloud, and every amenity was thoughtfully provided.

And then, the infinity pool… absolutely surreal! Swimming above the city, watching the sunset paint the skyline in gold and pink hues, was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. It felt like pure magic.

The location couldn’t be better, with easy access to everything Singapore has to offer. From start to finish, everything was flawless. This wasn’t just a stay; it was a memory I’ll cherish forever. Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel, it’s an experience of a lifetime!!

If you’re considering it, don’t think twice. Absolute perfection! I can’t wait to return.

review_text: I stayed in the Sands Bay Suite King with the Gardens by the Bay view, and it was pure luxury from start to finish. The suite was spacious and elegantly designed. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the walk-in wardrobe was a nice luxurious bonus. Being right in the heart of the city during the F1 weekend made the stay even more exciting, watching the city come alive with the race vibes was unforgettable. The rooftop infinity pool was breathtaking — swimming there with the city skyline all around felt like something out of a dream. The rooftop bar was the perfect place to enjoy premium drinks while soaking up spectacular views. With impeccable service and exclusive access to The Club, the whole stay was a truly luxurious experience. Definitely one of the best and most memorable hotel stays I’ve ever had.

review_text:
Iconic and Luxurious Experience!

Marina Bay Sands is an absolute gem in Singapore! The hotel, the infinity pool, and the observation deck – everything is top-notch. The view from the SkyPark is breathtaking, especially at sunset or night when the whole city lights up. The infinity pool on the 57th floor? Totally worth the hype – you feel like you're swimming in the sky.

The shopping mall downstairs is full of high-end brands, and the dining options are fantastic – perfect if you’re looking for something a bit fancy. The whole complex feels so luxurious and is a great spot to take photos.

Even if you're not staying at the hotel, visiting the observation deck or enjoying the rooftop is a must-do when in Singapore.

review_text: I stayed here in a suite for 3 nights, 21st June-24th June; family of 5. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Staff was helpful and efficient - both at check-in and accommodating of a 75year old disabled grandmother. Only mild complaint was some of the quality of the food at RISE for buffets - there is a lot of options, but a lot of it isnt world class that you'd expect. Other mild complaint is gym. It's a good 5-10 min walk away near the expo centre - while all the cardio equipment is new, the gym is TINY. If you go at peak times, you have to wait for dumbbells etc. Otherwise, all in all, it is a luxury hotel with great dining options and entertainment in a great location. RECOMMEND.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel — it's an experience.

From the moment you walk into the grand lobby, you're treated to luxury, modern elegance, and world-class service. The iconic three-tower structure connected by the SkyPark is an architectural marvel and a symbol of Singapore itself.

🌟 Highlights:

✅ Infinity Pool – The rooftop infinity pool on the 57th floor is everything it’s hyped up to be. The view of Singapore’s skyline while floating in the pool is unforgettable and perfect for photos. (Note: pool access is for hotel guests only.)

✅ Location – Perfectly located at Marina Bay with direct access to Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. Everything is walkable or connected via MRT.

✅ Rooms – Spacious, clean, and luxuriously comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows offer stunning city or bay views. Bathrooms are high-end and well-stocked.

✅ Dining – From celebrity chef restaurants (Gordon Ramsay, Wolfgang Puck, etc.) to food courts and local cuisine, there’s something for every palate and budget.

✅ Shopping & Entertainment – Endless luxury shopping, live shows, the casino, and even Sampan rides indoors! It's impossible to be bored.

✅ Staff & Service – Professional, friendly, and attentive. Check-in and check-out are smooth even when the hotel is busy.

review_text:
It was a surreal experience, which was good. It is expensive to dine within the hotel at various venues. Drinks were very expensive too. A buffet breakfast was included, but oh my goodness, it was extremely busy no matter what time we attended. One day, there were over 70 people in the queue waiting to be seated. We sent an email to the hotel, as one day, our allocated table was next to a door for anyone to go outside into the garden dining area. This particular breakfast wasn't enjoyable as it was a constant thoroughfare with so many other guests squeezing past. We received a phone call within a few minutes of sending our email. They understood our issue but didn't offer any solution. We weren't offered this table again 🙏 The said table was still in place the following day! We also sadly noticed the huge amount of food being wasted from a lot of guests.
We had a couple of issues having to wait, one was for some wine we had ordered for our room, we eventually after almost an hour of waiting received a call to advise the wine wasn't available!
The room itself was lovely & the views were beautiful. Overall the staff were extremely polite & very helpful.
The main thoroughfare near to reception is extremely busy, with anyone being able to access not just guests staying at the hotel as the shopping mall/cinema/casino/restaurants, etc, are accessible from here.
We do hope the infrastructure is being carefully considered whilst Tower 4 is being constructed, as the number of people moving through & around is extremely busy!!
The infinity pool was amazing though & enjoyable 😎

review_text:
To celebrate Kitty's birthday, I treated us to a suite at the iconic Marina Bay Sands, and it was an absolutely unforgettable experience. Knowing the suite was a significant investment, we decided to maximize our time indulging in the luxurious amenities and breathtaking views from our room. While we did venture out, we primarily focused on enjoying the comfort and elegance of our suite, interspersed with a special dinner at the Paiza Sky Residence.

The suite itself was incredibly spacious and elegantly appointed, offering stunning panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay. Kitty particularly loved the sheer size of the room, commenting on how much space there was to relax and unwind. The luxurious bedding and amenities were top-notch, but what truly impressed her was the luxurious bathroom. The enormous bathtub with a built-in jacuzzi was a standout feature, and the in-built bathroom TV added an extra touch of luxury.  She spent a considerable amount of time luxuriating in the tub, enjoying the jets and the in-bathroom entertainment.  We also made use of the in-room karaoke system (KTV), enjoying a fun and relaxing night of singing.

Our dinner at the Paiza Sky Residence was, without a doubt, a highlight. The service was impeccable, the food exquisite, and the ambience sophisticated and elegant. The panoramic views from the Sky Residence were equally stunning, offering a different perspective on the city skyline compared to our suite.

Even the little details were impressive. Kitty particularly enjoyed the high-quality toiletries provided. The  body lotion, hair shampoo, and conditioner all smelled divine. The complimentary drinks and fresh fruit in the room were a welcome touch. Everything was immaculately clean and seamlessly arranged, adding to the overall luxurious experience.

While we did briefly explore The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands and the SkyPark Observation Deck having a short swin at the infinity pool, the majority of our stay was spent luxuriating in our suite and enjoying the exceptional dining experience at the Sky Residence. It was a splurge, but for a special occasion like Kitty's birthday, it was absolutely worth it.

review_text:
If you’re visiting Singapore and looking for an unforgettable experience, Marina Bay Sands is the place to be. From the moment you step inside, it’s clear why this hotel is one of the most iconic landmarks in the world.

The architecture alone is a marvel — three soaring towers connected by the breathtaking SkyPark, which offers panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay. The infinity pool on the rooftop is perhaps the most famous in the world, and swimming there feels like floating above the city.

Rooms are spacious, modern, and impeccably maintained, with floor-to-ceiling windows that bring the stunning skyline right into your suite. The service is top-tier, blending warmth and professionalism in true Singaporean fashion.

What makes Marina Bay Sands truly unique is its integration with luxury retail, entertainment, and dining. The hotel is connected to a high-end shopping mall featuring the most prestigious brands globally — Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Dior, and more — along with a curated selection of fine dining from celebrity chefs like Gordon Ramsay and Wolfgang Puck.

The casino, ArtScience Museum, and regular light shows at the Spectra waterfront add even more dimension to your stay, whether you’re here for business or leisure

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is without a doubt one of the most iconic landmarks in Singapore, offering a luxurious experience from start to finish. The architecture alone is breathtaking—three towers connected by the famous SkyPark, which offers stunning panoramic views of the city skyline, Marina Bay, and beyond.

The Infinity Pool on the rooftop is world-famous and truly lives up to the hype. It’s only accessible to hotel guests, but if you get the chance to stay, it’s worth it for that view alone. There’s also a public observation deck if you're not staying at the hotel.

Inside, MBS features a high-end shopping mall with luxury brands, a canal with gondola rides, and a wide variety of restaurants—from celebrity chef fine dining to local delicacies. The ArtScience Museum and nightly Spectra light and water show at the promenade are great additions that make it a complete entertainment destination.

It’s directly connected to Gardens by the Bay via a beautiful pedestrian bridge, and the Bayfront MRT station is just below the complex, making it super accessible.

Whether you're staying the night, coming for a show, or just enjoying the views, Marina Bay Sands offers a world-class experience in the heart of Singapore.

review_text:
The most luxurious shopping mall I’ve ever been to. It includes the world’s first floating Apple Store and the world’s first Louis Vuitton Island Maison.

Easily accessible via Bayfront MRT station, the mall is huge, extremely clean, and well-maintained.

The signage in the mall is clear and easy to understand, making it simple to find your way around. There are many tourists, yet it doesn’t feel crowded because of how spacious the mall is.

The mall also has clean and modern restrooms and well-planned escalators for easy movement between floors.

It features a luxury hotel and was deemed the world’s most expensive standalone casino property in 2010 — though I didn’t have the chance to experience those myself.

Overall, it’s an impressive and unique shopping destination that combines luxury, convenience, and thoughtful design — definitely worth a visit even if you’re just exploring.

review_text:
For such a massive mega-hotel, the Marina Bay Sands executes quite flawlessly.  The room was beautiful and has some of the most impressive latest technology and the service is truly quite amazing.  And of course  - the rooftop infinity pool is one of a kind in this world.

We were fortunate enough to stay at the room facing Gardens by the bay with a large walk-out balcony. While the room was quite small, it was jam-packed with all kinds of tech features that even blow the Japanese hotels away.

The  service was absolutely remarkable. Any need was fulfilled within 10 mins or less from the call, and the staff truly cared about ones comfort.

The breakfast had the "quantity over quality" feel to it. As to be expected,  the spread was quite massive, with quite massive crowds to boot. Best to go before 08:30am to avoid any lines.

Of course, the rooftop infinity pool is a 10/10. Incredible in every way, a true modern marvel. We visited several times through several days and even at night and found plenty of loungers available. Staff was there to provide quick drink and snack service as well.

Overall , I was left impressed with the MBS. The room was impeccably clean and showed zero signs of wear. Its quite impressive how such a large enterprise can keep the service level so high. And the service was amazing, but one does feel a bit like a number based on the size of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
An iconic landmark of Singapore and a must-visit destination. The architecture itself is breathtaking, and the views from the SkyPark Observation Deck are absolutely stunning—especially at sunset when the city skyline lights up. The infinity pool at the top is world-famous, and for good reason, offering one of the most unique swimming experiences in the world.

Inside, Marina Bay Sands offers everything under one roof: a luxury shopping mall with high-end brands, a wide range of restaurants (from celebrity chefs to casual dining), a casino, and even a museum. The Spectra light and water show at night by the bay is a highlight not to be missed—free and beautifully choreographed.

While it is on the pricier side, the experience is unmatched and worth it at least once. A true symbol of modern Singapore.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Singapore truly exceeded my expectations during my short stay. The iconic property boasts breathtaking landscapes that immediately transport you to a world of luxury and elegance. While my visit was brief, I was able to immerse myself in the grandeur that Marina Bay Sands is renowned for.

Upon arrival, I regretfully missed the opportunity to dine at their Italian restaurant due to its closing hours. Nevertheless, I was compensated by the exceptional service and warm hospitality extended by the staff, making me feel welcome and valued throughout my stay.

One highlight of my visit was the casino experience, even though I am not a gambling enthusiast. Watching my friend revel in the excitement of the baccarat table was a joy in itself. The refreshing lemonade cucumber tea served at the casino instantly became a favorite, earning the amusing moniker "hot mountain dew" from us.

While exploring the expansive mall area, I marveled at the architecture and design surrounding me. The sheer scale of the mall was impressive, filled with an array of stores and amenities that cater to every need and desire. Although I missed the chance to fully indulge in retail therapy due to the late hour, the ambiance alone was enough to leave a lasting impression.

Despite the closing time of most establishments in the mall, we found solace in dining at the exclusive club restaurant. The culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional, offering a delectable array of dishes that tantalized our taste buds and left us craving for more. The impeccable service and attention to detail truly elevated our dining experience to a new level of luxury.

One cannot help but appreciate the intricate beauty and craftsmanship that permeates every corner of Marina Bay Sands. From the lavish decor to the stunning views of the surrounding cityscape, every aspect of the property exudes sophistication and opulence. The meticulous attention to detail is evident in every aspect of the hotel, ensuring a seamless and unforgettable experience for every guest.

The unparalleled views from the observation deck left me in awe of the panoramic vistas that stretched as far as the eye could see. The expansive skyline of Singapore, coupled with the stunning waterfront views, created a mesmerizing backdrop that encapsulated the essence of urban beauty and modernity.

Throughout my stay, I was consistently impressed by the level of service and professionalism displayed by the staff at Marina Bay Sands. Their dedication to ensuring the comfort and satisfaction of guests was commendable, making me feel valued and appreciated at every interaction.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a true gem that offers a luxurious and immersive experience like no other. From the exquisite landscapes to the world-class amenities and exceptional service, every aspect of the property is designed to exceed expectations and create lasting memories. My short but unforgettable stay at Marina Bay Sands has left me eager to return and indulge in all the wonders this iconic destination has to offer.

review_text: I really enjoyed my stay at Marina Bay Sands. We stayed one night only to experience the pool. I was concerned that the pool would be crowded but it wasn’t. The view at the top is truly amazing. I stayed there on a Tuesday in October. I got upgraded to a bayside suite room in Tower 3 in a newly renovated room and was able to watch the light show at the Gardens by the Bay which happens twice a night. The service was amazing and despite being such a big hotel, I did not feel lost or without attention. There is also a laser light show at the marina bay sands complex at night which was fun. Get there early to secure good seats. The area is fun to walk around or jog. There is also a mall attached and a casino. (Did not go so can’t comment)

review_text:
A Sky-High Experience with Spectacular Views

We visited hotel’s observation deck. This observation deck offers a panoramic view of the city that is truly breathtaking.

The primary draw of the Marina Bay Sands Observation Deck is, of course, the view. From this vantage point, you get an unobstructed, 360-degree view of Singapore’s stunning skyline, the bustling Marina Bay, and the vast expanse of the sea stretching into the distance. On a clear day, you can see as far as Indonesian lands.

The view encompasses some of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks. You’ll see the lush greenery and futuristic structures of Gardens by the Bay, including the Supertree Grove and the two glass conservatories. The sight of the Marina Bay area from above, including the Merlion, the Esplanade, and the Singapore Flyer, is particularly striking. As the sun sets, the city transitions into a vibrant display of lights, making the evening visit a magical experience. The colors reflecting off the bay and the dazzling city lights make it an ideal spot for photographers.

The Observation Deck itself is expansive, offering plenty of room to move around and take in the views from different angles. Unlike other observation decks that might feel cramped, this one provides ample space for everyone to enjoy the view without feeling crowded, even during peak hours. The deck is designed to ensure safety while providing an open, airy feel.

One of the unique aspects of the deck is its open-air design. Unlike enclosed observation decks with glass barriers, the Marina Bay Sands deck offers an unobstructed view, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the surroundings. The feeling of standing 57 floors above ground, with the wind in your hair and the city sprawled out beneath you, is exhilarating.

To get the most out of your visit, I recommend timing your trip to coincide with sunset. Arriving about an hour before sunset allows you to experience the transition from day to night. Watching the sun dip below the horizon, casting a warm golden hue over the city, is a moment of pure beauty. As day turns to night, the city’s lights begin to sparkle, creating a mesmerizing scene that’s perfect for capturing on camera.

Another highlight of an evening visit is the nightly Spectra Light and Water Show at Marina Bay Sands. From the Observation Deck, you get a unique, bird’s-eye view of this show, which combines dancing fountains, colorful lights, and music in a spectacular display. The view from above adds an extra dimension to the experience, allowing you to appreciate the choreography of the water jets and lights in their entirety.

The Observation Deck also offers a few additional amenities that enhance the experience. There’s a small bar where you can purchase drinks and snacks, allowing you to relax and enjoy the view with a refreshing beverage in hand.

It’s worth noting that the open-air design means it can get quite hot during the day, so bringing sunscreen and a hat is advisable if you’re visiting earlier in the day.

review_text: Of course, everyone needs to see and visit the Marina Bay Sands when they go to Singapore!! It’s a phenomenal building and just as impressive in-person as it is in photos. The staff is very kind and efficient since they have an outrageous number of people coming to stay or visit each day. The rooms are lovely with good views no matter where you are. The pool is also incredible! Staff is friendly there as well though reasonably strict about only allowing guests through (do NOT lose your room key!). The biggest downside is that it is truly flooded with people. The lobby, the restaurants, the bars, the pool, everything is crowded so it’s hard to fully appreciate the hotel and its amenities.

review_text: We stayed 2 nights and had booked bay view room but during checkin process we got upgraded to executive room with city zviewing which due to lack of room that I had booked. The executive room was fab and appeared like bigger than 3 bed flat.  City view from room and lounge area was amazing. Room was on 45th floor. Hi Tech touch panel everywhere to control lights, curtains and AC. Fully automatic smart toilet with touch panel, what a luxury !! Jacuzzi, 12 point shower panel, 2 wash basin in bathroom and a tv in front of bath. Separate dressing area, dining area, bar area, lounge area with 6 seater sofa having 75 inch TV. It was fab. Only thing I didnt like was the big queue for breakfast. This hotel is super expensive and seeing guests standing in a long queue was no pleasure at all. Then, though we were upgraded to executive room but were denied breakfast since it wasnt part of my original booking but executive suits cones with by default breakfast. Its like getting upgraded to business class from economy class but cabin crew serving you food of economy class which is rare or I have never heard of. Singapore is heaven for food and we wanted to explore local food hence it wasnt an issue at all but this is something MBS management shoul look into and consider my airlones analogy. Infinity pool, observation deck was easily accessible.

review_text:
I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the newly renovated suite at Marina Bay Sands, and it was an absolute delight from start to finish. Every aspect of the room exuded elegance and comfort, making my stay truly memorable.

One of the standout features of Marina Bay Sands that continually impresses me is their commitment to customer service. From the moment you arrive, you are treated with the utmost care and attention. The staff go above and beyond to ensure that every need is met promptly and with genuine warmth, leaving no detail overlooked.

This exceptional level of service is just one of the many reasons why Marina Bay Sands remains a top choice for discerning travelers seeking a luxurious and unforgettable stay. With its exquisite accommodations, stunning views, and unparalleled amenities, it's no wonder that Marina Bay Sands continues to set the standard for excellence in hospitality.

review_text:
Luxury on luxury! My favorite watch brands Patek and Piguet are here - bring your deep pockets if you want to hang out here.
Food- better than what we had everywhere else in the city but we didn't visit a lot of high end restaurants to compare. Ce La Vi is worth for the view! Make sure you have reservations.
Service - it is a hit or miss- at times you feel pampered and cared for, at times ignored.
Give yourself some time to eat from one place to another. The towers are quite massive and it takes some time to figure out and get from one point to the next. Definitely try the pool- an insta opportunity!
Is it worth the hype - absolutely (especially at night).
Is it worth the big price tag?-mmmm, not so sure!

review_text:
MBS is conveniently located as it's both close to the
Gardens by the Bay, as well as the city centre. The connected hotel buildings and the associated function and shopping venues are landmarks for Singapore. The hotel room was recently upgraded and has a great view of the garden (you can choose the city side too). It's got great services taken care of by the service teams, from filling up the bathroom amenities to booking a taxi for you, and immediately upon arrival - a warm (refreshing rather as it's pretty hot in Singapore already) welcome from the moment the taxi stops at the drop-off zone. The hotel has a great roof top pool with infinity edge, which is accessible to all guests through a transfer of lift. The hotel room felt luxurious - not my favourite style but every detail in the bathroom to the balcony was well considered. Highly recommended!

Would highly recommend experiencing a stay here.

review_text:
My trip to Marina Bay Sands was nothing short of spectacular, and I can't wait to share my experience with you. This iconic destination in Singapore is truly a marvel.

First off, the architecture is jaw-dropping. The three towering buildings connected by that massive rooftop deck, which includes the famous infinity pool, are a testament to human engineering at its finest. As soon as I arrived, I was in awe of the sheer scale and design of this place.

Now, let's talk about the shopping. The mall inside Marina Bay Sands is a shopper's paradise. You'll find all the high-end brands you can think of, and if you're a fan of luxury shopping, this is the place to be.

But the real star of the show is the view. From the rooftop deck, you get an unparalleled panoramic view of the Singapore skyline. I recommend going up there during sunset – the sight is simply breathtaking. And don't forget your camera because you'll want to capture every moment.

Now, onto the services. They are top-notch, just as you'd expect from such a renowned destination. The staff is incredibly friendly and always ready to assist with a smile. I felt well taken care of during my entire visit.

For those planning a visit, here are some tips. Aim to visit in the evening to catch the mesmerizing light show. Check the weather forecast because Singapore can surprise you with sudden rain. And budget accordingly, as Marina Bay Sands offers a plethora of experiences, and you'll want to make the most of your time here.

In terms of improvements, it's hard to find fault, but perhaps more affordable dining options could make the experience even more accessible to a wider range of visitors.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands is a must-visit destination in Singapore. It combines stunning architecture, world-class shopping, and breathtaking views into an unforgettable experience. So, if you find yourself in Singapore, make sure to put this gem on your itinerary – you won't be disappointed!

review_text: Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is an iconic destination known for its luxurious accommodations, world-class dining, and unparalleled entertainment options. The stunning architecture, including the rooftop Infinity Pool with breathtaking views of the city skyline, makes it a must-visit. Guests can enjoy the lavish casino, high-end shopping at The Shoppes, and a variety of cultural experiences at the ArtScience Museum. With its exceptional service and prime location, Marina Bay Sands offers an unforgettable experience for both tourists and locals alike.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is a stunning building with plenty of shops available, although the costs can be quite high. It’s easy to reach the Gardens by the Bay, Sky Tower, Flower Dome, and Cloud Forest from there. Inside the building, there’s a casino. For foreigners, there’s no entry fee and complimentary drinks, while locals need to pay an entry fee. It’s advisable to avoid playing the games.

A full day is needed to see the tourist attractions in Marina Bay and nearby areas. Most of these attractions require an entry fee, which can be quite expensive.

Everything about MBS is as expected so 5*. At the same time, there is nothing ‘special’ about the place. You get what you pay for. Some may find it cold and almost too clinical in its execution. It’s one of those ‘must stay’ hotels for tourists coming to Singapore.

review_text: Truly amazing hotel. Everyone comes here for the rooftop infinity pool, which is breathtaking and a must if you visit Singapore, however I was equally impressed with the complete package. The complex itself is absolutely huge, from the shopping centre to casino to various different top quality restaurants. From the moment you arrive and go through the efficient, time-allotted check in, the staff are so friendly and attentive. The rooms are massive and emaculately clean, bed is comfy and bathroom/shower is great. Certainly not cheap but you really feel like you get what you pay for with the whole experience.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort complex in Singapore. It features a distinctive design with three towers connected by a rooftop SkyPark. The SkyPark offers panoramic views of the city skyline and includes a stunning infinity pool, restaurants, bars, and observation decks. The resort also boasts a large casino, luxury shopping mall, theaters, museums, exhibition centers, and a wide array of dining options, including celebrity chef restaurants. Marina Bay Sands is a popular tourist destination, known for its luxurious amenities, entertainment offerings, and architectural marvels.

review_text:
Iconic. This is the only way to describe this hotel. We arrived at 9.30am and yet they still checked us in, allowed us our room and were friendly and inviting. We are in room 3622 (36th floor,  room 22)

The cases were brought to the room within 15 minutes as promised, and the bed (for my 16 year old) arrived and was set up within 30 minutes.

You can arrange everything from the app and the large TV.

The room overlooked the gardens and bay as requested.

The room was large, had tea and coffee machines, a pre stocked and free mini fridge, and snack drawer.

The bathroom had a full set of amenities e.g. shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, tissues, dental kit etc. There were slippers and bath robes, which I noticed people also used around the pool.

The lifts are activated by swiping your room key card before selecting your floor. The room key card is also required to access the infinity pool on the roof, which also allocates you a towel.

The pool is amazing. It is warm and has the most amazing views across the river to Singapore, including the Merlion. The food is amazing. You can sit around the pool with anything from squid sushi rolls to burger and fries (both of which are delicious).

Whilst the pool is only open to hotel guests the observation deck is open to the public.

There is nothing to dislike about this experience. Well worth the stay. The last thing to mention is the staff, every one has been brilliant, friendly and charming.

review_text: Had a lovely 3 nights staycation with my kids. Service was good. The views were just incredible, stayed at tower 3 51st floor. They do not mention this when ur booking the stay but they do inform u at the receptionist that in order to enter the infinity pool either to enjoy it or just walk around, you need to book a slot. Its an hr slot for each time ur book. And its limited. Due to they capped it at only 50-100pax at each slot. My advice is u book it when checking in. If u manage to get a slot, it will be fabulous.  The pool is basically empty due to everyone is spreaded apart. My kids had a good time since there were more space for them to play . ◡̈

The rooms are very clean, the bathroom was very spacious and the view is of course incredible over Marina Bay.

This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in in my life. I've been all around the world and this is it! The hotel is amazing but it's not just a hotel. It's the surroundings. You have a huge shopping mall attached to the hotel that has everything you can need as well as the casino for those of you who like to take risks. And you can't not mention the infinity pool on the roof. Singapore is a warm country so just sitting up there on the roof. Looking out over the skyline relaxing in a pool is by far one of the best feelings in the world. The staff was amazing. Everybody was very nice and professional. There's absolutely zero complaints about this hotel.  Of course, because of the surroundings everything's a little pricey, but what do you expect.?? There's a club located in the mall called marquee which is amazing, one of the best clubs in the world I would say. And then on the roof next to the pool you have another club and a restaurant called celavi
I spent almost a week here and I really had no reason to leave the hotel or the area.

review_text:
Such a great hotel!
If you’re visiting Singapore you must take at least one night to experience the hotel.
The hotel is well equipped, there is a gym and spa and casino and a whole new level of shopping experience. Oh and of course the tallest pool in the world (57th floor).
The staff is really nice and helpful.
The views from the pool deck (which is exclusive for hotel guests) is just incomparable. Spent hours there, day and night. The views are just addicting.
There is an MRT station right under the hotel (literally beneath it) so it’s so easy to get by.
The hotel is built from 3 buildings, which are huge, so take a little time to learn how to navigate through this huge complex.
The hotel is a bit pricey but it’s just so worth it.
Would definitely come back again.

review_text:
Not worth the cost $3,800USD for 2 rooms for 2 nights. 1 of 2 rooms wasn’t ready for 1.5 hours after guaranteed checkin time and was full of cigarette smoke. They attempted to say they will “clean” it somehow as they said they were fully booked which we refused as our kids were staying there. After some arguing they agreed to find another room which they did. Not sure how as they previously said they were booked. Later that evening we got stuck unable to use elevators from pool when all our keys became disabled including our 1st room. By 8pm we finally had 2 rooms. This is after arriving at 1pm. Really disappointing for a hotel demanding such a high price.

While amazing views and experience from rooftop pool, I would never stay there again. Wasn’t worth it even with the frustration.

review_text:
Definitely an overpriced place, the facility is outdated and the overall management is poorly designed. If you are there for casino and infinity pool this might be the place for you, but if you are there for leisure and holiday (like us), you might be ended up with huge disappointment. The hotel has no walk-in capacity for stay in guests at any bar/lounge, everything need to be booked in advance. We were planned to stay there for 3 nights but couldn’t find a place for a casual drink at any bar/lounge. The staff there was very friendly and managed to help us made a reservation at one of its bar, but there is a dress code which doesn’t allow any guests entry with slippers and shorts. (For god’s sake we just wanted to have a couple of drinks at the bar, who would wear a formal suit on the holiday with the temperature is around 33 degree Celsius)

I gave 2 star only to the staff there, they are very well trained and friendly. Overall a horrible experience. There are plenty of good 5 stars hotel in Singapore which have better facility/service. For the amount of money I have paid, the experience is not even close to expectations. I would never return there.

review_text:
What you’re really paying for when you stay here is to swim in the infinity pool, which is amazing!!! 5 stars for the pool and the pool staff.
BUT everything else is so average (plenty of much nicer accommodation on the island) and check in is painful. It took almost half an hour once I got to the front of the line and then I was told my room wasn’t ready and wouldn’t be for “maybe an hour” - this was at 3:30pm. You are paying a grand a night for that room, you would expect your room to be ready by the usual 3pm time. Luckily I asked if we could go up and use the pool until we had our room which they allowed and were nice about but they didn’t offer that up front. The staff are really nice but the hotel seems to have some strange and very strict processes which makes the stay feel really not holiday-yee. We loved the pool and staff but Otherwise the feel of the place wasn’t enjoyable. We hoped the experience for the price would be better!!
Must say they were helpful with storing luggage though!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most iconic hotels in Singapore, and for good reason. This luxurious hotel offers an unparalleled experience for guests, with its stunning architecture, world-class amenities, and unbeatable location in the heart of the city.

From the moment you step inside the hotel, you will be blown away by its grandeur and sophistication. The rooms and suites are beautifully designed and well-appointed, with all the modern conveniences you could need, including high-speed internet, state-of-the-art entertainment systems, and breathtaking views of the city.

The hotel's dining options are also exceptional, with a range of world-class restaurants serving up delicious cuisine from around the globe. Whether you're in the mood for fine dining or casual fare, you'll find something to suit your tastes here.

One of the highlights of Marina Bay Sands is its stunning infinity pool, which offers breathtaking views of the city skyline. This is the perfect place to relax and unwind after a busy day of exploring Singapore.

review_text: It was just OK for a big name. Not super good for family travellers. Restaurants aren’t good at all with way too many people. Night view from the poolwas good though.

review_text: Worth every peso. This is one of the best experiences I've ever had in Singapore. Definitely worth the hype. You'll enjoy the Singapore skyline.

review_text:
The pool, while very nice views, gets very busy.

Service, views, rooms, the mall below... All a one time experience, and I imagine if your wallet is deeper the premium rooms at the top should be even better.

If I happen to have buisness in Singapore again for a short period, I'll likley return.

review_text:
Liked - Obviously location, it is still the best. You are coming there for a great downtown view either from your room or from the rooftop pool. The pool is amazing but it is usually overcrowded and you have to spend time to find a spare sun bed.

Disliked · The rest a part from the above. The hotel is overpriced and we were not receiving that level of comfort that you could receive in any of 5* hotels near by. The room equipment was very weak and old, the free mini bar looked like a joke when you are paying 700$ per night. There were no bath in the bathroom.
We had a huge room but it looked empty, they might have added 2 armchairs in front of the window to enjoy the view, but it was not there.
It looked like very simple things were missing.
The hotel is undergoing renovation now and it looks like it will be even more expensive.

Simply love the tireless riding experience from Potong Pasir to Marina Bay Sand and immersing into the vibes of MBS during CNY Festive season. This is a MUST visit for all tourists, foreigners and Singaporean & PR.

review_text: Absolutely perfect stay. Staff was gracious and hospitable and the facilities left us wanting nothing. Our room on the 49th floor was spectacular with a view over the gardens, the cloud forest and the harbour. We woke with the sun every morning just to see the sunrise view, and enjoyed the Garden Rhapsody every night from the comfort of our private balcony.  Our visit was Feb 2020 so there were very few travelers and we often had the infinity pool to ourselves- a rare delight!  One of the few times that the experience is even better than the expectation- the hype is absolutely fair :)

Lots of shops to shop from. The food court is a mouth full too.
Love the jog around the bridge with a few enthusiasts around to  keep you active.

After hours, then hit the casino which is always a dream to win the jackpot, but it's all about luck, so don't expect, just have a good time.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is a lively and bustling hotel that may not offer a standard relaxing experience. However, its renowned infinity pool lives up to all expectations. Perched atop the skyscrapers, the pool provides breathtaking views of the cityscape, creating a memorable and unique oasis amidst the busyness. If you're seeking an unforgettable pool experience, Marina Bay Sands delivers.

review_text:

review_text: A luxury mall with tons of stores and fancy restaurants. Don't be like us and miss out on the amazing food court. It's definitely a more affordable side of the mall that includes tons of smaller food stalls at better prices. Similar to a standard hawker centre, you can grab food from different spots and bring them back to the table and share. Just be warned, it's a very popular area so it's usually packed and sometimes difficult to find an open table, especially during lunch/dinner times. But there's lots of very tasty food and incredible teas and drinks.

review_text: Lovely view from the pool. The staff are friendly and attentive which set the standard of my hotel stays. The food is alright, due to situation I believed they scale down but still the staff makes the experience lovely. TWG tea for breakfast, already make me grin happily.

review_text: Spectacular and iconic hotel, casino and shopping centre. While it tends to be pricier compared with other 5 star hotels in Singapore, you get a lot of value for your money - easy access to Gardens by the Bay, top quality shopping and dining experiences, great taxi and subway connections. Breakfast is superb with plenty of options. The skypool is a truly memorable experience and most definitely worth it. Rooms and roomy and have amazing views of either the city or the gardens.

review_text: Visiting Singapore with the family, we wanted to try out the famous Marina Bay Sands. Because our son just turned 12 few days before our check-in, we were told the room we booked was not sufficient for the 4 of us due to fire safety regulations. 12 years is considered adult. So we were offered a room that was 3 times more than the reservation we made. Which did not really fit into our budget. After waiting a little bit longer around the lobby, they found a solution that was more acceptable and finally - we checked in! The room was on the 46th floor - really nice view to the Harbor. The only cons I could find were - no toilet bidet and the pillows - way too big and uncomfortable. We did have an incident right next to our room- 3 am in the morning we were woken up by loud screams and crying on the hallway. Really scared us and the kids. But overall a nice experience that we wanted to try - the swimming pool and the breakfast were amazing!

The hotel is suitable for business and leisure purpose. Food are priced above average price compared to eatery shops located outside the hotel. Art Science Museum & Apple Store located outside the hotel on the waters.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is undoubtedly an impressive and beautiful destination to visit, with its stunning architecture, luxurious amenities, and breathtaking views. However, you should be prepared for the fact that it can also be quite tiring. The sheer size of the complex means there is a lot of ground to cover, and the lack of available seating areas can make it difficult to take a break and rest tired feet. Despite this, the experience of Marina Bay Sands is well worth it, as long you take it slow and are prepared to pace  and to take the time to fully appreciate everything this iconic location has to offer.

review_text:
Didn't stay here this time, but had a lovely lunch in one of the restaurants, which gave us the opportunity to check out the view from the opposite side of the hotel to the usual lookout.
It's truly a spectacular sight from one of the most beautiful hotels in the world, looking over part of one of our favourite cities. This place is an absolute must on any Singapore itinerary.
Added a few more fotos of Singapore as well.
Can't wait for our next visit.
Highly recommended.

review_text:
Enjoyed our stay at MBS. Was there mainly for work but brought 3 kids along. We loved the views  and the spaciousness of the room. The shower & bathroom were a great size with lovely amenities from Roberto Cavalli but we did wish there was a bathtub!

Of note was the service quality. We had a dedicated team- Erica & Mark- assisting us with an early check-in. They even arranged for a little cake as they knew it was one of my son’s birthday and a bottle of wine… probably since I was solo-parenting with 3 kids!

The kids visited the pool several times even when it was grey & drizzly as the views were really lovely, and we went to many different restaurants throughout our stay which were all lovely, notably Rise, Spago & Lavo.

review_text: The location is great. The pool access is key, but it’s crowded day and night with people taking pictures. Our last night I was hoping to take my daughter for a cocktail, but the bars were all rented out/booked and was told to use in-room dining. After calling and being on hold 30+ minutes was told it would be 75+ minutes for a cocktail to be delivered to the room. Huge disappointment!!! I do NOT recommend booking this hotel except for one night (for the pool pic) - other than that pick a hotel that has time and care for their customers. This was like a bad Disney experience.

It has included almost all sorts of business and facilities and, is pretty much like a mini city. Can you believe there is even a manmade river at the bottom floor that you can enjoy an interesting little sailing for a tiny bit of cost? The food court was always busy and crowded though. It is open 24 hours and provide a lot of convenience to the shoppers and hotel residents. Absolutely worthwhile visiting!

review_text:
Such a stay!

The rooms are well designed, and the beds are comfortable. You can add an extra bed for a couple of hundred SG$ if you travel in family. They are comfortable too.
The room service delivers in less than 30 min at 9 PM. It's tasty.

There is no alcohol in the mini bar, but everything is free and refills every day.

The WiFi is very easy to access but not available when you are in your balcony and the windows are closed. Very reliable and fast enough to do everything  you want.

When you are on the balcony in a garden room, the road is a bit noisy. But when you close the windows, you can't hear quite nothing.

Between levels 10th to 20th in the garden side, you'll access twice per night to the gardens by the bay show directly from your room. Very pleasant.

There is a SMRT station in the mole next to the hotel.

There is a supermarket in this mole.

We went 3 or 4 times (morning, afternoon, evening) in the swimming pool and never had to wait: there were always plenty of free spaces.

Easy checkout. (Less than 2 min).

Bad points:
- WiFi not available on balcony
- road noise on the garden side in the lower levels
- 1st price wine in the room service which could be better.
- would love not finding the lights turned on after every room service.

review_text:
Things I didn't know:
Pool access is no longer restricted to one entry per day as it was until recently - you can now go whenever you want
They will email a day before asking you to pick a check in time slot but this is not essential.

Location:
Great location to explore Gardens by the Bay - you can see the light show from a garden view room but it is probably too far away to hear the music. Apart from the shopping mall and hotel restaurants, I don't there are other cheap eats or supermarket nearby. The metro station is next to the hotel though. Also much quicker to get to the airport from here compared to the downtown hotels - it's closer to the highway.

Check in:
There are queues to check in and it took us about 20 minutes. Make sure you ask everything you need to to avoid queuing again! They were relaxed about extending check out by an hour to 12pm. We had a basic garden view king bed room. They gave a free mooncake which was a nice touch.

Room:
Very clean and seemed modern (not sure if it has been refurbished recently). Large bathroom with good shower. Huge TV screen! Balcony was spacious with stunning views of Gardens by the Bay and the ships beyond.

Pool:
We missed sunset but went at about 7am. Few people around then so easy to have great photos just after sunrise. Possible to swim a few lengths too. There are 3 main pools and one of these allows children with supervision. There is also a very small children's pool with clear plastic walls. Definitely the highlight of our stay. The pool staff know this is why people stay at the hotel and they are very helpful and friendly. The pool is open from 6am to 11pm.

Highly recommend a stay here as part of a Singapore vacation. It is the iconic building of Singapore - combine it with Gardens by the Bay. 2 nights may be better - we didn't have time for ArtScience museum, the Spectra light show, or wandering around the mall.

review_text:
This isn't really a hotel, it's a captured resort experience. The rooms are enormous, fabulous and the housekeeping is absolutely top notch; we did not want for bottled water and juices over our 5 night stay.

The views are great if you get a high enough room and if you really want access to the pool then you must be booked into a high enough floor to be allowed. Access to the pool is strictly by one room key being presented per adult.

Where this place really falls down is that you absolutely must place a reservation if you want to eat. We were turned away at every single restaurant on the night we arrived and ended up having to order room service food. Inevitably wth a place this size, even despite the insulated trolley, it was cold by the time it got to us. For those of us who are more spontaneous, this is frustrating.

The facilities are second to none. From the absolutely amazing laundry to the incredible breakfast and dinners, utterly stunning roof top pool to swim, rest, incredible views and lots of pics!!!!

MBS works like clockwork. It’s immaculately clean throughout, the amazingly stunning displays in the atrium and hall created in house, check in a dream and so informative to the incredible caring staff who come over and talk to you.

5 stars isn’t high enough. If you stay in Singapore, stay here. You’ll love it and create memories that’ll last a lifetime.

Thank you again!

review_text:
We decided to check off a bucket list item and stay at the Marina Bay Sands hotel specifically for the iconic pool.  And while I am glad we did, I likely wouldn’t stay there again honestly.  For the price, the rooms were really pretty average.  The view we had overlooking the Gardens by the Bay was great though as you could watch the Garden light show from your (tiny) balcony.  Bathroom was nice and large with good amenities.  Staff was overall friendly. The crowds definitely didn’t make it feel personal.  And frankly staying here felt almost like work rather than relaxing.  You had to remember to request check-in times and schedule pool times a day in advance (hard to do while traveling). Then each person has to have their own QR code—only available by SMS—for the pool, which was a problem because some in our party didn’t have cellular service to get the code. Luckily the pool staff accepted the room key and my confirmation email (likely helped we went early before it was crowded).  The pool was definitely impressive!!  It was also frustrating because they advertise over 90 restaurants but we didn’t know they all required reservations, even for lunch.  Most of these were in the mall (full of all the fancy stores and nothing in our price range!). We had a lot of trouble finding places to walk into to eat and that was just annoying.  It was also very crowded.  We did not visit the casino. Honestly the best way to describe the hotel is that you’ll feel like you are in a busy Vegas hotel like Caesar’s or the Bellagio.  It felt more like that than a 5 star hotel, especially considering it was likely the most expensive basic room I’ve ever stayed in.
Again it was fun to say we stayed there. We don’t regret it. But probably wouldn’t do it again. Just go into knowing to expect waits and crowds and that you are doing it to see one of the coolest pools ever.

I should note that one in my party completed a mid-stay survey from the hotel and got an almost instant follow up call. So they do seem to care about customer service.

Upon check-in, we waited as other have noted; Nothing is efficient.

We were then asked to pay, Room + a holding deposit, which we obliged.

I've never been asked to pay a holding deposit before, particularly when paying $1200 a night.

After making payment we were told there was no room available for us, and we were asked if we'd prefer a king bed or two single beds (for a family of four).

I had several email exchanges with staff prior to arrival and my wife also called on the phone to ensure the hotel was able to accommodate a family of four in one room. (Their website for some reason only allows Brookings for 3 people per room).

Being told by check-in staff that we had no room, after an 8 hour flight was exacerbating... If they'd told us before making payment we'd have simply walked out.

It was quite a horrible ruse.
It is entirely unfair and unreasonable.

Somehow after stating it was a ridiculous idea that four of us would share a bed, a room materialised.

The room was fine (just a standard room), however had two issues.

1) It is NOT a garden Room view which we booked and paid.

2) There are no linens for my second child. They missed out on even a towel.

To avoid frustration we decided to explore the hotel, where we looked for the observation deck.

The CE LA VE staff were simply rude.

Told us they were fully booked before we even had a chance to ask what CE LA VE was... I'm still not sure, I think it's a restaurant which we're not welcome to attend.

I travel around the world for work, and this is surely the most over-hyped hotel I have ever stayed.

Beds are uncomfortable, service is slow.

The pool view is great, but hardly anything to dribble over for your Instagram.

Oh at 9:30pm we had staff try and deliver a birthday cake... Which would have been nice, but it wasn't anyone's birthday.

Someone did try and call to "apologies" but their solution was to give us free breakfast... Which I had to inform them we'd already paid for with our room.

With so many nice hotels in Singapore, why bother?

Our room was extremely huge with 2 TVs and could easily fit another queen bed. No bath tub! The amenities had to be pre-booked but the system was easy to use. The pool was as picturesque as it seems and the sauna/steambath/hot pool was great! I was the only one there, and it came with fresh towels and shower facilities.

There's plenty of food nearby, even a super market! Room service was however a little slow, we had finished our cup noodles by the time utensils arrived.

review_text:
Had a one night stay at MBS for my birthday celebration last week with my wife. The stay was amazing! From the time we check-in, the front desk check in process was seamless and attentive. They aware that it’s my birthday and arrange a birthday cake send to my room.

The highlight of the trip definitely is the infinity pool. We manage to book a swimming pool slots by their online systems and the pool capacity is limited due to the covid SMM. This creates a even more magical moment to me as all of us get to have a beautiful slots in pool to relax and take lots of lovely photos.

Prior entering the pool, one of my biggest concern will be the water quality in the swimming pool as I had sensitive skin where I avoid public pool due to the cleanness and chlorine. To my surprise, I didn’t had any skin irritation after the swim! I’m truly amazed by the water quality of the swimming quality and the team that maintain the pool definitely deserve a praise!

Overall we had a very pleasant stay especially the experience in the infinity pool. Will definitely go back for the stay again!

review_text:
Checking in at 23:00 / 11:00 pm, and had to pay deposit. The problem is - it can NOT accept debit card from the most popular bank in Indonesia, BCA. Also it failed to accept payment from my Citibank Visa card.

So I had to look around for ATM, at 11 pm, get some cash from it, with NO PROBLEM using that debit card that was rejected by the hotel, and head back again.

And of course the check-out process became slower, because I had to get back my deposit as cash again.

And during the whole stay in S'pore I was, ALWAYS, able to use that debit card with no problem - except in a small diner, where the staffs does not even  speak English & only accept NEST or cash; but that's of course  understandable. A five star hotel? Unbelievable.

====

The hotel staffs however are amazing and very helpful. It's clear from their body language that they're genuinely care about you.

Once I had to ask for help with the TV, I tried to connect it to my laptop via HDMI cable, but no joy. The tech guy arrived shortly, and very apologetic.
He listened to my explanation, and fully accept that the issue is on their side - usually, people will try to blame my laptop (I use Linux, not Windows)

He worked really fast, but clearly it stumped him at first. He apologized so much I almost laughed - I had to say to him to take his time, I'm in no rush at all; yet he still tried his hardest. It was amazing.

Pretty soon he figured out the root cause, and my laptop finally able to connect to the TV. I thanked him, and he apologized again in return, while it was not even his fault.

The hotel should count itself very lucky to have such diligent staffs like him.

I forgot to ask for his name, anyway I stayed in room 520, from 11 to 13 Dec 2022.

review_text:
So before leaving Singapore, Marina Bay Sands was in my bucjet list and hence we had to go there for a staycation, otherwise its infinity pool could have haunted me forever 😛

We had two kids with us and we were in the infinity pool for most of the time ( upto 6-7hrs / day) ... the view from the pool is breathtaking but the breeze at this high rise is just freezing 😬😬😬 so we ordered some yummy hot vegetarian snack but to our dismay there wasnt much for vegetarians.. so we got fries, juices and hot coffee.

Apart from the infinity there isnt much for kids in the hotel.. but yes if you go downstairs to explore you will find great options like science exhibit, shopping malls, boat ride, laser show in the evenings..

For food I would recommend getting down the hotel and explore other options as there are many.

review_text:
This is a hard review to write. Marina Bay Sands was, by far, the most expensive hotel I’ve ever stayed, and is certainly an icon in Singapore. Since that was true, my expectations were particularly high. And Marina Bay just didn’t meet them.

Doing anything there is more challenging than most hotels. You have to reserve a time to check in. That’s actually more of a problem than it seems since most people fly in on international flights and have to clear customs and immigration, which can be unpredictable. Plus, reservation times become limited the closer to your stay. We arrived about an hour and a half earlier than our reservation. It was not immediately clear what to do when we arrived. Just about 30 seconds before we were approached by a helpful staff member, we noticed a small sign with a lot of writing and a QR code that signs you into the check in queue. We scanned the code, and after about a 10-minute wait, it was our turn to approach the desk and start the check in process. Evidently there are times of the day when Registration is extremely crowded, so the hotel has instituted these extra steps. Thankfully, it wasn’t that crowded when we arrived, but the whole process is still quite cumbersome.

You must also use a QR code to register if you want to use the famous rooftop pool. No access without first registering. By the way, after registering for a check in time and pool access, the hotel sends an SMS with confirmations. Of course, you must have an international phone plan that allows you to receive SMS messages.

The hotel room itself was nice enough. Spacious. Nothing particularly stands out as being a super expensive room, except we did have a fantastic view of the Marina Bay Gardens. Other than the view, it felt like any other convention hotel room I’ve ever stayed in.

The rooftop pool is as spectacular as all the pictures depict.

All in all, the hotel has a very Las Vegas feel to it - massive, crowded, casino and hyper-expensive shopping mall, nightly water and light shows. It was ok for one visit, but I wouldn’t pay that much to stay there again.

review_text:
We had to reserve our check in timing a day prior to our stay. We were allowed to check in early, which was good for us, since I requested for it after making reservations. The check in personnel - Shirley was able to explain the details clearly to us, and wished us happy anniversary since she knew we were celebrating our anniversary. She also check to ensure we made reservations for the infinity pool.
The staff at MBS are very friendly. They greet their guests and is usually with smiles.
The room was very spacious and ours was facing the sea. There is also complimentary snacks and drinks. They have us a small chocolate cake for our celebration.

Parking and walking to the hotel is difficult. There is no direct connection from carpark to the hotel. The walk from carpark to the hotel lobby is very far. The signage is very confusing.
We parked in central, and it took us a round about walk to hotel lobby 1, walk back to tower 3 for check in whereas I could have directly walked from central area to tower 3 check in!

The breakfast at Spago was good. Although we were limited to the mains, but it was really more than enough to fill us. The infinity pool is truly amazing with it’s bay view. It’s best to book a day and night trip, so you get to have different views.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and the service they provide.

review_text:
Booked reservations Oct 12-16 2022 .

On arrival, check in was less than 10 minutes (poor lobby seating noted). We were greeted by Sara(FOSARASVSI), front desk clerk who was very polite, professional and a true gem during our check-in process. We purchased the REIMAGINE Package at the time of booking (3nights) and did not realize this was going to be the biggest headache.
Sara explained that we must visit an agent within the hotel to redeem our REIMAGINE package/card/etc. , then proceed to any Silver Kiosk to print vouchers for daily redemption (breakfast, lunch, etc.)

After 4 hours of travel, I was not pleased to hear we had to go on a scavenger hunt in this massive hotel/ casino for an expensive package we purchased.

My husband and I walked down to the Casio( Near Metro/711) to find the nearest agent, then we were questioned if we had a MBS rewards card. The agent reluctantly proceeded to print a card and then instruct us to find a silver kiosk for vouchers. We spent approx. 1 hour with this process.

We returned to the desk to speak with a manager about the inefficient, cumbersome process  of redeeming the package purchased. She walked us to the nearest un user friendly kiosk to help us print vouchers ( We desired early am breakfast and did not want to run around the hotel early morning to redeem).

In addition, the room electronics were nice but too much. Motion light sensors continuously came on during the night while moving in bed. The power to the electric toilet went out (2nd day) and there was no manual flush. I had to take 30 flights down to the lobby restroom , so I did not embarrass anyone while maintenance worked on the toilet electronics.
In addition, we had reservations at one of the restaurants on 57th floor and if you get off on the wrong side of the elevators be prepared to deal with the pool police not allowing you to walk across without room key in hand. The staff was not useful in directing us to the restaurant location.

The last day on check out ,we were bringing our luggage to the lobby and was a approached by Mr. Jeevan Rao, Manager, Service Management., he was the true angel that redeemed a frustrating stay for us. I explained our disappointing experience while we were checking luggage for hold and he immediately whisk us to the VIP lounge. Mr. Rao was so kind, polite and exemplified the upmost professionalism in customer service.
We were gifted lunch in the VIP section of Rise Restaurant, where we met Mr. Daniel Whitelaw , General Manager Rise Restaurant such an amazing personality and a truly kind person. He made sure we were comfortable, our needs were met during our lunch. We were truly  grateful to have met such an exceptional team that cared about our experience.

***** 5 stars to Sara, Mr. J. Rao,  Mr. Daniel Whitelaw ,Concierge desk for exceptional service!

***     3 stars for Marina Bay Sands for inconsiderate policies ,process and operations.

review_text: You would think for a 5 star hotel, customer service would be impeccable, but I am saddened to report otherwise. After a long vacation in Indonesia, I was excited to kick my feet up and relax in this gorgeous hotel. Check in went smoothly, and I was greeted by a luxurious room and bathroom. For almost $1,000 USD a night, all I wanted was some peace and quiet. This was not the case. Hotel staff barged into my room not once, but TWICE, both times I was undressed and yelling at the top of my lungs to please wait as I collected myself. The first was partially my fault as I had slept through the alarm to go downstairs and extend my stay, however after YELLING repeatedly to wait, they still came in. The second time, the front desk made no attempt to communicate with housekeeping that I had indeed extended it. Come to find out, the front desk thought I wanted to change my key card (?) even though I handed over my passport and credit card and said I am paying for the room extension. As a female traveling alone, with past trauma with men, this was NOT the experience I wanted. I am deeply upset. I spoke to the manager, Atlan, who offered me a complimentary breakfast and taxi to apologize for the event, and we later settled for $150 Singapore dollars ($109 USD) in credit towards the room fare. It is a bit disappointing to know that the traumatic event and violation was only worth that much in his eyes. My room service server, Balan, was very kind and helpful, along with the bell hops I had the pleasure of meeting. Do not get me wrong, the hotel is exquisite, however, I will not be coming back again.

review_text:
So…if your reading this your probably trying to find a reason (or a bad review) for “not” spending the money and staying here. Well I’ll tell you this, you won’t. In fact, that’s probably the only reason why you wouldn’t wanna stay here.

Was it expensive? No, it was outrageously expensive. Lol. But I have to say it was worth the stay though. You sure get what you pay for and this place is a testament to that saying.

From the moment we arrived, my wife and I were greeted like first class. We arrived in a taxi and there were two hotel greeters that opened our doors. They took our bags and told us that it’ll be waiting for us in the room.

Everyone (hotel workers) was super nice and respectful. Your definitely treated like kings and queens here. This place is more of like a resort. There’s soo much to do and see. From casinos, to shopping, the gardens by the bay, night clubs, and the fine dining. Did I also mention the infinity pool? Yes, we to paid to stay here for the infinity pool like most people do.

Overall, if your going to travel to Singapore and wanna get the full “Singapore” experience then I encourage that you do stay at least one or two nights at the Marina Bag Sands. You don’t come here often and maybe once in a lifetime, so I do recommend staying here. Besides the wonderful food Singapore has to offer, this was the nightlight of our vacation.

Shoutout to the front desk person who helped us checked in, Caine! Super friendly and knowledgeable. He gave us a bunch of advice, tips, and things to do during our stay. He even was able to find us a room for early check in. Thanks Caine!
