review_text:
Booked for 3D2N for my partner’s birthday. Really loved the check in and pool reservation booking system which was easy and seamless! As we were waiting at the lobby for our Queue number to be called, a FO staff asked for our Queue number and informed us there were 2 more guests ahead of us.

Our check in staff was Alice. Her service was excellent! As she processed our booking, she noticed the date and it was my partner’s birthday which I didn’t mention upon reservation. Alice wished him Happy Birthday and upgraded us from Premier Garden view to Premier Harbour view and explained it’s on the higher floor. She also extended our check out time from 11am to 1pm which we did not have to ask. She explained the hotel’s facilities really well and also informed us a complimentary birthday cake will be sent to our room. We checked in at 2.35pm.

Our room was on 44th floor, it was big, clean and has a really breathtaking view. We went out for dinner and when we came back, there was a birthday cake on the table. Huang Xiu was the Housekeeping staff in charge for our room. On day 2, he rang our bell at about 3-4pm and spoke in mandarin which I had difficulty understanding. He pointed at the “Make Up Room” button which I told him he doesn’t need to make up the room. We went out for dinner, came back and the room was made up. Huang Xiu had replenished the towels, amenities & bar items. What I appreciate was, he placed the new bath mat at the exact spot I placed the used one.

The infinity pool was obviously beyond amazing. Booking for the time slots was easy and so was cancelling a slot which we did due to heavy rain. The staff at the infinity pool were all so friendly. My partner asked the Lifeguard which way is the washroom. The lifeguard, got down from his seat just to tell him the way.

I would also like to add that we went to Ce La Vi and each staff from the first floor, the counter and the waitress & waitresses that served our drinks were great! Also, Muhammad Fitri had been really helpful during our stay and also called the room to wish my partner a Happy Birthday.

Overall, MBS was a fantastic experience for us and for my partner’s birthday and each of the staff we met along way even if it was a small gesture, can be felt with warmth and sincerity.

review_text:
I was very disappointed with my stay at MBS as I was awoken multiple times through the night by a guest having a party in the room next door to me. I had to engage with the hotel reception and despite them calling security to the room they were unable to stop the issue for 3 hours. This ruined my stay and the only compensation I was offered was an upgrade next time I stay. I feel that a more appropriate gesture would have been to refund a quarter of the cost of my stay. I engaged with the customer service team but they have not responded to my requests for appropriate compensation. Given the cost of staying at MBS I have high expectations regarding customer service and based on my experience these were not met.

I would not recommend staying at MBS.

review_text: This iconic hotel is very near to airport, approx 15 mins by Taxi, so great location to explore city.  Lots of communal areas with shops and a Casino, plus a SkyPark (aka SkyDeck), but we found these and the lobby areas nearly always crowded, with hardly anywhere to sit, so if you are looking for a 5 star hotel with relaxing, quite public areas this one is not recommended. Had to queue for check-in and no welcome drink but room was comfortable (nothing special, more like 4 Star) and spacious, but on sixth floor, opposite the highway, so if you book this floor be prepared for some background road noise. AC a little noisy, but kept room cool. House-keeping excellent and kept room spotless. Room Key-cards can be temperamental so keep away from your mobile phone in pocket or handbag, unless you enjoy 20 min excursions to lobby with inevitable queues to recharge. Huge infinity pools (x3) with amazing views of city below and beyond, best one on 57th floor. Pools are open from 6am till 11pm, however be aware that they are not heated and can get very crowded during peak times when “selfie” mania takes over. Also not that it can take a few lift changes to get to them depending on where your room is. The Skypark is great fun, providing a great panoramic view of the city, especially at night. Highly recommend the morning Yoga class just for the fantastic vista. Note that SkyPark is open to public too, not just Hotel guests. If you don’t mind bustling crowds, location, city views and infinity pools are indeed 5 Star, else for service, room and value we’d rate more like 4 Star.

review_text:
This is a high end retail mall offering a mind blowing shopping experience to shoppers. Shoppers can choose anything from a simple supermarket to high end branded products in this mall.
There is pretty much everything and anything here. There are a lot of high end restaurants here too and they have Michelin starred restaurants in this mall too.
Outside of the mall, there is also a light show at stipulated timings and this attracts a huge crowd of tourists.
Families can also opt to bring their children to the nearby ArtScience museum for the Future World exhibition. There is also a schedule of musicals/performances in the ever popular MasterCard theatre.
One thing to note of this mall, as there is a huge crowd of shopper flow, the taxi stand may sometimes have a long wait. In addition the toilets may not be of clean standards as it is not possible for the cleaning attendants to keep up their cleaning as the place has too many patrons. Toilet paper may be lacking too due to the same reason.

review_text:
I spend my life on hotels and wanted to do MBS once before leaving Singapore.  A must do they say...
I couldn't be more disappointed by the service and how they handle the situation. They constantly check on you to stay away from people but... have nothing in place to speed up the check in process (other hotels in town will have automated kiosks, roaming staff or online check in to speed it up).
We queued literally for 1 hour to check in. Process was soooo tedious... unbelievable for a property of this size. Staff are obviously not trained.
This was for our honeymoon as a gift from friends and despite their request early in advance, nothing was done. Not a card, not the slightest attention. Such a disappointment for a hotel of that so called 5 star level.
Not only this is overrated but they haven't figured out how to handle the situation at all. For a place of that size and all the PR they do... needless to say that we were expecting something at least decent.
Hours of wait to get to the pool, with not even control on it so we are not even sure we will be allowed up at any point of our stay. Price is not down but stay hours are reduced (check in 3 pm and out by 11 am...).
Rooms are dated but decent.
View is spectacular from either side, that's the only star I can give...
Stay away everyone... other places will give you a way better value.

review_text:
A giant retail space at Marina Bay Sands. Spacious and airy, with wide walkways and exquisite architecture both inside and outside. It takes more than 15 minutes to walk from one end to another end walking at a leisurely pace.

Several celebrity restaurants anchor the levels and those are one of the main draws of this place. Of course kids will love the waterway that traverses into the heart of the building.

Being a massive space, one can easily loses the orientation if you are here searching for a specific commercial outlet because the unit numbers are very inconspicuous while the signboards are practically unhelpful to those who are new to the place.

review_text:
We stayed here for 2 nights in early November 2020 to celebrate a family member's birthday.

As safe distancing measures were still in effect, there were procedures which you need to note:
a) you need to book your slot to enter roof top pool. To avoid disappointment, it is advisable to book ahead of your stay. I emailed the hotel to obtain the booking details and booked weeks before check in. The view is fantastic so don't miss it.
b) you also need to book a slot to exercise @ the gym via sms. The difference between booking the pool and the gym is that there are pre-defined slots to go to the pool while it is go when it is your turn for the gym.The view @ the gym is fantastic too so don't miss it.
c) entry to and out to the lifts to go back to your room is screened
d) it is good to book dining venues too, particularly popular restaurants like Ce La Vi.

As for the room, we found the offerings dated, particularly the TV entertainment. Perhaps they could offer Netfix programme. The room is otherwise spacious and comfortable. Our rooms face Gardens by the bay and this side is where you can veiw sunrise. A complimentary birthday was sent to our room too on request.

review_text: Unbelievable service for our short stay at MBS. Our flight to Singapore arrived at 6am.  We were hoping for a early checkin. Faith at the Tower 1 check in desk provided outstanding service. Although they did not have a room ready for us, Faith set us with temp key cards so we could freshen up in the fitness center and use the pool. That was very welcome after our red eye flight in. We were told we would get a call when our room was ready so we chilled at the pool and hot tub taking advantage of the awesome views. Never received a call so we came back at normal check in time, 3pm to get our room. The front desk said the room had been available since this morning which was a bit disappointing. Anyways, our luggage was already delivered to the room.  When I checked my email, MBS sent a mid stay survey. Thinking nothing of it, I filled out the survey and mentioned I was disappointed in not getting a call and this is where their service shined. Within a few minutes of submitting the survey, I got a call Nicole in Service Management. This has never happened. She wanted to know more so they could improve and how she could make it up to us. I declined her offer and told her I just wanted to provide constructive feedback. She insisted on making our stay memorable and indeed she did. She sent us a bottle of champagne, provided us with a 1pm late check out and arranged a car for us to go to the airport. I even mentioned I was planning on pushing back our dinner reservation at Rise and she took care of that for us. Nicole did help us realize that although I never got a call, I was sent an email about the room being ready that went to my junk. Good thing she didn’t hold it against me. Pro tip: Don’t forget to check your junk mail.Thank you to Nicole, Faith, and the entire staff at MBS. Your dedication to service makes you stand out. You will be at the top of my list anytime I’m in Singapore.

review_text:
Absolute Vegas vibes gigantic shopping mall with all the luxury brands under one roof and countless eateries for different budget.

A place one could come back over and over whether to shop or just to soak in the atmosphere.

Visit one of the most iconic maison of Louis Vuitton on water, or the only Apple store in the world with an escalator.

You could also catch one of the many events happening all the time or take a walk outside.

Crowds are crazy from Fridays to weekends, a great sign of booming economy.

Dining tips : either make bookings way in advance for higher end dining or choose one which doesn’t take reservations and join the queues.

Ippudo is a great option next to the more expensive foodcourt in Sg.

For a great view of the rain occulus action, do Beanstro for a drink at appropriate times namely 3:30pm 8pm & 9:30pm.

review_text:
Great experience overall! Room is immaculate, housekeeping is speedy, food is great (Please try the breakfast potateos at SPAGO!) but 2 negatives.

Parking situation at MBS was horrible (15/12,). It was frustrating and I was late for check in at 2.30pm by about 30 mins. I approached a short hair Filipino service staff at the hotel for help with check in but was told the next check in time will be at 5pm and I will be the last in line for that time slot and she was "sorry" she can't do anything about it! That is an additional 2 hours wait with my luggage and I have Gardens by the bay booking at 4.30pm! I had hope to freshen up before I visit GBTB! She advised us to leave our luggage and "have some coffee" for 2 hours. I know I am late for check in with very good reason but to make me wait for a further 2 hours and give some ridiculous advise of coffee for 2 hours just to check in? I am in the service line for 20 years and I did not sense any hallmarks of quality service from her, she has failed to understand my problem from my POV and stuck to the rules of check in timing to the letter. No empathy at all This is just a staff drawing salary and giving lip service to MBS guest. Why bother to be in "customer service" industry when a robot running on smart contract can do the same exact job? Why station a human at the check in area if you can't solve a guest problem with a human approach?

I did not make a big fuss and cooled off for 5 mins at the side before I approached another tall bald Indian service staff. I explained myself like I did to the Filipino staff and he helped me to a physical queue for check in. He understood my pain and took immediate action that cost nothing to MBS to solve my problem. The room was already ready and it ONLY took 5 mins for the counter staff to check us in. This fact pisses me off even further with the short hair Filipino staff. It is comforting and good to know that there are some staff at MBS that understood customer service and they will always have my thanks and appreciation. But not to those that just pay lip service to "quality service".

Second would be the Infinity pool booking. I understand it is peak period with the holidays but the booking system is flawed. I stayed there for 3D2N and failed to book a 2nd slot for the 2nd day at check in. I refreshed the booking at every chance I get but did not see any slots opening up. My concern is, there isn't any penalty with no show and that is fine (its okay there shouldnt be a penalty for no show) but the empty slots that are no show could be better used for walk ins. If I walk in and get rejected because it is full, its fine but if the pool is not full and I get rejected as a walk in for my entitled booking, that isn't right.

review_text: Had a one night staycation. We need to book online the infinity pool slot after we booked the room which I didn’t do it. One week before our stay I could booked the pool online as all slots are unavailable. On thé day when I checked in, I told the manager I was upset that I couldn’t visit the pool. Jessica was very helpful. She asked to give her some time and see what she could do. She managed to get a time slot for 3 persons in the pool. I was very thankful to her. Really appreciate her help. We got a free upgrade to deluxe king room facing the garden on the 49th floor. The room is big with an awesome balcony view. When I booked the hotel, i wrote in comment that it was my wedding anniversary. We got complimentary lovely chocolate cake and a coffee cup made of chocolate. So wonderful. There were so much things to do. We need to book a slot for the gym, a slot sauna/hot tub for female and free access to the sky park observation deck. We also had a good dinner at Spargo. Origin + Bloom has fantastic sandwiches n breakfast options where hotel guests got 20% discount. I recommend Early Riser bun. Overall, it’s a marvellous stay here.

review_text:
Travelled to visit Marina Bay Sands from the United States on Dec 28th, 2022.

On December 22nd, 2022, I contacted Marina Bay Sands hoping to plan surprise proposal to my girlfriend on the Sky Observatory deck. No other piece of modern architecture is more iconic than MBS in Southeast Asia and I had my eyes set.

In just the few days before the Christmas holiday, Nicole was offered to connect with my 3rd party photographer and help coordinate the proposal as if I asked my best friend one favor in my lifetime. She is an amazing human and I can tell why MBS is lucky to have her be the face of their iconic brand.

Nicole granted permission for my photographer to be at the Sky Observatory Deck for the special moment when I popped the question. She even kept in communication with my photographer on a 2 hour photoshoot to surprise us with a generous gift with chilled champagne and truffle chocolates in our room when we returned.

The property itself is fantastic - from the intimate infinity pools, to the world-class architecture in the casino, to the immense amount of beautiful shops in the mall. Oh, and we cannot forget the delicious food at the food courts.

The experience at the property was far superior than the hundreds (yes hundreds) of times that I've visited in Las Vegas. But, it was truly the delicately care that Nicole selflessly provided that truly meant more than anything.
review_translated:
Travelled to visit Marina Bay Sands from the United States on Dec 28th, 2022.

On December 22nd, 2022, I contacted Marina Bay Sands hoping to plan surprise proposal to my girlfriend on the Sky Observatory deck. No other piece of modern architecture is more iconic than MBS in Southeast Asia and I had my eyes set.

In just the few days before the Christmas holiday, Nicole was offered to connect with my 3rd party photographer and help coordinate the proposal as if I asked my best friend one favor in my lifetime. She is an amazing human and I can tell why MBS is lucky to have her be the face of their iconic brand.

Nicole granted permission for my photographer to be at the Sky Observatory Deck for the special moment when I popped the question. She even kept in communication with my photographer on a 2 hour photoshoot to surprise us with a generous gift with chilled champagne and truffle chocolates in our room when we returned.

The property itself is fantastic - from the intimate infinity pools, to the world-class architecture in the casino, to the immense amount of beautiful shops in the mall. Oh, and we cannot forget the delicious food at the food courts.

The experience at the property was far superior than the hundreds (yes hundreds) of times that I've visited in Las Vegas. But, it was truly the delicately care that Nicole selflessly provided that truly meant more than anything.

1) Member who bring all ID cards(including passport & Casino VIP card if I remember correctly) except for a Long term social visit pass which they insisted must be sighted before allowing my father who was then seriously ill to ONLY make a brief visit to motivate himself a bit. Really upset with the STRICTLY NO EXCEPTION rule even after I explained to them the purpose of visit. Though it had happened a number of years back, this experience unfortunately left a very deep but negative impression in my mind.

2) The casino could not offer much help to a non-gambling person (that's me) who needed help to look for her mother whose whereabout in the casino became a question mark. I could do nothing but to wait outside the exit area. This occurred last month (29th April 2023)

review_text:
My stay here with my mother was amazing! We stay cay-ed for 2 days 1 night and their service was top notch! Our commendations to Reshmi at the counter, Dan at the pool and all the staff who served us the day we were there! They really did observe covid restrictions very strictly and made sure we were all safe!

Got upgraded to a room on the 50th floor as our room wasnt ready and got the best view!

We got a few perks the day we were there - one complimentary exhibition at the Arts Science Museum (plastics exhibition only) and we also got to go up to the skypark for free (just show your hotel card)

Be sure to make full use of these perks (and more!)when youre staying there!

Some cons were that the room we were in did not have a bath tub and there was no bidet in the toilet. But if one was really particular about that, you can request for a room with these items.

But the view totally made up for it!

Would definitely go again if there were another deal! 10/10 experience :)

Sign up for Marina Bay Sands Lifestyle membership so you can get discounted tickets for the attractions.

review_text:
A very high end shopping center that houses the Marina Bay Sands Casino and within walking distance from the hotel, Gardens by the Bay and the Bayfront MRT station.

Spacious and comfortable to visit, though most of the shops here are high end and branded shops catering mostly to more well-to-do tourists. There's a great view of the marina bay area outside and most of Singapore's central attractions are nearby.

There is also an Art Science Museum just be the Helix Bridge. Do also stay tune at night where there's a light show outside. You can also take a boat ride too in the shopping area for a fee.

Quite enjoy the ambiance of the place even though most of the shops are well outside of my spending range.

Amazing views, and it isn’t that crowded like what people say.
There is a total of 3 large pool combined together with a lot of beach seats so do not worry about not finding a spot.
At the top, besides the infinity pool there is also 2 bars. Spago (more for food) and Ce La Vi which is a popular bar for people looking for drinks.

review_text:
One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in Singapore. Decided to do a staycation/honeymoon during the Covid-19 period where there’s lesser crowd now at MBS. No regrets, we booked a premiere city view room. From booking, check-in to entire 2 night stay was superb. The front counter service was responsive to our requests and all their towels are well sanitized.

Their amenities are great too, should definitely try all of them (Infinity pool, banyan tree fitness gym with all new & clean equipment, hot sauna, observatory deck). It was a memorable experience that I decided to book a night for my parents anniversary too!

review_text: The hotel grounds and views clearly offer some options that are hard to find elsewhere..  however there are some issues which detract from the experience.. for some reason the room consistently smells humid.. there's a lack of mechanical ventilation.. the beds are not as comfortable as other 5 star hotels, most of the time room service is not available as waiting time is 1hr+ , the schedule for Spago and pool service is too restrictive (why is not possible to have lunch or order something before noon.. or after 7pm??).. but surely the most annoying feature is the keys that stop working.. particularly after 5pm when they close the reception at tower 3 and you have to walk all the way to tower 1 on a wet swimsuit.. so yeah it's a nice hotel and the pool in the evening is nice but considering the price I was expecting 1. More entertainment 2. More flexibility and 3. No technical issues.

review_text: I had the most luxurious staycation experience at Marina Bay Sands in Singapore. The hotel boasts stunning views of the city skyline, including the iconic Marina Bay Sands infinity pool on the 57th floor, which is one of the most famous rooftop swimming pools in the world. I enjoyed a variety of dining options, from casual eateries to fine dining restaurants, as well as a shopping mall with designer boutiques and a casino. The hotel also has a full-service spa and fitness center, and I took advantage of the nearby attractions such as Gardens by the Bay and the ArtScience Museum. With all of these features and amenities, my staycation at Marina Bay Sands was truly unforgettable.

I enjoyed a variety of dining options, from casual eateries to fine dining restaurants, as well as a shopping mall with designer boutiques and a casino. The hotel also has a full-service spa and fitness center, and I took advantage of the nearby attractions such as Gardens by the Bay and the ArtScience Museum. With all of these features and amenities, my staycation at Marina Bay Sands was truly unforgettable.

review_text:
Took our money then asked everyone to leave because of incoming thunderstorm. Security perspective aside, they cashed in on visitors to the very last minute, which meant some would only have 10 minutes on the deck. For those that insisted, ticket validity was extended for 2 weeks, but as we were just visiting for 3 days, it was a empty gesture.

I asked if it could be extended for 6 months, which was of course denied. It may come across as a silly request, but hey, you gotta try and there’d actually be a chance we’d come back in that timeframe (and my 4 year old son loved the view).

Total racket…

Security perspective aside, they cashed in on visitors to the very last minute, which meant some would only have 10 minutes on the deck. I asked if it could be extended for 6 months, which was of course denied. It may come across as a silly request, but hey, you gotta try and there’d actually be a chance we’d come back in that timeframe (and my 4 year old son loved the view).

Total racket…

review_text:
The check-in was a breeze, in fact, was served ice-cream while waiting, the check-in staff "MARK" was his name, was very courteous, cater to all my request and provides excellent experience.
We got the high floor and the view is FANTASTIC! Bay view you get to see musical fountain in the evening, and beautiful city night view. Sea view makes you feel like you're staying by the seaside.
The room is HUGE for singapore size, as big as the RWSentosa Equarius hotel, and Nespresso coffee machine was provided, fully stocked fridge and a sofa for relaxing and enjoying the large window view.
The best part of the hotel is the swimming, first time I use the pool 4 times in 2 days, mainly to dip and enjoying the view towards the city.
Had lunch at LAVO restaurants, don't miss the Truffle Fries and Margherita pizza, and parmigiano sandwhich.
Everyone who ever visited singapore should at least stay here for a day even at high price for the experience.

Tips : Ask for high floor, choose sea view if you want serenity and bayview if you want city skyline. Must not miss the swimming pool, and try the restaurant LAVO, not overly expensive compare to other restaurants nearby

review_text:
Considering this is a 5 star hotel I am extremely disppointed in the appointment of the rooms and house keeping service of the hotel. Granted I had a huge corner room with a wonderful view which was nice but that's where it ends. The finishing was basic and not in the least luxurious. The bed was OK but the bedding lacked the plushness that I would expect from a hotel of this calibre. In particular the duvet felt thin and old.

I truly appreciate that all towels were individually shrink wrapped, probably because of covid right now but it would appear that they have eschewed fabric softener. The towels were old and frankly the roughest I've used in a 5 star hotel.

Sadly the housekeeping was also sadly lacking. The mini bar and snacks were to have been replenished daily. Although the bar was replenished the snacks were not and we had to ask for it. What really surprised me though was the housekeeping staff entered the room without knocking while we were in the room. Used their master key and came right in to bring us our snacks.

MBS you need to up your game.

review_text:
Lots of high end shops here. Tourist trap basically. Food court I made piss poor decisions. I got the curry closest to the left as you walk toward it. The taste was a mixture of conflicting spices that made the sauce not so rich and delicious but rather thin, over powering with a bitter/tannin after taste on the tongue. Personally love dipping and would say I have a generally accepting palate for curry and can respect any decent butter chicken, Tika Masala, gram masala etc, but this place was bad. What got me was their fresh cooked tandoori Naan. The Naan was decent, but the butter chicken was just awful. Went to the Ramen joint across the way... poor decision.  It said #1 Ramen in the world... what is wrong with me? Too trusting I guess. Ramen was nothing to write home about. The crispy corn was basically ribbed corn on the cob fried with tapioca or corn starch powder. Lacked flavor. Got seaweed fried for my kiddo, unsalted not crispy... enough said.
Besides my poor food choices, the place was interesting to walk around. The casino is in there if that's a vice u like. All in all, it's like a urban hiking trip. Fun to window shop but you should really hit the hawker center for food. Satay stalls open at 0530pm~ Don't forget to go outside and take pics~

Peace,

~iWill

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is a standout destination in Singapore:

• The iconic hotel towers offer luxurious rooms with breathtaking city skyline views, a perfect blend of comfort and spectacle.
• The SkyPark, perched atop the towers, is a remarkable feat of engineering, offering panoramic views, an awe-inspiring infinity pool, and top-notch dining options.
• The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is a shopping haven, home to high-end boutiques and designer brands such as Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and Prada.
• The nightly light show outside in the bay is a dazzling spectacle, illuminating the night sky with a stunning array of colors.
• ArtScience Museum, situated within the complex, fascinates with its lotus-like design and an innovative mix of art and science exhibits.
• Sands Theatre hosts a variety of performances, from Broadway musicals to renowned concerts.

Marina Bay Sands is truly an architectural marvel offering a world of luxury, entertainment, and unforgettable experiences - the epitome of Singapore’s vibrant spirit!

review_text:
Policy and service was really bad, felt like I was going on a staycation at a prison instead. There were staffs stationed at every lift lobby to check our identity before entering, even had to announce our room number when we're exiting the lobby. What's worse is that the staffs infront of the lift lobbies just hate their job. Was told that visitors won't be allowed to enter the hotel after 10pm. My visitor arrived at the lift lobby at 9.50pm and was told "visitors not allowed to enter after 9.45pm." and the staff immediately looked away after he finished the sentence. So is brushing someone off the kind of service MBS staffs are taught to provide? I went on to explain that I was told (during registration) that visitors will only be disallowed to enter AFTER 10pm, not 9.45pm, and was told to proceed opposite to use a telephone to speak to the "front desk". After which, the operator on the phone told me to proceed to Tower 1 to speak to the staffs at the front desk. So they're basically just asking us to walk back and forth. When I went to the front desk to explain the situation, the staff was polite (thankfully), and apologised for the miscommunication. She then told me that the only thing I can do is to pay $117 add a guest so that there's no restrictions, which I went on to pay the amount given. Afterwhich, I proceeded to bring my guest back to Tower 3 lift lobby, which we were allowed entry this time. However, I heard the staff (which rejected our entry previously) asking his colleague in Bahasa "Can meh?" or something similar. This kind of service is what you'll be getting in MBS.

Oh and not to mention that you're only given 6x 500ml of water per day, and when you request for more, it's $5 per bottle.

review_text:
I cant contain my excitement to experience Marina Bay Sands Hotel staycation. This establishment is now one of the representation of Singapore and you can find here the magnificient one of a kind infinity pool.

I will share with you some important aspect which i experienced recently.

Room - upon entering the assigned room, you will feel instantly the relax ambience of the unit, maybe because its spacious and interior is well curated. What im impressed most is the curtain will automatically open for you to have a look of its view outside, this is depends whether you have a gardens by the bay or a city view but both sides i believed is amazing. The bed is comfortable definitely your
in to a good night sleep. The linen is fresh, T&B are squeky clean and you all have the things that you may need during your stay.

Staff : as this is a three tower building establishment, a lot of staffing that they need. However, i am so impressed with the staff on how they look after each guest with the request that you are making. There is no delay and a quick reponse coordination among to all department.   In addition to that, they make sure that you are well attended and request is being delivered. A big salute of their team.

Amenities - aside from the regular offering of this hotel, one of the main reasons why tourist or even local singaporean want to experience is the massive infinity pool. It is located on top of the tower, 57th floor to be exact. A truly magnificient view that will make your experience a remarkable one. While enjoying the pool, you will be amazed also with singapore skyline, the towering building, the names of the giant company, the orderly planning of its city. The view will give a peak or even an answer why this little dot is a truly example of a good governance.

If you really want a good staycation, i can highly recommend this property because they do offer most of what you need. From its infinity pool, a mall that most of international brands are present, experienced a hawker style to their makansutra food court which is open 24 hours, nearby tourist spots like garden by the bay, the merlion, esplanade among others, a light show at night, a cafe and restaurant, a casino, or even you want to have a quick run around the area is possible.

If we will tackle about the price, yes it is a bit pricey compare to its nearby hotels, but we need to take note that it is not only the hotel room that are covering, we are also paying a one of a kind experience that will surely remember by its guest.

Marina Bay Sands  perfected the expectation of its hotel guest from a family, group or even solo traveller. I can recommend this to everyone who wants to visit Singapore, a one for the book experience that will give you a story to tell for a lifetime.

With this i am giving this hotel establishment a score of 10 out 10. And i cant wait for my next staycation again 🙏

review_text:
This place is for the rich.
Everything is awesome here if you have money to blow for a romantic night out to woo a potential partner.
Other than that, everything is too expensive for peasants like us.

There's nothing much to do besides eating and sleeping on a staycation in the hotel besides going to the pool and the gym during this covid19 season. The control to go up is terrible because you're competing with 3 towers of people trying to go up to the pool - which is a must visit due to the awesome view.

They have an automated sms system where you sms this number and issue you a queue number to go up to the pool after 8am. No need to sms from 6 to 8am. But after 8am you have to get a queue number.

On our 1st day, we smsed at 1pm and only got a reply to go up at 10pm, same for the 2nd and 3rd day there even on a weekday. Not very enjoyable but the view is great!

review_text: This mall is very grand, and sprawling and is much more elaborate than usual shopping malls. It is styled after the high-style malls of Las Vegas and like, but along with that is that most of the shops are very high-end (Chanel, Gucci etc) and very tourist-oriented. There are no mid or low-end retail outlets (or very few) and also not that many casual Food and Beverage places like your usual Mr Bean. There is a food court on the end closer to the Art Science Museum and the chicken rice there is about 10 singapore dollars,  and still, very hard to find seats there during peak horus. The square footage is enormous (just like big US malls), and so you can walk very long if you want to go to just one specific shop.  This is a great place to bring visitors from out of town, you can split up and explore the mall for a few hours. The canal boat thing is so tourist and odd ,but i guess very good for photos. In the evening you can enjoy the light show right outside on the waterfront.  And don't forget, Gardens By The Bay is just next door.

review_text:
Here are my experiences staying at Marina Bay Sands Hotel Singapore with City View and Garden View. Booth has pros and cons.

Choose City View if you like:
-Beautiful sunset of Singapore Skyline, if the weather is good.
-Cosmopolitan atmosphere with high rise buildings, the city never sleeps. You can view Singapore CBD, and Marina Bay, including Singapore Merlion and The Esplanade.
-A Light and water show at Marina Bay Sands is back, so it is an excellent spot to view the show without squeezing into the crowd.

Choose Garden view if you like:
-To see the beauty of the sunrise.
-Sea view of Singapore straits, including Garden by the Bay, the light show at night time, and Batam Island from far far away.
-Fresh air because the room has a balcony, a good spot for a smoker, you can hang your wet clothes as well, and an excellent place to relax in the late afternoon or evening with the fresh air.

I wish you a Happy staycation!

Horrible hotel for what you pay. They nickel and dime you whenever they can(i guess, unless you are willing to lose tons of cash at the casino). Check in is unnecessarily long and the staff does not explain terms of stay properly. The welcome staff at Spago are just horrible. For that same money per night, there are a dozen more deserving and better run hotels in Singapore run by friendly staff who excel at their job of being in the hospitality sector (and deserving of accolades). MBS? No. Hell no.

Initially I thought that checking in would be an intimidating experience as Marina Bay Sands is regarded as one of the world renowned hotel and have a standard to meet, but was pleasantly surprised on how casual and smooth the checking process was.

The room was comfortable and the views were amazing in Tower 2. The only con I could think of is the lack of refrigerator as the one in the room was reserve for the snacks and drinks that they were selling and the fridge has a sensor to track which item was removed and will charge you automatically however that is easily solved by requesting for a personal fridge for a one time fee of $10 SGD

Overall I had an amazing stay and would visit again.

review_text:
Wow, where do I start. This might be a long one but it’s absolutely necessary!
My sister came to Singapore to visit me from Liverpool, UK and we stayed at Marina Bay Sands hotel while she was here.
Of course it is peoples job in hospitality be polite and professional however we came across some truly exceptional staff during our stay that I would love to mention.

Havis (pool)
The manager at the pool, ensured that we had all of our needs met and we’re completely happy while poolside.
He has very friendly and professional, ensuring that the guests are well looked after and maintaining a personal interaction. We really appreciated this.

Ridwan (pool)
Again, ensured my sister and I were taken care of and checked on us to ensure all was well. He was a really lovely person, and Havis and him made a great team.

Ryan, Fir, Brandon and Jenny (pool)
What an incredible team of people who take a genuine interest in their guests. They all offered to take pictures for us and didn’t rush us whatsoever. Their presence at the pool made sure that my sister and I felt comfortable and content the entire time we were guests on the roof.

Nelly (Spa)
I had a facial with Nelly and was blown away by the care and time taken. She truly knows her craft and the treatment pleasantly included a foot bath and mini head and shoulder massage.
Nelly made me feel completely at ease and it felt so luxurious the entire way through.
She also gave practical tips and advice on how to maintain my skincare following the treatment, not pushing to buy products as I have had before. This will remain one of my favourite facial treatments for a long time.

Mani (Bellhop/Porter)
What a genuinely lovely young man. Very accommodating, cheerful and professional. I enjoyed meeting him and he was a wonderful leaving impression of a beautiful establishment such as MBS!

review_text:
An amazing architectural structure that has become an icon of Singapore. Visiting the complex in person brings the sheer scale to reality and is very impressive.

From the upscale shopping mall, casino, Sky Park Observation Deck to the surrounding public areas, it is a fantastic place to explore. The boat rides available inside the mall are reminiscent of the gondolas at The Venetian in Las Vegas. The smaller version of the Changi Jewel is just as impressive to watch. And the nightly water show on the bay is more spectacular than the Bellagio's in Vegas.

If a visit to Marina Bay Sands isn't on your Singapore itinerary, you don't know what you're missing.

review_text:
World Class Service! Highly recommended for anyone who believes top service is imperative to an enjoyable stay. Some parts of the hotel may not be spanking new (eg balcony tiles), but we were beyond satisfied by the excellence in customer service during our stay - certainly reason enough to want to come back again! Whenever we called with any concern (bathroom, pool slot and belongings left behind), this was not only addressed professionally, but empathetically and most swiftly.

I must say, for a massive hotel, Marina Bay Sands Singapore really has surprised us with the impeccable standard of guest relations. They clearly have guest satisfaction at top priority and therefore understood inside out, leaving even the most discerning guest impressed and assured to have an enjoyable, memorable time.

Special thanks to Edmund who took our feedback seriously and went above and beyond to meet expectations, Peter who followed up diligently to find the best solution for us, Nicole who also saw to our extra request and the 3 polite housekeeping gentlemen who attended to us at night and in the day.

review_text: Beautiful view of course from the pool. Other than that, for the price you pay, you expect a good internet connection that you can have a decent WhatsApp call over, and TV that is working. The price we paid was exorbitant for a 5th floor room with no view, no bathtub, and 2 single beds, and a small lounge chair. Awkward going back and forth between the different elevators and keys that constantly had to be rekeyed. "Late" checkout was 12pm, and if you expect to be served upon as a luxury hotel once you get there, forget it. Expext to be treated as a number, and you'll be OK. But expect to be walking around grumpy thinking you could have had real service in a really nice room with a really nice view somewhere else in the city...

review_text:
Check-In : 21/2/2022, Mon
Chexk-Out: 23/2/2022, Wed
Room No.: 4089

This is our first time staying with Marina Bay Sands Singapore. We had a wonderful experience in these 3 days. Every staff members I encountered from the valets, bellmen, housekeepers, slot ambassadors to concierge ambassadors, they were performing excellent services and eager to help us out anytime. Our room was spacious and spotless with good garden view. We enjoyed a lot at the infinity pool, jacuzzi and skypark. Suggest the time of your jacuzzi sessions can be extended from 15min to 30 min.

Unfortunately, only one of your front desk receptionists was really made us speechless and fedup just upon the day we check-in.

We were served by counter 4 at about 2:30pm-2:45pm. We need to fill up a form for check-in purpose. I believe that she still a NEWBIE?

I was checking with my fiance if the name is written correctly, how dare she giving us a rude comment by asking,  "你男朋友的全名你也不知道啊？"

We were stunned and totally can't believe that we just received an insult gift from a FIVE stars hotel receptionist, just the first day we check-in.

Things were not getting better but getting worse instead.

My fiance mentioned to her that we were actually getting married tomorrow. No blessings received, another unexpected words came out from her mouth AGAIN. She looked at my finger and said I was not even wearing ANY RING. She told me that I should wear my ring so she can know that I AM ENGAGED.

Another rude comments from her mouth by saying, “Waaaa, your husband soon but you don't know his full name.“

This is how a FIVE stars hotel, Marina Bay Sands provided us an unforgettable first impression. =) Thanks to her. Management should train her more about MANNERS and COMMON SENSE before assign her to serve your valued guests. I believe that she was not well-trained enough.

⭐⭐⭐⭐
We will definitely be back for staycation but certaintly hope that we won't receive such rude comments to start off our day again.

review_text:
Got re-directed from Carpark South to loading/unloading bay carpark convention hall due to some event ongoing. This parking had a fixed rate of about $9. Enquired about using rewards card to redeem parking and one of the attendants told me it was the same as regular parking.

Upon redeeming points for parking, I was told at the barrier that I had to present the receipt instead of the card. Unfortunately, the receipt was with my sister and she had left earlier. I also had a picture of proof receipt. With no chance of redeeming the parking coupon, I was forced to pay about $9 of parking. They told me I could claim back $4 the next time I come or through email. Howevern that would mean in the end I would still be losing time and money to go through all the hassle when I redeemed a full amount of $27 for the parking.

It was unjust and unfair as there wasn't any notice to present receipt upon leaving as you could just redeem using the rewards card at the usual carpark south. It was due to poor communication from the management. To make it aware to customers using the carpark. If I had known, I would gladly have parked at the other carpark entrances.

Utterly disappointed as they could have helped me instead of leaving me with no option but to pay the full fee. Be warned if they redirect you elsewhere!!!

review_text:
Stayed at Tower 3 in mid Aug 2021.  Magnificent view and spacious (upgraded category) however it came with an outdated and old fashion interior design with a ventilation pillar in the middle (??).  The shower was always in rather hot temperature and it took at least 5 minutes to turn less hotter.

I was rather disappointed that a 5 star property does not provide a bathtub (??!!).  Went to the hot pool at Tower 2 and needed to transfer at L1, with the Covid19 checkin/checkout procedure in a bathrobe.  Was advised that only swimsuit is allowed in the hot pool as towel will contaminate the water but BYO swimsuit will not (!!??).

And somehow I could hardly sleep for 2 nights and decided to checkout at approx 6am on 3rd day.

I will not pay SGD400 to SGD500 for such a below average stay.

review_text:
I am extremely disappointed and shameless with my experience at Koma Marina Bay Sand.

About 1 month back, I made an appointment for January 12, 2023. Have introduced my contact from Australia and highly recommended him to try Japanese food at Koma.

He was wearing expensive designer sandals due to his leg injury on that day. When we reached Koma's entrance, a lady at the reception stopped and told us strictly that the dress code policy is "Gentlemen must wear closed shoes and long trousers" and "Ladies and gentlemen, don't wear flip flops.". She restricted us with two options on either buying a new pair of closed shoes for admission or just simply cancel the appointment off. We were utterly unbearable and impossible to communicate and negotiate with her in the absence of customer servicing at all.

Does the policy discriminate and not welcome people who wear sandals and with disabilities? If this is the standing, please properly state and spell out clearly within the policy that sandals are not strictly allowed. I can say that "Policy is fixed, but human mindset is alive". Should Koma staff don't change their mentality and remain inflexible, "customer service" can hardly be labelled. Unfortunately, I encounter such unpleasant experience at Koma.

We faced with entrance rejection flatly for Koma dining and left with no choice but visit another eatery - Bistro & Oyster Bar. Despite the fact that receptionist over there mentioned the dress code policy as well, they wholeheartedly understood, showed empathy and accepted my contact's medical disabilities without any trace of discrimination. I seriously in doubt on how well establishment and highly prestige Koma assumes and rates itself but nevertheless in my opinion, Bistro & Oyster Bar offers a much more professional customer service and provide appetizing food.

With such a terrible and awful experience, I will not recommend anyone and visit Koma again. I do sincerely hope that the Management of Marina Bay Sands can advise your Partners/Tenants to provide more professional flexible and customer services and allow customers to enjoy their good moments when shopping and dining at Marina Bay Sands.

review_text:
Spectacular views from L42 (Deluxe King Sky View).

The Hotel is an imposing and spectacular sight from many locations in Singapore and just as spectacular looking out from the Hotel rooms.

The Deluxe King Sky View Room is spacious, exceptionally well appointed, very clean and comfortable.

There is a bar fridge which is full of stock, leaving no room for storing your own items - be aware the bar fridge has electronic sensors and any item removed (even if you are just checking out the item), is charged to your room.

If you want a personal bar fridge for storing your own items, you can do so for $10; delivered to your room!

Included in the cost of the room is access to the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck and Infinity Pool, with the latter restricted to hotel guests only. Access is strictly enforced, so ensure you carry your access card at all times. Not sure about access to the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck, but access to the Infinity Pool ceases immediately upon check-out.

The  Sands SkyPark Observation Deck is open to the public and entry is approximately S$23 for adults and S$12 for children.

Spectacular views from L42 (Deluxe King Sky View).

The Hotel is an imposing and spectacular sight from many locations in Singapore and just as spectacular looking out from the Hotel rooms.

The Deluxe King Sky View Room is spacious, exceptionally well appointed, very clean and comfortable.

There is a bar fridge which is full of stock, leaving no room for storing your own items - be aware the bar fridge has electronic sensors and any item removed (even if you are just checking out the item), is charged to your room.

If you want a personal bar fridge for storing your own items, you can do so for $10; delivered to your room!

Access is strictly enforced, so ensure you carry your access card at all times. review_text:
UPDATE: after a discussion we were offered an upgrade to the Orchid Suite for a good discount and from that moment on the whole experience turned around. The suite included the club facilities we wanted and granted us preferred slots for the pool as well. The extra costs were definitely worth it and the whole Marina Bay Sands experience was amazing. So my tip: book a suite to get the best service.
--------------------------------------
We are supposed to arrive tomorrow in Marina Bay Sands, but until now everything is going wrong. We booked a clubroom on the website in the beginning of August. Today I find out the system did not book us a clubroom. What I did: after selecting clubroom and then date, I selected the roomtype. Turns out these are not clubrooms because they are not available. But there wasn't any sign on the website that informed me I was not booking a website. When talking to reservations today I was not offered help, instead I was informed repeatedly (approx 15-20 times) the clubroom was not available anymore. I got that the first time. But I was not offered a solution. The problem created by the hotel's website was made my problem. Not the kind of customer service you expect from a 5 star hotel with high prices.
Then I read the email I received at 9.17 this morning about prebooking the pool and check-in time. By the time I filled out of the information like names, confirmation and pasport numbers, I received the available slots. I was flabbergasted. More than 24 hours before our arrival I was only to book 1 slot on Sunday for the pool: from 6.00-7.15 AM!!!! Are you kidding me? I hope the hotel will arrange a suitable solution. Fingers crossed. This is unacceptable for a 5 star hotel with price starting at 500 SGD per night.

review_text:
Check-in - 3/5: A bit of hiccup as we missed the queue. A chinese-speaking lady who's helping at the queue seemed to have communication issues - instead of showing hospitality and professionalism, she portrayed sarcasm. We are aware that we missed the queue but she had to keep reiterating it without giving us a solution initially. It's only after we asked whether we can get another queue number (solution came from us?) and she exclaimed rudely: "YES I WILL GIVE YOU AND I'M ARRANGING IT FOR YOU NOW!" She speaks English but had a thick Chinese accent. Eventually we gotten sort of a service recovery when we were ushered into the VIP Guests Services Lounge for checking in. Staff in there were nice.

Lobby services (concierge, bellboy, carpark valet etc) - 1/5: Ordered Grabfood but items went missing. 0 communications between departments and 0 hospitality given to my wife. The staff simply asked my wife to check on her own. A simple call or maybe thru walkie talkies can be really helpful no? Ended up making my wife ran (literally) from tower 1 to 3 and back to tower 1. Shouldn't all staff simply direct her to the concierge to assist?

Room service - 3/5: After finally retrieving our food, we called to request for cutleries but it didn't came until like 30 mins later. Had to call in twice to chase for it.

Pool - 5/5: Compliments to a staff at the pool gantry who's especially nice and friendly - forgotten his name sadly.
Gym - 5/5: View and equips were great.
If only we had more time for both of them.

Room itself was nice, neat and clean - 5/5 (city view tower 1)
Breakfast @ Spago was awesome. Had sumptuous choices and tasted great. Staff there were nice too - 5/5

review_text:
My husband and kids visited MBS today and took a ride on the sampan ride ($13 per person). It was a very enjoyable ride and both kids had a lot of fun.

As soon as they alighted, my 2 year old was handed a plastic photo snow globe with their pictures in it. Being a 2 year old, he obviously wanted to keep it despite us not wanting to purchase it. We ended up paying $30 for a piece of plastic with low resolution pictures in it.

What a dirty trick to sell souvenirs to tourists - through child manipulation. I encourage you to skip the sampan ride. If you absolutely must ride it, watch out for the scam artist that will slip a souvenir into the hands of your child so you’re manipulated to purchase it.

I will not be visiting this tourist trap again.

review_text:
Child fell at the stairs at the entrance of the pool and bleed profusely. None of the staff, not even the lifeguard who witnessed the bleeding took initiative to call for a first aid kit. Thank goodness my friend who is first aid trained shouted for the kit and did first aid treatment on her own. This is a clear indication that the staff were not prepared for emergency. Following this event, poor communication among staff surfaced. We were told to wait in the room and a car/taxi will be called for us to the hospital. It did not happened. 3 different staff came but none had context or had called for a taxi.
Child had a total of 10 stitches.
Following day, I requested to meet with Manager, service management who took in our feedback. The 1 star is given to the Manager, Max.

Expensive
Time consuming and lots and lots of walking between attractions, shopping and hotel room.

2 nights costed 1160$ (Booked under sensational staycation package)

3 PM checkin 11 am checkout - Very unfair timings.

Sky deck free multiple access.

Free membership sign up white card gets you Complimentary Sampan Riders, art museum, Future world, digital canvas. (All these attractions can also be purchased as well.)

- Book art guided tour to know more about marina sands. (Free for those who booked two nights)
- getting 3 months free membership gets you 2 free attraction tickets each month
- Downloading marina bay app is useful to navigate between different places and check on attraction timings, etc

No food provided.
No options nearby.
Little India in 30 minutes so that's a good option for food and shopping.

From pool Sunrise not possible to view
Sun set can.

You have to book pool before checkin.
Better to register all checkin details to save time.

- Request for early check in at 11 and check out at 1 pm. Subject to hotel approval and availability.
- Pool time is limited to one hour per day.

Bayfront MRT exit B is the nearest one for transport.

review_text:
When I need a stroll. Indoors. With air conditioning.  With interesting people watching. With an airy feeling. With deluxe super lux luxury stores! This is where I go. I often walk so much I get blisters on my feet and don't care. So much to see! Every big name fashion house, every sparkly bauble and watch store, celebrity chef eatery, yup. Tis all here. Do consider dressing up slightly when you visit. A tourist in a tube top and holey shorts plus dirty flipflops looks, feels, and (sorry) smells out of place here. This is where you go to get your glam on. Do it! Enjoy the experience, even if you buy nothing.
They also have a huge eating area on one of the lower levels, toy and clothing stores, and for families with kids, an astounding electronic whimsical sort of skate rink (no ice, your feet moving affects a design on the floor).
If you like architecture,  inside and out this place should be studied. It is truly a marvel. Love it for the openness, the designer shops, the modern fabulousness and especially for over the top nice, helpful and friendly concierge desks who will help you along the way.

review_text: A high end and very large shopping mall located on the waterfront in the heart of Singapore City. There is a large variety of high end shops ranging from Chanel, Dior, Gucci etc along with celebrity restaurants like Gordon Ramsay's Bread Street Kitchen. There is even a huge Casino and even a nightclub inside. It is a huge mall which will take you almost a day if you want to see everything. However, the prices are on the higher side..

review_text: Very premium mall attached to the MBS hotel and conference centre.  In addition to the premium shopping and restaurants, there's an indoor canal with manned gondolas, a casino (free entry for non-residents - bring your passport), an outdoor light and water show, and the adjacent bay with views of the Downtown skyline.  Combined with MBS this is a popular tourist attraction with plenty to do and see.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is a great way to experience Singapore’s bougie side. There is no need for reservations for the pool anymore, and the best time to go is sunset / sunrise for the photos. review_text:
Spacious air conditioned building, most stores inside opens until 10pm, where you can access:

1) Gardens by the Bay, Super tree groves
(at the center of the building, find the Chanel store, beside it are escalators with signs)

2) Spectra water and light show - in front of the mall, between the standalone apple store and the standalone louis vuitton store. Show at 8pm, 9pm, and 10pm.

3) Marina Bay Sands hotel and sky observation deck.

You can follow my travel tips on YouTube and IG @ iVuDang

review_text:
Had the opportunity to stay at MBS Tower 1 during Deepavali weekend. The Premier Sky View Room gives excellent view of Marina Skyline especially at night. Room is large able to accommodate a family of 4 easily. Infinity Pool offers great view, do note limited to 1hr per day for guests. Also pre-booking of timeslot to be done in advance to avoid disappointment.

Pro Tip : If you're celebrating a Birthday or Anniversary please inform Front Desk and they will send a complimentary cake upon check in.

review_text: Just returned from a fantastic event SSA 37th Gala Dinner held at Marina Bay Sands Grand Ballroom... I got a masterpiece advice in customer service... he advised that the bar was closed so if I fainted he would be happy to call an ambulance. Such a considerate human being.... way to go...

Hope MBS will relook this type of system and maybe follow others hotel standard how the booking works.

review_text: If you come to Singapore you have to take a look at Marina Bay Sands Casino. You can try your luck on one of the hundred gambling tables or at the slot machines. You can just come to have a stroll in it and enjoy free drinks (wide choice of soft drinks, and hot beverages). Strictly no pics in the casino. No dress code required. To enter and to exit you need to go through security check, so passport for tourists and ID for locals is required. Singaporean citizen needs to pay in order to enter the casino, whereas it is free entry for everybody else. The place developed in two floors and is divided into smoking area and no-smoking area. Stuff and funny robots carry beverages all around the casino.

review_text:
Had 4D3N staycation. Everything was good EXCEPT hiccups upon checkin with reward card updates! Really a bummer on arrival!!!!!

We had to go back and forth multiple times between Checkin-out counter and Rewards counter.
There is also a disconnect between room side and rewards side. Room side said we could claim Another 60bucks from 3rd night. But rewards side said it is not applicable.
Info given to guests should be consistent.

Upon checkout as well, card rewards point are not updated while we can see on apps. Checkout counter indian lady is so rude in the way she told us that there is no point in the card. Will we ask for points offset when there is zero?

Really unpleasant experience dealing with 2 set of people. Other than these 2sets of people, rest is pretty good.

We decided to ignore and didn't say anything but checkout experience made us lose our limit and write our unpleasant experience.

It is a shame that our experience is ruined by these 2 sets of people.

Bad bad experience. While checking in, we were informed by the staff at check in counter that it’s possible to pre-register a friend who’s visiting us on all 3 days of our stay. However, when our friend visited us on the 2nd day, he was denied access, as his name was not in the system and another staff at the check in counter informed us that “pre-registering of visitors is NOT ALLOWED”. In the end, we had to queue at the check in counter to register our friend every single day. While I understand that the restrictions put in place are to safeguard the hotel stayers, it’s absolutely disappointing to see the lack of SOPs from a five star hotel.

That aside, i called the express service in the morning to request for additional bottled water, as there were 3 adults staying but was told that additional charges apply. Totally unacceptable!

review_text:
Just few hours ago, got back from a enjoyable family trip at chirstmas event at garden by the bay.

Could not go back to my room with my wife n kid, cause i was registered as the visitor. Literally from a fantastic weekend turned a nightmare, got chased out of my hotel room.

The check in counter lady literately have the compassion and ego, to ask me come back the next day, leaving my wife and kid to stay at the room by themselves.

That just sums up my family staycation for the weekend, we just head home in the wee hours.

Verdict:
Get your infomation and registeration done right, if not will not recommend you staying. Not family centric nor have the compassion to consideration the customer circumstances.

Then again glad i took the bullet, will not recommend my customers or foreign guest to stay there.

It is very convenient that the hotel is linked to the mall and to the MTR. The infinity pool is amazing and the skydeck is a great place to go if you want to see the bird's eyeview of SG. Our room has a balcony which has an amazing view and where you can stay if you want to just relax and enjoy the view. What I like least about this hotel is that
no one cares to welcome and assist you as you enter the hotel. No assistance with our baggage as well. No shuttle service. The room is just normal and what I didn't like the most here is that they do not have toilet bidet.

review_text:
The Shoppes is the flagship shopping mall in Singapore’s epic Marina Bay Sands complex, which offers a host of luxury brands from across the world. Home to hundreds of shops, high-end restaurants, cafes, bars, and fun attractions, this Singapore mall unashamedly caters to the exclusive end of the market.

Notable fashion brands on sale at The Shoppes Singapore include Alexander McQueen, Armani, Dior, Hugo Boss, Bottega Veneta, as well as a range of premium jewellery and watch brands, from Bvlgari to Chopard. Even if you’re not a fan of trawling Singapore’s megamalls, it’s worth a look alone for its spectacular architecture and features.

Home to hundreds of shops, high-end restaurants, cafes, bars, and fun attractions, this Singapore mall unashamedly caters to the exclusive end of the market.

Notable fashion brands on sale at The Shoppes Singapore include Alexander McQueen, Armani, Dior, Hugo Boss, Bottega Veneta, as well as a range of premium jewellery and watch brands, from Bvlgari to Chopard. review_text:
This is a very high-end mall located in close proximity of the Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Quite a few high-end brands, such as Hermes, Louis Vuitton, are present here. The mall has a very high floor-to-floor distance, which gives it a very luxe feeling.

For dining options, there are food court (Rasapura Masters), and several famous restaurants (Black Tap, Din Tai Fung, Bread Street Kitchen).

At several timings, there are also a show on the river called Spectra. It is a 15-minutes light and sound show.

The mall is also linked to the Bayfront MRT which gives it a very easy access.

review_text:
If you're interested in abstract, towering architecture combined with an overwhelming number of restaurants and shops, Marina Bay Sands is the destination for you. If you have the chance, also head to the Sky Deck for views of Singapore.

The ship-like top level of the building connected by its three towers, are a sight to behold. It does leave you quite overwhelmed with the sheer size and scale of the complex. It's worth heading over to this location as a part of the Marina Bay area overall, but I found The Shoppes to be similar to any major mall and wouldn't spend any particular time here. Shopping enthusiasts of high-end and luxury labels will be spoilt for choice by what feels like an endless supply of shopping outlets and restaurants.

There are some great art installations dotted around the complex, including a fantastic interactive piece by teamLab, which responds to pressure points that visitors stand on (a favourite of young children).

Footpaths on the main road are nearly non-existent (aside from pedestrian areas) and requires using the shopping mall to get around the Marina Bay area. Pass through The Shoppes to get to the MRT station and surrounding attractions such as Gardens by the Bay and the ArtScience Museum.

review_text:
A high-end mall residing within an architecturally beautiful structure with Marina Bay, the Gardens by the Bay and the financial district as her backdrop depending on where you are.

Proper placement of signages are helpful in this huge retail heaven. There is a food court at one end (near to the ArtScience Museum), and also an indoor sampan (a beautifully crafted Chinese wooden boat) ride for a fee if you prefer to window shop while floating through the mall.

There is a nightly light show facing the Esplanade, giving shopper an opportunity to wind down after shopping. The evening breeze can be enjoyable as well despite Singapore's balmy weather.

The place is well connected to other places of interest like the Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and more shopping destinations on the other end of the Helix Bridge.

review_text:
Every time I visit Marina Bay Sands, it just never gets old. The whole place has that wow factor — from the architecture to the views to the atmosphere. Whether you’re here to dine, shop, relax, or just walk around and take in the sights, it really feels like you’re in the heart of Singapore.

I’ve been here a few times, sometimes just to chill with colleagues or bring visiting friends around. The vibe is classy but still welcoming. The views from the observation deck or even just around the promenade area are incredible, especially at night when the skyline lights up.

Even if you’re not staying at the hotel, there’s so much to explore — the Shoppes, the food court, the canal, and of course the light and water show outside. It’s one of those places you always end up coming back to, whether for the experience or to just enjoy the scenery.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon, alsoeet, and it was an unforgettable experience! The front desk staff, Simon and Jenny, were incredibly warm and welcoming. They gave us excellent service and were very thoughtful—they noticed it was my wife's birthday and that we were on our honeymoon, and even surprised us with a special honeymoon dessert!

The room was  spacious, spotless and very comfortable. Housekeeping did an amazing job every day, paying close attention to detail.

We were also lucky to catch Singapore’s 60th National Day fireworks during our stay. Watching the fireworks from the rooftop pool was one of the happiest and most unforgettable moments of our trip! Everything was perfect. This is truly a top-notch luxury resort.

review_text: We stayed at the MBS for 2 nights. It was an unforgettable experience: the rooms are very spacious and clean, with the beds being absolutely perfect. Of course, the infinity pool was the highlight for the whole family, but so were the light shows in the Garden and the Bay. The quick check-out was perfect since we had little time on the day of departure. Unfortunately, on the day of arrival, only one of the two booked rooms was ready, which is not ideal after a 14-hour flight when all you want to do is rest. But overall, the hotel is definitely worth the trip!

Let's inspire one another. 🌟
**Inspire one
🌟 "Not every dream fades when you wake up."**

Last night, I had a dream.

I was surrounded by warmth and wonders—a world where everything felt possible.

The most fascinating part? I was at Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Tower 3, on a high floor. Standing by the edge of infinity, I gazed at a horizon that seemed to stretch forever.

When I woke up, I realized something amazing.

The dream stayed with me.

It reminded me how moments of awe can bring clarity and spark new ideas. Our surroundings play such an important role in shaping our emotions, thoughts, and even our dreams. And sometimes, those dreams gently nudge us to aim higher, to explore further, and to truly embrace the wonder around us.

I woke up inspired.

And now, I’m curious:
Have you ever had a dream or experience so vivid it stayed with you, even after you woke up?

Let’s inspire one another. 🌟

review_text:
Got nothing to do during night in Singapore? Try marina bay!

It's a really really good place to enjoy the evening and experience the night life in Singapore. Take a walk around the marina bay and seeing all the crowds and lights are really hyping you up.
The skyline is also amazing here, you can spend the night just chilling watching the skyline or seeing what the crowds are up to, sometimes there's a performance from dance groups all over the city there.

One thing that you shouldn't miss is definitely the spektra light show. It's an amazing light show with water and laser projectors creating an amazing show that runs about 10-15 minutes. A perfect night with family or partner

review_text:
Didn’t get a chance to stay at Marina Bay Sands, but just seeing it from the outside was a stunning experience. The architecture is iconic and instantly recognizable — it truly dominates the Singapore skyline in the most elegant way.

The way the SkyPark spans across the three towers is incredible to see up close. At night, the building comes alive with beautiful lights and reflections on the bay. The surrounding area is also lively with great views, walkways, and photo spots.

Even without staying inside, it’s a landmark worth visiting — a must-see when in Singapore.

review_text:
From the moment you step into Marina Bay Sands, you’re wrapped in pure luxury. Every detail is meticulously thought out — from the grand lobby with its sweeping architecture to the impeccable service that anticipates your every need. The rooms are elegant and spacious, with breathtaking views of the city skyline or the bay, and the plush beds make it hard to leave.

The iconic infinity pool alone is worth the stay — floating at the top of the world with Singapore stretched out before you feels like a dream. The restaurants are world-class, offering everything from fine dining to global cuisines, all served with precision and flair.

Whether you're shopping in the high-end boutiques, relaxing at the spa, or simply soaking in the beauty of the design, Marina Bay Sands doesn’t miss a beat. It’s more than just a hotel — it’s an experience in flawless luxury and stunning attention to detail. Absolutely gorgeous from top to bottom.

review_text:
This is a review of MBS Hotel’s newly launched Aperitif Hour at 6 different restaurants based at MBS
————————————————————————-
In Jun 2025, MBS launched the Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ) at 6 restaurants based at MBS hotel and mall. This replaces the Evening Canapés ( which was available only at MBS hotel ).

The Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ), plus Breakfast ( 6.30am-10am ) and afternoon tea ( 3pm-5pm ) are made available FOC to guests staying in certain room types.

In the past 5 weeks, I have tried 5 of the restaurants that participated in the Aperitif Hour. Of the 5 restaurants, I tried 2 of them twice, because they are just so good.

My reviews, in descending order of ranking , are as follows :-

1.Bread Street Kitchen ( BSK )
———————————————-
I tried BSK twice over 5 weeks.
Of all the Aperitif Hour participating restaurants, this is the BEST ! 👍👍👍

Even though it was only 5pm, the restaurant has a busy and vibrant feel, with courteous staff attending to the needs of diners, who are happily chatting away. This is a happy place 😀😀😀.

Being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, the food is, of course, very good. I am very happy that they served their in-house focaccia bread ( with humus ) first, before the arrival of our main orders of Sunday Roast Yorkies, Mini Fish & Chips, and Wagyu Burger Sliders. The delicious focaccia and humus makes the wait for the main orders so much bearable 😜.

Even though it is supposed to be Aperitif Hour, the food BSK served is of such a good size that we skipped dinner thereafter.

The Wagyu Burger Sliders are so good, that we ordered it both times we are there. ( My dining companion thinks it can give Cut’s Wagyu Sliders a run for their money, but I have to, ahem, differ lah 😅 ).

Even though we did not order any alcoholic beverages ( it’s part of the package ), I note they have a wide selection for connoisseurs. The non-alcoholic Ginger De Pooh, and Belini Junior are refreshingly good.

I will return to BSK for Aperitif Hour or a main meal during my next stay at MBS. 😋😋😋

2.Wakuda
—————-
I also tried Wakuda twice over 5 weeks.

Wakuda has an understated and quiet elegance. At 5pm, it’s not crowded or busy ( unlike BSK ), and I think many diners may like Wakuda exactly for that.

Being a sister restaurant to Waku Ghin, its food is very good. I have dined there many times, so having Aperitif Hour at Wakuda allows me to have a different experience there.

I really like their Wagyu Cigar, which is yummy 😋. Their Karage Chicken is extra crispy and delicious .

Wakuda is a really good restaurant.
I will definitely return for a sumptuous dinner with close friends and family… soon.

3.Koma
————-
When I am served with the food , I am blown away by their presentation… it came on a mini version of their iconic bridge ( which is the backdrop of countless photos of many diners there ). What a nice touch. 👍

We had the Aperitif Hour at the Bar Lounge instead of the main dining area. The wagyu slider is very good but the portions are relatively small.

I look forward to return to Koma for a main meal again.

4.Yardbird
——————
The quality of the food is good, and the portions are big enough that I skipped dinner thereafter.
