review_translated:
This is a review of MBS Hotel’s newly launched Aperitif Hour at 6 different restaurants based at MBS
————————————————————————-
In Jun 2025, MBS launched the Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ) at 6 restaurants based at MBS hotel and mall. This replaces the Evening Canapés ( which was available only at MBS hotel ).

The Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ), plus Breakfast ( 6.30am-10am ) and afternoon tea ( 3pm-5pm ) are made available FOC to guests staying in certain room types.

In the past 5 weeks, I have tried 5 of the restaurants that participated in the Aperitif Hour. Of the 5 restaurants, I tried 2 of them twice, because they are just so good.

My reviews, in descending order of ranking , are as follows :-

1.Bread Street Kitchen ( BSK )
———————————————-
I tried BSK twice over 5 weeks.
Of all the Aperitif Hour participating restaurants, this is the BEST ! 👍👍👍

Even though it was only 5pm, the restaurant has a busy and vibrant feel, with courteous staff attending to the needs of diners, who are happily chatting away. This is a happy place 😀😀😀.

Being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, the food is, of course, very good. I am very happy that they served their in-house focaccia bread ( with humus ) first, before the arrival of our main orders of Sunday Roast Yorkies, Mini Fish & Chips, and Wagyu Burger Sliders. The delicious focaccia and humus makes the wait for the main orders so much bearable 😜.

Even though it is supposed to be Aperitif Hour, the food BSK served is of such a good size that we skipped dinner thereafter.

The Wagyu Burger Sliders are so good, that we ordered it both times we are there. ( My dining companion thinks it can give Cut’s Wagyu Sliders a run for their money, but I have to, ahem, differ lah 😅 ).

Even though we did not order any alcoholic beverages ( it’s part of the package ), I note they have a wide selection for connoisseurs. The non-alcoholic Ginger De Pooh, and Belini Junior are refreshingly good.

I will return to BSK for Aperitif Hour or a main meal during my next stay at MBS. 😋😋😋

2.Wakuda
—————-
I also tried Wakuda twice over 5 weeks.

Wakuda has an understated and quiet elegance. At 5pm, it’s not crowded or busy ( unlike BSK ), and I think many diners may like Wakuda exactly for that.

Being a sister restaurant to Waku Ghin, its food is very good. I have dined there many times, so having Aperitif Hour at Wakuda allows me to have a different experience there.

I really like their Wagyu Cigar, which is yummy 😋. Their Karage Chicken is extra crispy and delicious .

Wakuda is a really good restaurant.
I will definitely return for a sumptuous dinner with close friends and family… soon.

3.Koma
————-
When I am served with the food , I am blown away by their presentation… it came on a mini version of their iconic bridge ( which is the backdrop of countless photos of many diners there ). What a nice touch. 👍

We had the Aperitif Hour at the Bar Lounge instead of the main dining area. The wagyu slider is very good but the portions are relatively small.

I look forward to return to Koma for a main meal again.

4.Yardbird
——————
The quality of the food is good, and the portions are big enough that I skipped dinner thereafter.

I am surprised by the quality and spread of the food at Yardbird, which I have never visited before. I may now visit Yardbird in the near future.
At 5pm, the restaurant is relativity quiet.

5.Maison Boulud
—————————
When I arrived at 5pm, the service staff  assigned me a seat near a window which is scorching hot from the afternoon sun.

The food portions are very small and the quality average.

The restaurant itself is very quiet, with only 2 staff serving customers at 5pm.

Comments
——————-
The newly introduced Aperitif Hour is a brilliant idea !!!

This gives the hotel guests a chance to try the excellent food served by the restaurants based at the mall and hotel. Also, it provides the restaurants some business during the quiet hour of 5pm-6pm. A win-win-win for all. 👍👍👍

I look forward to Aperitif Hour being introduced at Cut, Spago, Black Tap etc. 😀😀😀

review_text:
I stayed at Marina Bay Sands from July 3rd for five days and four nights with my family. Unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience.

On the first day, we waited for two full hours during check-in because the hotel said our room had a smoke odor. As compensation, we were given USD 150.

However, on the second night, we noticed the room still had a strong smell of smoke. The manager brought in a machine, saying it used a “natural solution” to remove the odor. I told them this was unacceptable—we have a child, and we couldn’t tolerate this for the rest of our holiday. I requested a room change or an upgrade, but the manager only said they would report it and then completely ignored us afterward.

This is the second time this year we’ve stayed here as a family, but sadly, it will be the last. A hotel of this level should take better care of its guests.

Had an amazing wedding anniversary stay on  at Marina Bay Sands! Huge thanks to Aini at the front desk for the warm welcome, and to Ryan the pool lifeguard for being so friendly. Santhosh from housekeeping quickly sent up items when we needed them. The Express Service team from the call centre was super helpful and responsive throughout our stay.

It came with a Dyson hairdryer in the closet, an automated smart toilet (it opens the lid as you approach!), and wireless charging pads built right within the tabletop. The room was absolutely spotless and super comfortable.
A special shoutout to the Front office team and in‑room dining team for arranging a cake and red wine to celebrate our wedding anniversary—such a thoughtful and memorable gesture. Thanks to everyone for making our stay truly exceptional!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Hotel Suites: The Best Birthday Ever! (4.5/5 stars)

Ratings:

• Accommodation: 5/5 (Breathtaking suite, spacious, impeccably designed, stunning views, plush furnishings)

• Service: 4.5/5 (Generally impeccable, friendly and attentive staff, minor delay in room service)

• Amenities: 5/5 (Exceptional dining options, unforgettable Sands Skypark infinity pool)

• Overall: 4.5/5

The best birthday ever! My amazing boyfriend, Donkey, surprised me with a stay at the luxurious MBS Hotel Suites, and the entire experience was pure bliss! From the moment we arrived, we were enveloped in an atmosphere of unparalleled elegance and sophistication. The suite itself was breathtaking & spacious, impeccably designed, and boasting floor to ceiling windows offering stunning panoramic views of the city skyline and Gardens by the Bay. The plush furnishings, state of the art amenities (I especially loved the deep-soaking tub!), and the sheer opulence of the space created an unforgettable experience. Simply relaxing and enjoying the breathtaking views was pure bliss. The service was generally impeccable, the staff were friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with a smile. Dining at one of the hotel's many exceptional restaurants was a highlight, and the Sands Skypark infinity pool provided an unforgettable backdrop for a celebratory swim.  The only minor drawback was a slight delay in room service, we requested shower gel via the in-room TV system and waited approximately 45 minutes before having to call directly to expedite the request. However, this small inconvenience was easily overshadowed by the overall magnificence of our stay. Overall, the MBS Hotel Suites delivered an extraordinary experience, making it the most memorable birthday celebration ever. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking a truly luxurious and unforgettable getaway.

An Unforgettable Experience at Marina Bay, Singapore!

Marina Bay is truly the heart of modern Singapore. The skyline is absolutely breathtaking, especially at night when the city lights reflect beautifully off the bay. The entire area is impeccably clean, safe, and well-organized—perfect for a relaxing stroll or a romantic evening.

Highlights for me included the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark with its stunning panoramic views, the Spectra Light & Water Show, and the Gardens by the Bay, especially the Supertree Grove. There's also fantastic dining nearby, from street food to fine restaurants with amazing views.

It’s a perfect blend of nature, technology, and luxury. Whether you’re a tourist or a local, Marina Bay offers something memorable for everyone. Highly recommended!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most iconic and breathtaking destinations in Singapore — a true architectural marvel that lives up to the hype. The moment you arrive, you're struck by how clean, modern, and well-maintained the entire area is. It’s obvious the government has invested heavily in making this part of the city not only efficient but also visually stunning.

The complex itself has everything: a luxury hotel, a massive shopping mall, world-class restaurants, the ArtScience Museum, a casino, and the famous SkyPark Infinity Pool with panoramic views of the city skyline. At night, the entire bay lights up beautifully, creating an unforgettable atmosphere. The nightly light and water shows are truly a spectacle, adding to the area’s magical charm.

Marina Bay Sands is also very tourist-friendly. Once you’ve walked around a bit or used the MRT nearby, getting your bearings becomes easy. The area feels safe, accessible, and full of energy.

We were incredibly lucky to visit while Singapore was preparing for its 60th National Day celebrations. We witnessed military rehearsals, fighter jets soaring overhead, and stunning fireworks lighting up the bay. Combined with the elegance of Marina Bay Sands, it made for a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Highly recommended for any visitor to Singapore.

Let me know if you want to add hotel-specific feedback or highlight anything else like shopping, food, or the pool!

Went there a couple of days ago for the fireworks display during the NDP rehearsals. It was so well organised despite being super crowded.

I drove there via the south parking entrance and we were directed to park our cars in the expo hall/loading bay. They opened all the expo halls and converted it into a massive carpark instead 😆 the staff members allocated spaces to each car so the process was very quick and efficient.

review_text:
We booked a stay at Marina Bay Sands to celebrate my son’s birthday — it was his dream to swim in the infinity pool, and we wanted to make it unforgettable. I booked two suites for our family, kids, and nieces so everyone could be part of the celebration.

The rooms and the pool were simply amazing, and the kids had the time of their lives. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service, especially from Erica, who gave us a check-in experience unlike anything I’ve had before.

We were greeted right at the car and taken directly to our suite, where the kids were welcomed with chocolates and apples. While the little ones ran around, excited and full of joy, my family and I completed the check-in formalities in the comfort of our room — no queues, no waiting, just pure ease.

From start to finish, everything about our stay was thoughtful, seamless, and special. Thank you, Marina Bay Sands, for making my son’s birthday a memory we will cherish forever.

review_text:
I had a very disappointing dining experience at the restaurant on the 55th floor of this supposedly “luxury” hotel.

I was invited to dinner by a friend who was staying in one of the VIP suites. The restaurant is not open to the public and is exclusively for hotel guests, which made the experience feel even more exclusive—until the service completely ruined it.

Shortly after we began our meal, a staff member informed us that the dining time was limited to 90 minutes. That seemed fine at first. However, well before the 90 minutes were up, we were rushed by the same staff to finish our meal. I politely asked if we could have a little more time, as we were still eating slowly, and I noticed that two other tables who arrived before us were still enjoying their meals as well.

Eventually, they agreed to extend our time by 30 minutes and sent another staff member to apologize. I then asked again, “Isn’t the restaurant open until a certain time? Can guests eat until closing?” The person who came to apologize said, “Yes, you can stay and dine until the end.” So why was I being pushed out before our time was even up?

What shocked me the most was the attitude of the first staff member—it felt cold and unwelcoming, as if we were not entitled to be there. Was it because we weren’t the registered guests, but just friends of a VIP guest? If so, that kind of discriminatory service is completely unacceptable in a hotel of this standard.

The environment and view were wonderful, but the service left a sour taste. Dining should be about hospitality and respect, and unfortunately, this experience had neither. I hope management takes this feedback seriously—this is not the level of service one expects a high-end establishment。

review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Staying at Marina Bay Sands was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience that exceeded every expectation I had. From the moment I walked into the grand lobby, I could already feel that this was not just a hotel, but a world-class destination in itself. The scale, the design, and the atmosphere are breathtaking. Everything is built with such attention to detail that you immediately know you’re in one of the most iconic hotels in the world.

The highlight, of course, is the infinity pool at the SkyPark. I’ve seen it countless times in photos and videos, but being there in person is something else entirely. Swimming at the edge while overlooking the Singapore skyline is surreal—it feels like floating above the entire city. Day or night, the view is spectacular. In the morning, you get the calm and fresh energy of the city waking up, and at night, you’re treated to a dazzling skyline with lights that make the entire experience magical. It’s easily the most unforgettable pool I’ve ever been to.

The rooms are spacious, modern, and luxuriously comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows give you an unbeatable view, whether it’s the Gardens by the Bay or the city skyline. The beds are so comfortable that it’s almost difficult to get up in the morning—except you know you don’t want to waste any time staying in when you’re in such an amazing place. The bathroom amenities are top-notch, and everything feels meticulously maintained and spotless.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is also an experience of its own. The selection of restaurants is phenomenal, from celebrity chef restaurants to local-inspired cuisine, ensuring there’s something for everyone. Every meal feels like part of the luxury experience, with flavors that are memorable and presentation that’s on point. The staff across all the restaurants are highly professional, attentive, and genuinely welcoming.

What makes Marina Bay Sands stand out even more is the service. Every staff member I interacted with—from reception, concierge, housekeeping, to the restaurants—was friendly, helpful, and professional. They really go the extra mile to make guests feel taken care of, which is the hallmark of true 5-star hospitality.

Beyond being a hotel, Marina Bay Sands is practically a city within a city. The integrated resort has luxury shopping, the ArtScience Museum, theaters, and direct access to Gardens by the Bay, making it incredibly convenient to explore. The location is unbeatable, with everything you need either within the resort or just a short walk away.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel stay—it’s an experience. It’s luxurious, iconic, and unforgettable in every sense. Whether you’re traveling for leisure, business, or a special occasion, this place leaves a lasting impression that you’ll treasure for a lifetime. If you want to experience the best of Singapore, there’s no better place than Marina Bay Sands. Absolutely worth every dollar, and I can’t wait to come back again.

review_text:
A Review of the Sands Premier Suite at Marina Bay Sands
If you’re looking for a rejuvenating, luxurious holiday then you should definitely consider a stay at the prestigious Marina Bay Sands hotel!
Recently, me and my family had an amazing experience staying in the Sands Premier Suite of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff were very helpful and polite. They immediately helped us with our luggages which made me felt very welcome.
The entire hotel, from the ceiling to the walls are designed with lots of thoughts in mind. Because we arrived way earlier than the check-in time, they arranged a temporary key so we could enjoy the infinity pool while waiting. From the infinity pool, you could see the whole skyline of Singapore. The water temperature is just cool enough to make you feel relaxed but warm enough so that you won’t have a hard time getting out.
After lunch, we came back to check-in and receive our room keys. They had 3 check-in counters, the “normal” one, the VIP one and the Paiza & Limosine one (which is like the Super VIP one). Because the “normal” check in counter was way too long, we got escorted to the Paiza & Limosine to check in. The receptionist there are very kind and quick, she got us our room in less than 5 minutes. Even though I booked the Sands Premier Studio, we got upgraded to the Sands Premier Suite (for free!).
The room was much bigger than a standard hotel room, with a separate living area that had a comfortable sofa and a large TV. The bedroom was also spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. I really liked the floor-to-ceiling windows, which offered a stunning view of either the city skyline or the Gardens by the Bay. I chose the city view, and it was breathtaking, especially at night.
The bathroom was very modern and felt like a spa. It had a big bathtub for two people, which was a nice touch. They also provided very nice toiletries from Jo Malone. The room also had a walk-in wardrobe, which was very useful for keeping the room tidy and getting ready.
In conclusion, I would highly recommend the Sands Premier Suite. It’s a very luxurious option that offers excellent comfort, great amenities, and beautiful views. While it is quite expensive, the experience is worth it if you are looking for a special treat.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is, without a doubt, one of the most spectacular hotel experiences I’ve ever had. From the moment you walk into the grand lobby, you’re immersed in luxury, elegance, and impeccable service.

The infinity pool on the 57th floor is every bit as iconic as it looks in the photos—floating above the city skyline, it offers jaw-dropping panoramic views of Singapore. Watching the sunrise from the pool with a coffee in hand was pure magic.

My room was spacious, sleek, and sophisticated, with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking either the bay or the city. Every detail felt premium—from the plush bedding to the advanced tech and luxurious bathroom amenities.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a culinary journey. I had the pleasure of enjoying a world-class dinner at one of the celebrity chef restaurants and also loved the more casual options throughout the property. The buffet breakfast alone is worth writing home about—an incredible spread that caters to every taste.

The hotel is also in the perfect location—connected to high-end shops, the ArtScience Museum, and just steps from Gardens by the Bay. Whether you want to shop, sightsee, or just unwind in style, everything you need is right there.

review_text:
This hotel is perfect. Check in couldn’t have been more helpful. We were given and upgrade as it was my birthday along and as we were just staying one night and had a late flight the next day we were offered a replacement keycard for the next day to access the facilities as well as a bookable shower room so we could freshen up before heading to the airport.

The room was not huge but was so comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was gorgeous and everything felt fresh and brand new. The tech worked well including wireless charging on the night stands, auto opening curtains and the largest tv I have ever seen in a hotel room.

We had a great view of the city but immediately changed to try out the infinity pool which is better than I could have ever imagined. The staff are kind but some of the servers could do with a little more training as quite a few mistakes were made. Food and drinks came from nearby Wolfgang Puck Spago and even simple things such as a Caesar salad or burger were really excellent.

It is open 6am until midnight and we went three times to visit. Don’t forget the hot tubs on the other side of the pool deck.

The hotel itself is absolutely huge and has a large number of restaurants within it, also a massive shopping mall, nightclub and casino. It is a city within a city.

It is also close to Gardens on the Bay and a walkway goes through the hotel towards it. But you can’t access the walkway from the hotel and have to exit the hotel and take a small lift and then walk back into the hotel at walkway level. A small detail.

The location is not great for the city but there is a metro stop nearby and of course it is perfect for all the attractions around the Marina Bay. One day was not enough. I can’t wait to go back.

review_text:
Went to access this hotel while on my recent Singapore stay.
I didn't stay at the hotel, so am not offering a critique of the rooms/suites.
At 11.45-12pm, the lobby/foyer was insanely busy, there were hundreds of people checking in/out or hanging around.  Only black taxis( the expensive ones) were around and the valet and doormen were over whelmed. When I was leaving the cost for the black taxi to go to the airport was insane.
Overall, the crowd put me off immediately to even consider staying at this hotel.
There are so many instructions on how to get around the hotel, and which lifts to use.
I chose to have lunch at the foyer restaurant, as it's seafood buffet had been suggested to me. The restaurant is nice and the staff wonderful. The selection in the multi cuisine buffet stations is excellent, unfortunately with the exception of the seafood station. Prawns, lobster, crayfish, scallops arrive frozen from origin, then thawed and place on ice. All these were soggy, tasteless and chewy. I would avoid these.
The Sushi/Sashimi station is excellent.
The food in rest of the stations was also excellent.
I visited the pool, which was again very crowded. I don't care how good a view a pool has, the crowd here was intolerable.
The top level restaurants and bars have a lovely view, so lunch or dinner would be a nice experience.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort and landmark located in Singapore. It's a massive complex that has become a major destination for business, leisure, and entertainment.
Key Features and Attractions
* Three Cascading Towers: The resort's most distinctive feature is its three hotel towers, topped by the Sands SkyPark.
* Sands SkyPark: This extraordinary rooftop platform connects the three towers and offers a 360-degree panoramic view of the city. It's home to the world-famous Infinity Pool, as well as restaurants, bars, and a public observation deck.
* Infinity Pool: The iconic 150-meter-long infinity pool is the world's largest at that height. Access to the pool is exclusive to hotel guests.
* The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands: A luxury shopping mall featuring a wide range of high-end international brands. You can also take a Sampan boat ride along the indoor canal within the mall.
* ArtScience Museum: The museum's unique lotus-inspired design hosts permanent and rotating exhibits that explore the intersection of art and science.
* Sands Expo and Convention Centre: A major facility for meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibitions (MICE).
* Casino: A large casino with a wide selection of gaming tables and slot machines.
* Celebrity Chef Restaurants: The resort is home to a number of acclaimed restaurants run by world-renowned chefs.
* Spectra Light and Water Show: A nightly outdoor light and water show at the Event Plaza, which is free to the public.
Nearby Attractions
Marina Bay Sands is situated in a prime location with easy access to other major Singapore attractions, including:
* Gardens by the Bay: A stunning futuristic park known for its Supertree Grove and cooled conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest).
* Helix Bridge: A unique pedestrian bridge with an architectural design inspired by the structure of DNA.
* Merlion Park: Home to the mythical Merlion statue, a symbol of Singapore.
* Singapore Flyer: A giant observation wheel that offers breathtaking views of the city.
Practical Information
* Hotel Access: To use the famous rooftop infinity pool, you must be a registered guest of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
* Observation Deck: The Sands SkyPark Observation Deck is open to the public for a fee, offering a chance to see the views without being a hotel guest and get a glimpse of the pool.
* Getting Around: The location is well-connected by Singapore's excellent public transportation system, including the MRT (subway) station at Bayfront.

review_text:
Our visit to Marina Bay Sands was a memorable one, especially the experience of going to the top and witnessing the spectacular views of Singapore’s skyline. The coordination by the staff was commendable. Although we initially faced a small issue with our ticket not scanning properly, the team handled it with genuine warmth and professionalism. They reassured us not to worry, quickly sorted out the problem, and welcomed us with a friendly smile, which really set the tone for a great experience.

Once we reached the top, the view was undeniably impressive—stretching across iconic landmarks like the Singapore Flyer, Gardens by the Bay, and the endless expanse of city and sea. Everything was immaculately maintained, from the observation deck to the common areas. Cleanliness and upkeep clearly seem to be a top priority here.

That said, there are a few areas where the experience could be elevated further. Tourists today look for more interactive and immersive elements. Simple additions—like informative or engaging video displays inside the lifts (similar to what Burj Khalifa offers)—can really enhance the journey upward. Even having touch-screen installations at the top showcasing the history or stories of the buildings in view could add value.

Also, visiting during the daytime can be quite uncomfortable due to the harsh sun and heat. Some shaded or misted zones, or even cooling stations, would allow visitors to enjoy their time without feeling the need to rush through it.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands offers an iconic view, with a great team on the ground—but with just a few tweaks, it could offer a more memorable and comfortable experience for all.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is without a doubt one of the most iconic landmarks in Singapore, offering a luxurious experience from start to finish. The architecture alone is breathtaking—three towers connected by the famous SkyPark, which offers stunning panoramic views of the city skyline, Marina Bay, and beyond.

The Infinity Pool on the rooftop is world-famous and truly lives up to the hype. It’s only accessible to hotel guests, but if you get the chance to stay, it’s worth it for that view alone. There’s also a public observation deck if you're not staying at the hotel.

Inside, MBS features a high-end shopping mall with luxury brands, a canal with gondola rides, and a wide variety of restaurants—from celebrity chef fine dining to local delicacies. The ArtScience Museum and nightly Spectra light and water show at the promenade are great additions that make it a complete entertainment destination.

It’s directly connected to Gardens by the Bay via a beautiful pedestrian bridge, and the Bayfront MRT station is just below the complex, making it super accessible.

Whether you're staying the night, coming for a show, or just enjoying the views, Marina Bay Sands offers a world-class experience in the heart of Singapore.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is a landmark that has become synonymous with luxury and innovation since its opening in 2011. Located on the waterfront of Marina Bay, the resort features an iconic design with three interconnected towers, topped by the Sands SkyPark, which boasts the world’s largest infinity pool. This rooftop area offers stunning panoramic views of Singapore’s skyline, creating a unique experience for hotel guests.

The resort offers 1,850 rooms and suites, ranging from elegant Premier Rooms to the ultra-luxurious Paiza Collection. The rooms are designed with modern sophistication, featuring plush furnishings, marble bathrooms, and the latest in-room technology. Guests staying in the Paiza Collection enjoy exclusive benefits, including butler service, private lounge access, and enhanced privileges at the SkyPark.

Marina Bay Sands is also home to an impressive selection of dining options, with over 80 restaurants and bars. Renowned chefs like Wolfgang Puck, Gordon Ramsay, and Tetsuya Wakuda have established eateries here, offering a variety of world-class culinary experiences. The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, an upscale shopping mall, features more than 300 luxury stores, while the ArtScience Museum offers an intriguing mix of exhibitions that combine art, science, and technology.

Entertainment options at the resort are abundant. The light and water show, Spectra, is a nightly spectacle, and the MARQUEE nightclub adds to the vibrant nightlife scene. The casino, along with a theater hosting international performances and a large convention center, ensures that there’s always something to do. For those looking for relaxation, the Banyan Tree Spa provides a range of luxurious treatments, and the fitness center is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities.

One downside to consider is the resort’s sheer size, which can lead to crowded public areas, especially during peak seasons. Guests have occasionally mentioned longer wait times for certain amenities. Despite this, the vast array of services and the exceptional level of service offered at Marina Bay Sands often outweigh these inconveniences.

Marina Bay Sands is a top-tier destination for travelers seeking a luxurious all-in-one resort experience. Whether you’re enjoying the infinity pool, dining at world-class restaurants, shopping, or indulging in the entertainment, the resort offers something for everyone, making it a standout choice when visiting Singapore.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel—it's an icon that defines the Singapore skyline and an immersive experience in luxury, architecture, and entertainment. From the moment you enter, you're surrounded by a sense of scale and grandeur that few hotels in the world can match. The triple-tower structure, connected at the top by the SkyPark, feels futuristic yet harmoniously integrated with the Marina Bay waterfront.

I stayed in a Premier Room on a high floor, and the view from the floor-to-ceiling windows was absolutely unforgettable—overlooking Gardens by the Bay and the Singapore Strait. The room itself was luxurious yet understated, with thoughtful design touches, a spacious bathroom with a rain shower, and everything you’d expect from a world-class 5-star property.

Of course, the highlight was the infinity pool. It's reserved for hotel guests only and lives up to every bit of hype. Watching the city skyline glow at dusk while swimming 57 stories up was something I’ll remember forever. The SkyPark observation deck, accessible to the public for a fee, is also fantastic for views and photos.

Dining was equally stellar—LAVO had one of the best Italian meals I’ve had in Asia, and breakfast at Rise was generous, varied, and well-executed. The integrated shopping mall downstairs (The Shoppes) has everything from Louis Vuitton to artisanal coffee shops. You’ll also find the ArtScience Museum here, with its lotus-like design and rotating exhibitions.

Yes, it’s expensive. But for what you’re getting—the architecture, the views, the facilities, the sheer wow-factor—it’s one of those places worth splurging on at least once. Tip: Book early and request a higher floor with a pool-facing view

review_text:
It was a surreal experience, which was good. It is expensive to dine within the hotel at various venues. Drinks were very expensive too. A buffet breakfast was included, but oh my goodness, it was extremely busy no matter what time we attended. One day, there were over 70 people in the queue waiting to be seated. We sent an email to the hotel, as one day, our allocated table was next to a door for anyone to go outside into the garden dining area. This particular breakfast wasn't enjoyable as it was a constant thoroughfare with so many other guests squeezing past. We received a phone call within a few minutes of sending our email. They understood our issue but didn't offer any solution. We weren't offered this table again 🙏 The said table was still in place the following day! We also sadly noticed the huge amount of food being wasted from a lot of guests.
We had a couple of issues having to wait, one was for some wine we had ordered for our room, we eventually after almost an hour of waiting received a call to advise the wine wasn't available!
The room itself was lovely & the views were beautiful. Overall the staff were extremely polite & very helpful.
The main thoroughfare near to reception is extremely busy, with anyone being able to access not just guests staying at the hotel as the shopping mall/cinema/casino/restaurants, etc, are accessible from here.
We do hope the infrastructure is being carefully considered whilst Tower 4 is being constructed, as the number of people moving through & around is extremely busy!!
The infinity pool was amazing though & enjoyable 😎

Overall the hotel provides a lot of good facilities nearby, but the room could benefit from some renovation.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is the pinnacle of luxury in Singapore. From the moment you arrive, the impeccable service, stunning architecture, and breathtaking views leave you in awe. The infinity pool atop the hotel is an experience like no other, offering panoramic vistas of the city skyline. The rooms are exquisitely designed, spacious, and fitted with top-tier amenities. Dining options are world-class, with Michelin-starred restaurants and vibrant bars. The casino, shopping mall, and entertainment options ensure an unforgettable stay. Whether for business or leisure, Marina Bay Sands delivers an extraordinary experience that redefines luxury. Simply spectacular in every way.

The hotel does offer free access to the fitness center, which is located near the hotel, short walking distance.

review_text:
One of the most iconic pieces of architecture to ever take centre stage. Love that these beautiful buildings can be seen at different vantage points around the city.

We visited three times, to the hotel and lobby bar. To tower three for a fine dining experience at Spago on L57 and to the shoppes for casual dining, shopping and the Sampan boat ride which is a must do.

Pro tip, book in advance at a restaurant or bar on L57 so you can enjoy the million dollar views, along with the establishments observation deck (which is) often private and for patrons only.

Skypark observatory seems to have massive queues (and) for slightly more than you’d pay for the fee (you) can enjoy a beautiful experience instead.

We walked all round the lake and then entered Marina Bay Sands. The shopping hall is huge here with all the high end brands here.
There is a food court at the basement level which has a huge amount of local food shops to try.
There are a few restaurants and bars on the roof which you have to pay for to enter but then you get the views from the roof of the Singapore skyline.
There is a Venetian canal in the middle of the mall where you can take a boat ride also.

review_text: I really enjoyed my stay at Marina Bay Sands. We stayed one night only to experience the pool. I was concerned that the pool would be crowded but it wasn’t. The view at the top is truly amazing. I stayed there on a Tuesday in October. I got upgraded to a bayside suite room in Tower 3 in a newly renovated room and was able to watch the light show at the Gardens by the Bay which happens twice a night. The service was amazing and despite being such a big hotel, I did not feel lost or without attention. There is also a laser light show at the marina bay sands complex at night which was fun. Get there early to secure good seats. The area is fun to walk around or jog. There is also a mall attached and a casino. (Did not go so can’t comment)

review_text:
We had only one night at MBS, and it wasn’t enough. First, Singapore has too much to offer to try and fit in to a short layover. Second, this hotel is a great place to use as a base, conveniently located and with a ton of stuff to do on-site.

It isn’t the most “bespoke” hotel. You’ll find friendly staff (we had an absolutely lovely woman checking us in!), and a ton of conveniences. What you won’t find is the hyper personal touch that a small, boutique hotel might offer. That said, you probably know that already considering the size and scope of this hotel.

Perhaps, and as no surprise, the highlight is the Infinity Pool at the top. We went up in the morning, on a day with rain and clouds. We still enjoyed it. Though it was a bit cold for our comfort, we jumped between the infinity pool and a nearby jacuzzi. It was a fun and memorable experience.

Shopping nearby is plentiful, and the food options are many. We would love to stay longer the next time we visit.

review_text:
This is one of the best hotels in Singapore located right in the middle of the action area. Everything is just a stone's throw away. There are a lot of shopping options if you are into indulgence. You can also explore nearby options quickly if you are staying here.

It has one of the best infinity pools which is located on the 57th floor and only accessible to hotel guests. The only issue is it would be crowded mostly and You can see a lot of guests clicking pictures and capturing the skyline. It gives one of the best views of the city and they have restaurants like Spago and Lavo right next to the pool which give quite a few and reasonable eating options as compared to the charges of the room.

Overall I would say that the room sizes could be better at the cost that is charged but then again you should be prepared for spending some money if you want to visit and stay in one of the most expensive hotels in one of the most expensive city 😜. Definitely a must go if you have the money to experience.

review_text: Honestly I expected much more. It's a relatively nice hotel but that's about it. The service was good but not great. The room seemed to rely on the spectacular view as a selling point but the furnishings were cheap looking and in some places damaged. Room amenities vere very basic. The in room dining was a little disappointing. It kind of reminds me of a Disney resort hotel without the characters or excellent service. The restaurant we tried inside the hotel wasn't great although the views again were spectacular. Fortunately you have direct access to the shops in the mall and some really great places to eat. There are also loads of high end stores so if shopping is your thing that will definitely help. The infinity pool/sky-park were very nice but definitely not worth staying there for. The complex is connected to Gardens by the Bay which is an awesome attraction. The garden is accessible from many downtown hotels though so again not sure it's worth staying here for. One tip for this place is that it is HUGE. Give yourself some extra time if you are going anywhere that is not in the tower you are staying in. We had a nice stay but the hotel itself was just average.

review_text: This is a stunning hotel and will be landmark of Singapore for years to come. If you can afford to stay it’s a great one I believe, I couldn’t afford so we went in for the deck tour to get the superior view of Singapore from top. Guess it was more than 54 floor and deck is on top floor and went in by a high speed elevator, was not crowded when we went, the cost covers a digital photo and if you need a printed one it’s extra. The view from the deck is stunning and luckily when we went it was not that sunny, so could enjoy the view. The swimming pool is on other side and only residents are allowed and from the deck we can catch a glimpse. Please experience this view if you are in Singapore. Once we were done and got to the reception level we strolled the huge lobby which was decorated well for Christmas and had some snacks at the cafe /bakery there. Taste was awesome and you must try. From the entrance of the hotel where taxi dropped us for the deck tour the gardens by the bay is walkable which is another attraction you should not miss.

review_text: Something special about this place is that it's an integrated resort notable for transforming Singapore's city skyline, it comprises three 55-storey towers of extravagant hotel rooms and luxury suites with personal butler services. The appearance of the Marina Bay resort is what makes it famous. The three huge towers are home to 2,500 hotel rooms and suites, joined together at the bottom by a seamless lobby area. What makes these three towers so unique, however, is the way that they are joined at the top. The view is just to die for! I think this is a place for me to enjoy and forget about all my problems for a while. Do you need a break? Have it at Marina Bay Sands!!

review_text:
Fabulous hotel, staffed by great people. everything about this place is awesome, it deserves its iconic status.
Our room was exceptional; clean, well appointed, nicely furnished (it had two TVs!) and the view was incredible. Pay the extra for a high floor and marina bay view, you won’t be disappointed. Guests have exclusive access to the infinity pool on level 57. It does get busy, especially in the afternoon, but it is open from 6am to 11pm so there are quieter times to visit. NB the pool is not heated and can be chilly!  The pool bartenders are so nice and attentive. I would’ve relaxed here all day but the amazing views of Singapore beckon you.
The concierge team also deserve a mention. Welcoming, informative and really helpful about the hotel and Singapore in general. Ask them anything, they have the answer!
We loved our stay here, the whole experience was amazing.

review_text:
Luxurious Experience at Marina Bay Sands Singapore

Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort that offers a unique and luxurious experience to its guests. The hotel's architecture is breathtaking and the views of the Singapore skyline are simply stunning. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed with modern amenities.

The resort's dining options are top-notch, featuring a wide range of international cuisines and some of the best fine dining restaurants in Singapore. The shopping mall is impressive, with high-end designer stores and luxury boutiques. The casino is also a popular attraction, with a wide selection of games and entertainment options.

One of the highlights of Marina Bay Sands is its world-famous infinity pool, located on the rooftop of the hotel. The pool offers breathtaking views of the city skyline and is a popular spot for both tourists and locals. The pool area also includes a bar and lounge, making it the perfect place to relax and unwind.

The staff at Marina Bay Sands are friendly, welcoming, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure that guests have a memorable experience. Whether you need assistance with your room, recommendations for dining or entertainment, or simply want to chat, the staff are always available and eager to help.

In summary, Marina Bay Sands is an exceptional resort that offers a truly luxurious experience to its guests. From the stunning architecture and world-class dining options to the iconic infinity pool and attentive staff, everything about Marina Bay Sands is designed to provide guests with an unforgettable stay. If you're looking for a luxurious and unforgettable experience in Singapore, Marina Bay Sands is definitely worth considering.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is truly a symbol of Singapore, and it’s a place I visit every year.

With so many rooms and guests, compared to other hotels of the same class, it doesn’t give the feeling of personalized care while moving around the hotel. However, the service at the lobby and concierge is excellent.

A few years ago, the hotel underwent a major renovation, and the rooms have been updated to a higher standard, which I’m really happy with. Since COVID, hotel prices in Singapore have risen across the board, and Marina Bay Sands is no exception. It’s now hard to find a room for under $700 a night.

Still, the signature infinity pool is something you just can’t miss :) I often bring guests here, and the growing number of F&B outlets offers a variety of options, which is very satisfying.

review_text:
We were so excited to be staying at the Sand’s as we had heard so many good things about it.

We arrived at the hotel and went to check in. Maybe 3 reception stations were open with about 2-3 employees at each one. It felt like an airport check in.

After standing in line for around 10minutes we were told to go to a back room to check in. The lady who checked us in was incredibly unfriendly. If she smiled it would have cracked her face.

Room was very nice but small. View was great until you looked down to the ground and they were doing construction. They don’t tell you this when you check in to a room with the garden view.

We were told our bags would arrive within 15-20min after checking in. After 30min I called front desk and I was told they were on the way up. 30min after that call luggage never arrived. I then called again and told them I was coming down to reception to collect the bags.

They once again told me the bags are on the way up. 10min later the bags arrived.

We headed up to the observation deck and it was like stepping foot into a disaster camp. As soon as you exit the elevator staff with cameras try and con you to take photos for money. This was really irritating and they blocked the entire walk way to the outer deck.

You had people sleeping all over the chairs and deck floor. There was even people having picnics with food out on the deck. So tacky.

Went and asked for information at the desk and again a stone cold faced women barely spoke to us.

For the price they charge and the service they provide it is not worth it. Staff are rude and the place is like an airport terminal.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of those places you have to experience at least once in Singapore — it’s more than just a hotel, it’s an icon. The views from the rooftop are legendary, but here’s the insider tip: instead of paying for a full-day pass, make a reservation at one of the rooftop bars or restaurants. That way, you get the same incredible skyline without overspending. Sometimes staff will let you walk around after dining, but it’s not guaranteed — so booking a drink or meal is the safest bet.

The food here is truly exceptional. From high-end restaurants to casual bites, everything feels curated, and you don’t have to break the bank if you plan wisely. Downstairs, the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands mall is stunning — a mix of luxury brands, unique boutiques, and even a canal with gondola rides. Don’t miss the wine and whisky collection store; it’s like walking into a museum of rare bottles.

At night, the free Spectra light and water show at 8:00 and 9:00 PM outside the mall is a must-see — a dazzling blend of fountains, lasers, and music against the backdrop of the bay. Inside the hotel, the architecture itself is an experience: the world’s largest rooftop infinity pool (hotel guests only), soaring lobbies, and restaurants that rival any luxury destination.

Fun facts:
• Marina Bay Sands opened in 2010 and cost around $5.5 billion USD to build.
• The rooftop SkyPark spans all three towers and could fit four and a half A380 planes end to end.
• The infinity pool is the longest elevated pool in the world at 150m.

Tip: Book a restaurant in advance for sunset, explore the mall before or after, and stay for the evening light show. It’s one of the few luxury experiences where you control how much you spend — and it’s worth every minute.

review_text:
This was the highlight of my Singapore trip in early 2024.
Marina Bay Sands truly earns every single star of its 5 star rating.
The rooms are spacious, spotless & the main lobby is huge.
The service is top notch. We only stayed there for 1 night as it's quite expensive & I'm usually quite a budget conscious person, so I don't usually stay at 5 star hotels, but the MBS hotel service is second to none. After getting there, we were immediately offered assistance with our luggage by staff, which was brought upstairs for us. The check in & check out process is seamless & straight-forward.
I'm not a gambler, so I didn't go to the casino, but I do like to keep my fitness up whilst I'm away, so I do recommend their gym. It is a fair walk from the rooms, but the variety of equipment was fantastic & it's a 24 hour gym too.
Obviously, you also can't go past the Infinity Pool whilst you're at MBS. Just remember to take your hotel key card with you when you go up.
Overall, despite the high price tag, I do recommend MBS if you do stay in Singapore, even if it's just for 1 night.

I'm not a gambler, so I didn't go to the casino, but I do like to keep my fitness up whilst I'm away, so I do recommend their gym. It is a fair walk from the rooms, but the variety of equipment was fantastic & it's a 24 hour gym too.
Obviously, you also can't go past the Infinity Pool whilst you're at MBS. Just remember to take your hotel key card with you when you go up.
Overall, despite the high price tag, I do recommend MBS if you do stay in Singapore, even if it's just for 1 night.

The room was of course immaculate, the view stunning and the experience exceeded expectations. They enjoyed their stay and will definitely be back! Thank you once again to the amazing team at MBS.

review_text:
A seaside hotel that captures the imagination often blends natural beauty with human-centric design, creating an immersive escape from the mundane. Here’s a multidimensional portrayal of an ideal coastal retreat:

**1. Symbiosis with the Ocean**
- **Boundless Vistas**: Perched atop a crescent-shaped bay, every suite features 270-degree floor-to-ceiling windows. The tides become a living mural, while the "Golden Hour of the Sea" during dawn and dusk offers a private visual feast.
- **Exclusive Shoreline**: A private 800-meter white sand beach pairs with a tidal monitoring system that alerts guests to optimal tide-pooling times. Guided explorations reveal hidden intertidal ecosystems at low tide.

**2. Architectural Poetry**
- **Cultural Reverence**: Inspired by traditional fishing village dwellings, the terraced structure boasts a façade embedded with millions of recycled seashells, their undulating textures shimmering like sunlit waves.
- **Liquid Aesthetics**: The lobby dazzles with 3,000 hand-blown glass jellyfish lamps. Ocean breezes animate the space, casting rippling shadows that transform check-in into an aquatic overture.

**3. Sensory Sanctuary**
- **Smart Ambiance**: Beds auto-adjust to body contours, while voice-controlled systems cycle through soundscapes like "coral reef white noise" or "dolphin frequency." Mineral-seaweed aromas diffuse via circadian-rhythm scent systems.
- **Marine Interaction**: Balconies house underwater periscopes; UV night mode unveils bioluminescent plankton. A cabin journal logs daily sightings of rare marine species.

**4. Reimagined Ocean Experiences**
- **Tidal Gastronomy**: A 18-course "Marine Evolution" tasting menu evolves with daily catches. Glass-floored dining platforms frame schools of fish darting beneath diners’ feet.
- **Abyssal Meditation**: Collaborating with oceanographers, transparent submersible pods host singing bowl sessions at 20-meter depths, where humpback whale songs resonate through the hull.

**5. Sustainable Innovation**
- Tidal energy meets 60% of power needs; greywater nourishes vertical algae walls that filter CO₂.
- The "Coral Adoption Program" lets guests plant reefs for carbon credits, redeemable for eco-experiences like nocturnal squid tagging.

More than a hotel, it’s a portal to marine consciousness—when bare feet touch moon-warmed sands and smart tidal bracelets pulse to signal a bioluminescent bloom, worldly identities dissolve with the receding tide, leaving only the true self in whispered dialogue with the eternal sea.

review_text:
An iconic landmark of Singapore and a must-visit destination. The architecture itself is breathtaking, and the views from the SkyPark Observation Deck are absolutely stunning—especially at sunset when the city skyline lights up. The infinity pool at the top is world-famous, and for good reason, offering one of the most unique swimming experiences in the world.

Inside, Marina Bay Sands offers everything under one roof: a luxury shopping mall with high-end brands, a wide range of restaurants (from celebrity chefs to casual dining), a casino, and even a museum. The Spectra light and water show at night by the bay is a highlight not to be missed—free and beautifully choreographed.

While it is on the pricier side, the experience is unmatched and worth it at least once. A true symbol of modern Singapore.

review_text:
In November 2022, we took our friends visiting from Australia to Marina Bay Sands, and it turned out to be one of the highlights of their trip. We started by strolling through the luxurious mall, where they enjoyed browsing the wide range of shops. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the architecture itself was impressive, adding to the overall experience.

After exploring the mall, we took a leisurely walk through the surrounding areas, which offered stunning views of the city skyline. The walk across to Gardens by the Bay was particularly enjoyable, as it provided a perfect blend of modernity and nature. Our friends were captivated by the seamless transition from the bustling mall to the serene gardens. Marina Bay Sands is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the best of what Singapore has to offer!

review_text:
S i n g a p o r e s . F i n e s t .
This was my second stay at Marina Bay Sands, and it’s now my absolute favorite! I opted for a suite room overlooking the breathtaking Gardens by the Bay, and it truly took my experience to the next level. The suite itself was exquisitely detailed, every inch of the room designed to perfection. From the plush bedding to the sleek bathroom and high-end amenities, the attention to quality was second to none.

The views were beyond spectacular, and it felt like the gardens were an extension of the suite, creating a serene and unforgettable atmosphere. But what truly made my stay exceptional was the staff. They were incredibly attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to make sure my stay was perfect. Nothing was too much for them—each request was met with a genuine smile and impeccable service.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands is the ultimate hotel experience. It’s a place that leaves you inspired and looking forward to returning. If you’re looking for an unforgettable, luxurious getaway, this is where you need to be!

Only issue was the mass confusion of how to exit the venue after the fireworks. Entries and exits were locked and couldn't find a way out to the street.  0,000s of people were cramming to enter the MTR.

Fluked finding the underground carpark, still not knowing how to exit the venue.  If not for a generous local, who had parked there, offering to drive me home, I'd probably be stuck there for hours!! With all the locked entries/exits that night, I'm concerned as to how they would have evacuated visitors had there been a fire.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is nothing short of spectacular. From the moment I stepped in, I was struck by the luxury and attention to detail in every corner of this iconic hotel.the highlight, of course, is the infinity pool.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands was also a treat. With a range of world-class restaurants and cafes, there’s something for everyone. I tried a few options within the complex, and each meal was delicious, albeit a bit pricey (which is expected given the location).

The hotel is perfectly located for exploring the city—just a short walk or ride away from major attractions like Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. The convenience and experience were well worth it.

review_text:
We stayed in Marina Bay Sands to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel staff was amazing and they went beyond our expectations to make our experience a very special one 🙏

The room was both beautiful and highly functional in ways that actually matter: High-end Audio, automated lights, curtains, HVAC all controllable from the TV.

Our stay in MBS by itself made the trip to Singapore totally worth it.

The location is perfect, views amazing and there's top notch shopping, dining and entertainment in the same building.

If there is one nit that I think can be improved on:
It would be amazing to offer a wider food menu for room service, or to offer in-room dining experiences from some of the high end restaurants in the MBS complex. Allowing guests to enjoy top notch dining in a top-notch room with top-notch views.

And I didn't even get to the insane infinity pool on top of the building 🙂

If you're thinking of booking one night, strongly consider booking two to have one full day without worrying about logistics.

review_text: The Sands Exposition Center and Mall is probably the most impressive mall that I have ever seen.  I don't know how much money it took to build this, but they thought of a lot.  First, they have the best food court that I have ever been to.  I've been here several times now and the prices are slightly higher, but the cuisine is really good with all booths.  It is like a high quality Hawker Center or something.  Plus, there is a Subway that goes right through the middle of it.  The Downtown line comes directly to this mall! Plus, in case you didn't know this already, you can actually walk on top of this mall!  There is an elevator to the top, and the view from here is amazing!  Not only that, but you can also walk directly to the Supertree Forest, via a special walkway which they have built between the two locations, saving you all kinds of time.  There is a lotus lake outside which almost nobody visits, which is a great place to enjoy some Tea or Coffee.  There is a casino here, and a lot more.  But you have got to see this place to believe it.

review_text:
Superb hotel in terms of view, architecture and service. The infinity pool is stunning, at day and night.
Towers are immaculate to walk through, the adjacent mall has one or more stores of almost all important designers. We only noticed Zimmermann who wasn't present.
Make sure to get their member card, if you plan on buying anything or eat at black tap burgers for example.

Their staff was extremely friendly, they even lined up our shoes and folded clothes that we threw on the couch. After using most of our complementary coffee capsules, they even gave us one more of each and plenty of sweets. Minibar is well stocked with a good variety of snacks, softdrinks and even a shaker to make your own cocktails. Even the size of the coffee was adjusted to match their cups.
Rooms are clean and of high quality interior. You can control all lighting, do not disturb and Ac from each side of your bed, which was a nice add on. When we left they put a number of glass cleaning clothes and even a cable organizer + amenities to take with us.

Probably the best city hotel I have ever stayed at. Definitely worth the money, don't look any further.

Thank you for having us!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is an iconic luxury destination that offers a unique combination of world-class hospitality, stunning architecture, and exceptional experiences. Located in the heart of the city, it is renowned for its striking design, featuring three interconnected towers topped by the SkyPark, which provides panoramic views of the Singapore skyline.

The hotel boasts opulent rooms and suites with modern amenities, elegant furnishings, and floor-to-ceiling windows that showcase breathtaking city or sea views. The service is exemplary, with staff going above and beyond to ensure a seamless stay.

The highlight of Marina Bay Sands is undoubtedly the Infinity Pool on the SkyPark, which is the world’s largest rooftop pool. Floating on the edge of the pool while gazing at the cityscape is an unforgettable experience. The SkyPark also houses observation decks and restaurants offering gourmet dining, further elevating the luxury quotient.

For entertainment, Marina Bay Sands has something for everyone. The integrated resort includes a high-end shopping mall, an impressive casino, and the ArtScience Museum, which hosts cutting-edge exhibitions. The theater regularly features international performances, adding to the cultural allure.

While the experience is undoubtedly luxurious, it comes with a premium price tag. Some guests might find the property bustling, especially during peak tourist seasons. However, the overall ambiance, impeccable service, and unmatched facilities make it worth the splurge.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands is more than just a hotel—it’s a destination in itself, perfect for those seeking indulgence, entertainment, and iconic memories in Singapore.

review_text:
My recent visit to Singapore was fab, and the highlight of this incredible journey was undeniably my stay at Marina Bay Sands. From the moment I set foot in this iconic hotel, I was spellbound by the sheer beauty of the bay area and the rich cultural experiences that surrounded me.

The first thing that left me in awe was the breathtaking view of the city skyline from the rooftop infinity pool. The sight of the glittering skyscrapers and the stunning Marina Bay was nothing short of magical, especially during the evening when the city lights up. I could have spent hours just soaking in this incredible panorama.

The Bay Area itself is a sight to behold. The calm waters of the bay, juxtaposed with the bustling cityscape, create a unique and captivating atmosphere. A leisurely stroll along the bay promenade allowed me to absorb the vibrant energy of this place and appreciate the blend of modernity and tradition that Singapore so perfectly encapsulates.

Overall, my visit to Marina Bay Sands in Singapore was nothing short of extraordinary. The hotel, the bay area, and the cultural experiences exceeded my expectations and made my first trip to Singapore a memorable one. If you're seeking a blend of luxury, culture, and breathtaking views, this is the place to be. I left with a heavy heart, but with memories I will cherish for a lifetime.

review_text:
My recent stay at the iconic Marina Bay Sands in Singapore was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I arrived, I was thoroughly impressed by the level of service and attention to detail that the resort provided.

One of the highlights of my stay was the unexpected room upgrade I received, which afforded me breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline and Marina Bay. Being able to wake up and enjoy the stunning vistas each morning was truly a treat. Swimming in the infinity pool was an experience I'll never forget.

What really sets Marina Bay Sands apart, though, was the exceptional level of service. The resort provided me with temporary cards that allowed me to access the swimming pool and reserve time slots for the shower facilities, even after I had checked out. This thoughtful touch ensured that I could continue to enjoy the resort's amenities on my final day, without any hassle.

I cannot recommend Marina Bay Sands highly enough. Whether you're visiting Singapore for business or leisure, this iconic resort offers an unparalleled blend of luxury, service, and unforgettable experiences. I left feeling refreshed, rejuvenated.

🌟 **Exceptional Service from Christine at Marina Bay Sands Concierge**

During my recent stay at Marina Bay Sands, I had the pleasure of being assisted by Christine at the concierge—and I can confidently say she is a true gem in the hospitality world. From the moment I approached the desk, Christine greeted me with warmth, professionalism, and a genuine desire to help.

She went above and beyond to ensure every detail of my stay was seamless. Whether it was arranging last-minute reservations, offering insightful recommendations tailored to my interests, or simply making me feel welcomed and valued, Christine handled everything with grace and efficiency. Her knowledge of the local area and hotel amenities was impressive, and her calm demeanor made even the busiest moments feel effortless.

In a hotel known for its luxury and world-class service, Christine stands out as a shining example of excellence. She embodies everything Marina Bay Sands represents—elegance, attentiveness, and a commitment to unforgettable guest experiences.

Thank you, Christine, for making my visit truly special. I hope the management recognizes the incredible asset they have in you!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks and a symbol of modern architectural brilliance. The complex consists of three towering hotel blocks connected at the top by the SkyPark, an engineering marvel that offers panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay.

One of the biggest draws is the world-famous infinity pool, located on the rooftop. Reserved exclusively for hotel guests, the pool provides an unforgettable experience—floating above the city while enjoying spectacular views. Many visitors book at least one night’s stay just to access it, and while prices can be high, booking during off-peak periods or through special promotions can help you save significantly.

Beyond the pool, the resort is home to a large shopping mall, a casino, and a wide variety of dining options ranging from food court fare to high-end restaurants by celebrity chefs. The quality of food across the property is consistently excellent.

What makes Marina Bay Sands truly special is its dual perspective: you can enjoy stunning views of both the futuristic Gardens by the Bay and the dazzling city skyline, especially at night when the lights come alive.

Whether you’re staying overnight, dining, or just visiting the observation deck, it’s an experience that’s absolutely worth having at least once in your lifetime.

During my recent visit, I attended the STACK Conference organized by GovTech, held in its expansive event spaces. The venue is impressively large, with state-of-the-art facilities that can accommodate conferences and workshops seamlessly. I organized a workshop for 40 participants, and the spacious, well-equipped room made the experience smooth and productive.

Beyond the corporate side, Marina Bay Sands also doubles as a shopping haven, with a sprawling mall featuring high-end brands, fine dining, and entertainment options. It's an exceptional venue that effortlessly blends business with leisure, offering something for everyone.

review_text:
An Iconic Luxury Experience

Marina Bay Sands is nothing short of spectacular. From the moment you arrive, you’re enveloped in luxury and grandeur. The architecture is iconic, and the view from the SkyPark is absolutely breathtaking, offering panoramic vistas of Singapore’s skyline that are worth the visit alone.

The rooms are spacious, modern, and well-appointed, with many offering stunning views of the bay. The infinity pool is the star attraction—swimming at the top of the world is an experience that you simply can’t miss. It’s a bit crowded at times, but the view and atmosphere make it worth it.

Beyond the rooms and pool, the complex has everything you could need—high-end shopping, world-class dining, and a casino. The staff are attentive and ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible.

Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel; it’s a destination in itself. Whether you’re staying here or just visiting, it’s an experience that defines luxury in Singapore. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in the best the city has to offer.

Any the infinity pool was amazing overlooking the city! We went at 6 am in the morning for a swim and no one was around until about 6:30 am then the crowd started to build up. All in all, it was an amazing stay and would still recommend the hotel!

Both rooms had superb views over the supertree grove and glass houses so we could watch the light show from our balcony.  We got priority  access to the observation  deck and visited the pool twice. Loved the fact there  was an adult only area, too.
We didn't dine there, and the only issue  I have is the fact that everything  in Singapore  harbour area that's good gets booked far in advance.  We were warned about this the day before check-in and didn't  do anything about it. My advice would be to choose a restaurant  within the hotel as they are excellent (not like hotel food in the UK), and come highly  recommended  on Trip Advisor.

All in all, it was an amazing  experience.  Would love to come again someday, and I will sort out eateries before  we arrive!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel; it’s a destination in itself—a place where luxury, innovation, and grandeur converge to create an unforgettable experience. From the moment you approach this iconic structure, the stunning architecture captures your attention. The three soaring towers connected by the breathtaking SkyPark have become synonymous with the Singapore skyline, and the reality of staying here exceeds every expectation.

The rooms are nothing short of spectacular. Whether you’re enjoying panoramic views of the city skyline, the bustling harbour, or the lush Gardens by the Bay, every window offers a postcard-perfect scene. The interiors are sleek, modern, and impeccably designed, providing comfort and luxury in equal measure. The attention to detail is evident, from the plush bedding to the high-tech amenities that ensure your stay is seamless and indulgent.

But what truly sets Marina Bay Sands apart is its unparalleled range of facilities. The SkyPark infinity pool is a must-visit—swimming at the edge of the world, with the city sprawled out below. You are an experience that’s hard to match. It’s not just a pool; it’s a statement, a place where you feel like you’re floating above the city.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a journey through culinary excellence. The hotel houses a plethora of world-class restaurants, each offering unique and exquisite dishes. From celebrity chef establishments to more casual yet equally delightful dining spots, the options are endless and cater to every taste. Whether you’re in the mood for gourmet cuisine or a quick, delicious bite, you’ll find something to satisfy your palate.

For those looking to indulge in some retail therapy, the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands offers a luxurious shopping experience, featuring high-end brands and designer boutiques. The integrated resort also boasts an impressive casino, a theatre showcasing world-class performances and an art-science museum, ensuring that there’s always something exciting to do.

The service is top-notch across the board. The staff are attentive, professional, and genuinely eager to make your stay exceptional. From check-in to check-out, every interaction is smooth and pleasant, making you feel pampered at every step.

Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel; it’s an experience that leaves a lasting impression. Whether you’re in Singapore for business or leisure, this iconic landmark provides the perfect blend of comfort, luxury, and entertainment. It’s a place where every detail is crafted to perfection, making it an absolute must-stay for anyone visiting this vibrant city.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks, a luxury hotel that is more than just a place to stay—it’s an experience in itself. During my recent visit, I was left in awe of its architectural grandeur, world-class amenities, and stunning views. Adding to this, my dining experience at LAVO Italian Restaurant & Rooftop Bar was a highlight of the trip, though there were some areas where it could have been better.

**Marina Bay Sands Experience:**

From the moment you arrive at Marina Bay Sands, the sheer scale of the place is impressive. The hotel consists of three massive towers connected by a SkyPark, which offers one of the best panoramic views of the city. Checking in was seamless despite the large number of guests, and the staff were attentive and professional throughout our stay.

The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and offered floor-to-ceiling windows with breathtaking views of Singapore’s skyline or the bay. The attention to detail in the rooms, from the plush bedding to the luxurious bathrooms, made our stay incredibly comfortable. The location of Marina Bay Sands is also unbeatable—it’s situated near many of Singapore’s key attractions, such as Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and the Merlion, making it perfect for tourists looking to explore the city.

However, what sets Marina Bay Sands apart is its world-famous infinity pool located on the 57th floor. Floating in the pool while taking in the views of the city skyline is an experience you won’t forget. It’s worth noting that the pool area does get crowded, especially during peak hours, so it’s best to visit early in the morning or late in the evening for a more relaxed atmosphere.

For entertainment, Marina Bay Sands also boasts a world-class casino, high-end shopping at The Shoppes, and an array of restaurants, bars, and cafes. The hotel’s wide variety of dining options ensures there’s something for everyone, from casual eateries to fine dining.

**Dining at LAVO Restaurant:**

One of the dining highlights at Marina Bay Sands was our dinner at LAVO Italian Restaurant & Rooftop Bar. Situated on the 57th floor, LAVO offers stunning 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline, and the ambiance is unbeatable. The warm lighting, plush seating, and open-air terrace create a sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere. Whether you’re seated indoors or outdoors, you’re in for a visual treat.

LAVO’s menu is an impressive mix of Italian-American cuisine. We started with the *Fried Calamari* and *Meatball*, both of which were delicious. The calamari was perfectly crisp, and the meatball was tender and flavorful, served in a rich tomato sauce. For our main course, we ordered the *Spaghetti Carbonara* and *Lobster Ravioli*. The carbonara was creamy and flavorful, though slightly on the heavier side, while the lobster ravioli was a standout dish, with perfectly cooked pasta and generous portions of lobster.

However, as much as we enjoyed the food, the prices were on the higher side, which is to be expected given the prime location. The service, while friendly, could have been more attentive. It took longer than expected for our orders to be taken, and the food arrived slightly later than anticipated. While the ambiance and views made up for the slight delays, it’s something that could be improved for a more seamless dining experience.

The rooftop bar at LAVO is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy cocktails with a view. The drinks were well-crafted, and sipping a cocktail while watching the city lights come to life was a memorable experience.

**Conclusion:**

Marina Bay Sands is a premier destination in Singapore, offering a luxurious stay with unparalleled views, world-class amenities, and a range of dining options. The infinity pool alone makes it worth the visit, and its location is perfect for exploring Singapore. LAVO Restaurant, with its stunning views and delicious Italian-American cuisine, is a great dining spot, though a few tweaks in service would make it even better. Overall, both the hotel and restaurant was amazing.

Pools were separated for the adults and kids section, so for all us adults could enjoy the views and food/drinks in peace and harmony without screaming and jumping kids. If you ever visit Singapore, you have to visit Gardens by the bay even if you don't stay at the hotel, but if you do stay at the hotel,  the views from our room were magnificent.

Unfortunately they don't let you go around to the rooftop pool area even to take photos of the view but it was still a great time.
The area is roofed but has open sides that allow the breeze to flow through.

review_text: I had an amazing time during my stay at Marina Bay Sands. The one-bedroom suite we had was fantastic, with a killer view of the gardens. The posh decor and the huge bed made it even better. The iconic pool overlooking Singapore was stunning, although it felt a bit crowded. Despite that, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would gladly return in the future.

review_text:
Outstanding hotel. I don't have any complaints about it, only compliments:
- professional staff (for welcome, restaurant, room service, etc). Also did their best to accommodate us as soon as possible
- the rooms are excellent, great amenities and automations for everything, high tech
- the infinity pool, one of the best in the world: very high up in the sky with great views. Fruits refreshments throughout the day
- great and complete main restaurant, both breakfast and dinner buffets
- luxurious overall, like a mini mall with various stores and restaurants
- good location, various nearby attractions: Gardens by the Bay, Singapore Flyer, Spectra show, etc, nearby the MRT subway too

My advice: get a room with gardens by the bay view, both day and night the view is nice and calming, during the night you can also see the Gardens lights and music show. On the opposite side you have the city and the lake below, I personally prefer the Gardens view

It came with a fun pic too so that was nice. We loved the views. Definitely need to explore this after dark if you are exploring Singapore! Would love to stay there but it's so expensive... there are fancy shops below that anyone can walk through. A very enjoyable experience.

review_text:
Love the views but that’s all they are charging for. Quite frankly the infrastructure is really old and the rooms are quite basic. My room smelled like cigarettes which got me a headache, they put an air freshener but this is something I have never experienced in a 5 star.
The service of the hotel is not the best. I found the staff quite unfriendly and would not even greet their guests which I found odd. I mentioned to them in an email exchange that we will be staying for our anniversary and they said they will be sending a dessert over once we check in which they didn’t. Who even does that.
Overall I would not recommend it, there are many much better hotels in Singapore for the same price or even much cheaper.
