review_text: The hotel is great in industrializing the 5-star experience. Do not attempt online checkin, because then your stuff won’t reach your room from the drop-off and there will be issues with the online deposit. This simply does not work as you would expect. The room is quite nice on higher floors, but they started some maintenance next to our room and as they left an emergency exit open and blocked the beeping noise was quite disturbing in our room during the night. We were offered a new room, but as we would had to move our staff the night before our checkout, it did not make any sense. We would have expected much more from such a high ranked hotel and considering these it does not worth the money. Maybe one time to check the pool. I never had to call or contact the front desk so often in any other hotel like here, and we are not picky at all. The service is nice and the staff is polite but not flexible at all. Mixing business people with people on vacation is also not a great idea.

review_text:
We feel like all we do is wait at this hotel. We are checking in to the Orchid Suite today after a day in the Premier King room. We've been waiting 15 minutes in line to get a table for breakfast, no one had time to serve us at breakfast, and the food was not very good, we waited in line to check in, we waited in line to check out, the restaurant makes mistakes on the order at lunch. The check out-person told us we could keep our access to the first room while waiting for the suite to get ready, but our key cards stopped working so we had to spend another 30-40 minutes with the check in counter to get access to our luggage which was still in the old room. Finally, after spending $1,200 for a night in their suite we were asked to walk to an ATM to withdraw $2 for stamps so they could send two postcards for us. OK, thanks

It is evident that the service as a Premier Room customer is low. The service level as a Suite customer is much higher - use Club 55 as much as possible! The service at Club 55 lives up to our expectations and service at other great hotels and Club 55 together with the pool is what gives this hotel 3 out of 5 stars. This was a nice change after the first day. We have stayed at 7 hotels in the past 30 days, and even though the service level increased a lot after booking the suite, this hotel comes in at rank 6 out of 7 hotels (second last).

The top floor pool is amazing, though. Amazing views from the top! A must see!

review_text: Very beautiful view of Singapore. Best time to visit is evening around the sunset and then continue till Singapore lights are on, this way you can enjoy hot day and night views and it’s amazing beauty. Tickets are 36 SGD, better to book online on marina bay sands website since counter tickets are sold much earlier in the day. They take a nice pic at the entrance however they charge quiet a bit for hardcopy of the photos. If a digital copy be sent to guest on there email or whatsapp for minimal price or for free it would just be a very nice memorable experience. Overall it’s a must visit place on your Singapore trip.

review_text: Clean, beautiful, and wonderful service. It’s expensive for a reason. The pool gives probably the best view in Singapore on clear days. Restaurants are great. review_text: It is one of the tallest building in the Marina Bay Sands area and the observation deck at the top gives a fantastic view of the iconic place of Singapore. It was a little hard to get drink/food service but other than that we had a lovely time around the pool. The gym is a little small considering the number of rooms at the hotel. We didn't want to leave. Such a wonderful experience.

review_text:
Never ever disappointed by this place. Visited many times, but always feel wonderful.

It is a must visit place in Singapore. A huge shopping mall with a Casino, multiple restaurants, luxury brands, etc available.

The outside area is just something else. A floating apple store, and a floating LV store, with an amazing view of high rise buildings and the city all lit up.

A light and sound fountain show happens Fri - Sun.

Lovely lovely place!!

review_text: Marina Bay Sands in Singapore offers a truly spectacular holiday experience with its world-class facilities and breathtaking views. The iconic architecture houses a luxurious hotel, cutting-edge entertainment options, and an expansive infinity pool that provides a mesmerizing panorama of the city skyline. The attention to detail and opulent design make it a standout destination for those seeking a lavish and memorable escape. Whether indulging in fine dining, enjoying top-tier entertainment, or simply relishing the stunning scenery, Marina Bay Sands sets the stage for an unforgettable and truly awe-inspiring getaway.

review_text: We were concerned about the scale of the hotel and the number of guests and how that might impact our stay, but from even before reaching the hotel, we were so wonderfully assisted by a personalized check in staff as part of premier check-in services that we didn't need to worry about a thing. The luggage magically came to the room and left the room without us needing to supervise, thanks to the very able luggage staff and the exceptional operational management. It is worth staying in the suites for this premiere experience. Each dining option offered by the hotel is just fabulous, with the stunning views from Club 55, the beautifully crafted cakes and savouries at Renku, and especially the widespread and delicious breakfast selections at Rise. The ease with which the scale of operation at breakfast at Rise is managed is just remarkable. The swimming pool experience was also memorable, and we managed to go at times when the crowds were a little less. The suite itself was beautifully appointed, with all necessities placed in the correct position. The views were stunning..we were lucky to get a corner room for an Orchid suite, which offered both city and garden views with sunset and sunrise views. The large windows with mechanised curtains truly elevate the experience. The bathroom and all its amenities, including the selection of toiletries, was extremely premiere. And it is extremely easy to access the towers, the mall, and the various dining places due to the logical layout of the whole complex. The only thing thing that needs a bit of improvement is the elevator waiting time when exiting the sky deck. Overall, amazing stay and we will come back.

review_text: The food court service and food standard at MBS managed by Koufu is worse than a hawker centre. Rasapura Masters is the name of this food court at MBS which is managed by the Koufu. This is not the first time we patronize this place and the latest incident really makes me feel pissed off and decided to leave a bad review for them. Firstly, we bought coffee and tea from them, the taste is so bland and diluted. Therefore i return back to the beverage counter asking for more condensed milk to be added. But to my surprise instead of condensed milk sugar was added instead? Is this the correct way to brew and serve a cup of coffee/tea which cost $2.20 to the customer and give substandard quality? We don't mind to pay extra but it is really not worth as hawker centre coffee is even better than them! And the food court executive is standing at the beverage order counter allowing all this to happen? Secondly, we bought ice kacang from the dessert counter and the portion and appearance is totally different from what is display on the signage. I feel cheated as this is not way to do business and it costs $4.30 for this kind of dessert? I approach the staff making the dessert and she rudely told me is like that one, the display is only a photo! Come on shouldn't you make the finished product to be almost the same as display or else this is actually considered as cheating customers. Example if i sell fishball noodles, my signage display is three fishball and some fishcake but the end product i cook out i only put one fishball into the noodles. Is it correct to do so? I don't think so! This foodcourt is simply a disgrace to the customers especially to the tourists and ruined Singapore food and beverages heritage which they represented at MBS...

Secondly, we bought ice kacang from the dessert counter and the portion and appearance is totally different from what is display on the signage. I feel cheated as this is not way to do business and it costs $4.30 for this kind of dessert? I approach the staff making the dessert and she rudely told me is like that one, the display is only a photo! Come on shouldn't you make the finished product to be almost the same as display or else this is actually considered as cheating customers. Example if i sell fishball noodles, my signage display is three fishball and some fishcake but the end product i cook out i only put one fishball into the noodles. Is it correct to do so? I don't think so! This foodcourt is simply a disgrace to the customers especially to the tourists and ruined Singapore food and beverages heritage which they represented at MBS...

Won't be going back anytime soon.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a luxurious and iconic hotel located in the heart of the city. The hotel features stunning views of the Marina Bay and the Singapore skyline, and offers a wide range of amenities and services to ensure a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, with comfortable beds, modern amenities, and beautiful views. The hotel also offers a variety of dining options, from casual cafes to upscale restaurants, all of which serve delicious and high-quality food.

The hotel also has a large and well-equipped fitness center, as well as a beautiful infinity pool and rooftop terrace that offer breathtaking views of the city. The hotel also has a casino and a shopping mall, which are both worth a visit.

The staff is friendly and professional, and always willing to help with any request or question. The hotel's location is also great, it's close to many of the city's main attractions and also has easy access to public transportation.

Overall, the Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a fantastic hotel that offers luxury, comfort, and great views. It's an excellent choice for anyone looking for a high-end hotel in the heart of the city.

review_text:
When visiting Singapore, a stay at the MBS is a must. The unique architecture and beautiful design greeted us en route from the airport.

Arriving at the property we witnessed an air traffic control level of coordination across 5 drive through lanes.

We were greeted by multiple bag handlers and brought into the lobby for check-in.
While waiting a brief 15 minutes, a member of reception walked the queue and offered bottled water. There must have been 20 different receptionists checking guests in.

After getting checked in we went up to our room on the 9th floor, room 93 facing the Gardens by the Bay. The room was as luxurious as you would imagine for the price paid. All the amenities you could think of from coffee/tea, a variety of premade alcohol cocktails, snacks and meals, stocked mini fridge, complimentary candies, and all the appropriate drinkware.

The bathroom offered a tub for two, double vanity's, fully stocked Salvatore Ferragamo soaps, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion. Additionally, the vanity drawer was stocked with nail kits, dental kits, hair brush and comb. There was a walk-in shower with a rain forest shower or an angled shower head and a frosted glass door. Right next to it was a motion sensing toilet bidet with a full multifunction control panel and frosted glass door.

The beds were two plush queen sized mattresses and for entertainment and various information availability was a 90 inch TV screen on the wall directly in front of the beds.

The last piece was a walk out balcony with two chairs and a table. The views to the Gardens by the Bay and the overall harbor were incredible and definitely worth the upgrade.

If you have the means I would encourage staying here every time in Singapore if not, book it at least once for a night or two to gain access to the 57th floor rooftop infinity pool. Or you can enjoy one of the many fine dining options.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Singapore is an iconic landmark in the heart of Singapore that is known for its luxurious accommodations, world-class entertainment, and exceptional dining options. This magnificent hotel and entertainment complex is an ambitious project that has set a new standard for hospitality and entertainment in Southeast Asia.

One of the most impressive aspects of Marina Bay Sands is the ambition behind the project. The development of the complex was a massive undertaking that required extensive planning and execution. The result is a breathtaking structure that features three hotel towers, a massive shopping mall, a convention center, a museum, a casino, and a stunning rooftop infinity pool. The sheer scale of the project is a testament to the vision and dedication of the team behind it.

The staff at Marina Bay Sands are another impressive aspect of the complex. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted by friendly and professional staff members who go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. It’s the kind of hotel where you can easily spend the whole day without leaving, but it’s also perfectly located for exploring the city. Overall, it was a wonderful stay!

review_text:
We first stayed at Marina Bay Sands 13 years ago, and this time we returned for just one night. Check-in was smooth and efficient — we received a temporary room card that already gave us access to the pool, which was very convenient. We decided to do some shopping first, and when we returned to collect our official room cards, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been given an upgrade. This gesture was truly appreciated.

As always, the pool and the food were excellent. You have the option to enjoy breakfast either by the pool or downstairs. If you're looking for a large buffet and don’t mind a lively atmosphere, the downstairs option is ideal. However, if you prefer a quieter, more refined experience with a set menu, the poolside breakfast is the better choice.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would be happy to return again in the future.

review_text:
While Marina Bay Sands dazzles visitors with its luxury shopping, world-class restaurants, and breathtaking architecture, my lasting memory comes from a group often overlooked: the housekeeping team.

During what was otherwise a very difficult trip, these professionals became the highlight of my stay. The scale of their work is extraordinary—cleaning massive, high-tech rooms with meticulous precision, restocking coolers and amenities, and ensuring no detail is overlooked, all within tight time frames. As someone with severe OCD, I notice everything, and I was genuinely in awe.

One housekeeper, in particular, came to refill my ice bucket—something I didn’t even need—yet she bowed repeatedly and apologized as though she were inconveniencing me. Her humility and dedication were deeply touching. Later, another staff member surprised me with a vegan birthday cake, complete with a candle. I had forgotten it was even my birthday, but that thoughtful gesture nearly brought me to tears. It wasn’t just a dessert; it was a reminder that I was seen and valued.

In a hotel renowned for grandeur, it’s the quiet diligence of the housekeeping team that, in my view, forms the true backbone of Marina Bay Sands. They made me feel special, cared for, and genuinely welcome. I would return not just for the stunning rooms, but to personally thank and see these remarkable individuals again.

Thank you so much for this experience, it made my birthday trip.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most stunning places I’ve visited in Singapore. That day I spent time walking around, enjoying the view, and taking photos. The architecture is so iconic and the whole place feels elegant and beautifully designed. Even just strolling along the promenade was relaxing and memorable.

What made the day truly unforgettable was having dinner at the rooftop bar, right at the highest point of the building. The view was absolutely breathtaking. I watched the sunset paint the sky in warm colors, followed by a full moon rising above the city skyline. It was one of those moments that just takes your breath away. Everything felt magical. The atmosphere, the view, the food, the soft breeze,  it all came together perfectly.

Whether you’re staying at the hotel or just visiting, this is a place you should not miss. It’s a must-see in Singapore and a memory I’ll always keep with me.

What made the day truly unforgettable was having dinner at the rooftop bar, right at the highest point of the building. The view was absolutely breathtaking. I watched the sunset paint the sky in warm colors, followed by a full moon rising above the city skyline. It was one of those moments that just takes your breath away. Everything felt magical. The atmosphere, the view, the food, the soft breeze,  it all came together perfectly.

Whether you’re staying at the hotel or just visiting, this is a place you should not miss. It’s a must-see in Singapore and a memory I’ll always keep with me.

review_text:
This is one of the iconic spots I always visit when I’m in Singapore, and it totally lives up to the hype. From the moment I walk in, it feels like I’m stepping into something grand, boujee, and massive. The Shoppes here offer luxury shopping at its finest: sleek, shiny, and filled with high-end brands like Chanel, Gucci, and Louis Vuitton. Basically, it’s window-shopping heaven if you’re not there to splurge.

But it’s not all about designer labels. There are great dining options too, from fancy restaurants to casual cafés with beautiful views of the waterfront. And yes, the indoor canal with gondola rides adds a fun, over-the-top touch. There’s also the casino: sleek, expansive, and brimming with indulgences for those who want a premium gaming experience.

Even if you’re not buying anything, it’s a cool spot to stroll, people-watch, and soak in all the glam.

review_text:
We booked a stay at Marina Bay Sands to celebrate my son’s birthday — it was his dream to swim in the infinity pool, and we wanted to make it unforgettable. I booked two suites for our family, kids, and nieces so everyone could be part of the celebration.

The rooms and the pool were simply amazing, and the kids had the time of their lives. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service, especially from Erica, who gave us a check-in experience unlike anything I’ve had before.

We were greeted right at the car and taken directly to our suite, where the kids were welcomed with chocolates and apples. While the little ones ran around, excited and full of joy, my family and I completed the check-in formalities in the comfort of our room — no queues, no waiting, just pure ease.

From start to finish, everything about our stay was thoughtful, seamless, and special. Thank you, Marina Bay Sands, for making my son’s birthday a memory we will cherish forever.

She went above and beyond to ensure every detail of my stay was seamless. Thank you, Christine, for making my visit truly special. I hope the management recognizes the incredible asset they have in you!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is truly a symbol of Singapore, and it’s a place I visit every year.

With so many rooms and guests, compared to other hotels of the same class, it doesn’t give the feeling of personalized care while moving around the hotel. However, the service at the lobby and concierge is excellent.

A few years ago, the hotel underwent a major renovation, and the rooms have been updated to a higher standard, which I’m really happy with. Since COVID, hotel prices in Singapore have risen across the board, and Marina Bay Sands is no exception. It’s now hard to find a room for under $700 a night.

Still, the signature infinity pool is something you just can’t miss :) I often bring guests here, and the growing number of F&B outlets offers a variety of options, which is very satisfying.

Staying at Marina Bay Sands was truly a dream come true! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was blown away by the sheer elegance and attention to detail, the grand space, the warm lighting, and the stunning arrangements of pink lilies that filled the air with the most amazing fragrance. It set the tone for an unforgettable stay.

The service was beyond exceptional. Every staff member I met was warm, professional, and genuinely eager to make my experience perfect. The room was a sanctuary, spacious, spotless, and boasting breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline. The bed was so comfortable, it felt like sleeping on a cloud, and every amenity was thoughtfully provided.

And then, the infinity pool… absolutely surreal! Swimming above the city, watching the sunset paint the skyline in gold and pink hues, was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. It felt like pure magic.

The location couldn’t be better, with easy access to everything Singapore has to offer. From start to finish, everything was flawless. This wasn’t just a stay; it was a memory I’ll cherish forever. Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel, it’s an experience of a lifetime!!

If you’re considering it, don’t think twice. Absolute perfection! I can’t wait to return.

review_text: I stayed in the Sands Bay Suite King with the Gardens by the Bay view, and it was pure luxury from start to finish. The suite was spacious and elegantly designed. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the walk-in wardrobe was a nice luxurious bonus. Being right in the heart of the city during the F1 weekend made the stay even more exciting, watching the city come alive with the race vibes was unforgettable. The rooftop infinity pool was breathtaking — swimming there with the city skyline all around felt like something out of a dream. review_text:
Every time I visit Marina Bay Sands, it just never gets old. The whole place has that wow factor — from the architecture to the views to the atmosphere. Whether you’re here to dine, shop, relax, or just walk around and take in the sights, it really feels like you’re in the heart of Singapore.

I’ve been here a few times, sometimes just to chill with colleagues or bring visiting friends around. The vibe is classy but still welcoming. The views from the observation deck or even just around the promenade area are incredible, especially at night when the skyline lights up.

Even if you’re not staying at the hotel, there’s so much to explore — the Shoppes, the food court, the canal, and of course the light and water show outside. It’s one of those places you always end up coming back to, whether for the experience or to just enjoy the scenery.

review_text:
1. The Landscape – Clean, Refined, and Aesthetically Pleasing

What struck me most upon arriving in Singapore was how neatly orchestrated everything felt — as if every corner had been thoughtfully composed. The city is meticulously planned yet still breathes with nature. Green spaces are not just “added in,” they’re woven into the very fabric of the urban environment — from vast parks to rooftop gardens and tree-lined streets.

Each district has its own flavor: Marina Bay is sleek and futuristic, Arab Street is a burst of color and culture, while Gardens by the Bay feels like stepping into a dream where technology and nature intertwine.

2. Singapore at Night – Where the City Truly Shines

If Singapore in the daytime is a pristine canvas, then nighttime turns it into a masterpiece. As the sun sets, the city transforms — illuminated by thousands of lights that reflect off glass towers and gentle waterways.

Key landmarks like Marina Bay Sands, Clarke Quay, Helix Bridge, and the lotus-shaped ArtScience Museum light up in ways that feel almost cinematic. Walking along the Singapore River at night, you can’t help but slow down — not from tiredness, but from awe. The “Spectra” light and water show at Marina Bay isn’t just a spectacle — it’s a moment that stays with you.

3. The Rhythm of Life – Energetic, Yet Graceful

Despite being a hub of finance, tech, and tourism, Singapore doesn’t feel overwhelming. People move quickly, but not anxiously. The city runs with purpose but still feels respectful, clean, and kind.

There’s a deep sense of order and mindfulness in how locals interact with public spaces — how they queue, how they keep the streets spotless, how they balance modern life with cultural roots. It's a quiet discipline that leaves a lasting impression.

review_text:
We were so excited to be staying at the Sand’s as we had heard so many good things about it.

We arrived at the hotel and went to check in. Maybe 3 reception stations were open with about 2-3 employees at each one. It felt like an airport check in.

After standing in line for around 10minutes we were told to go to a back room to check in. The lady who checked us in was incredibly unfriendly. If she smiled it would have cracked her face.

Room was very nice but small. View was great until you looked down to the ground and they were doing construction. They don’t tell you this when you check in to a room with the garden view.

We were told our bags would arrive within 15-20min after checking in. After 30min I called front desk and I was told they were on the way up. 30min after that call luggage never arrived. I then called again and told them I was coming down to reception to collect the bags.

They once again told me the bags are on the way up. 10min later the bags arrived.

We headed up to the observation deck and it was like stepping foot into a disaster camp. As soon as you exit the elevator staff with cameras try and con you to take photos for money. This was really irritating and they blocked the entire walk way to the outer deck.

You had people sleeping all over the chairs and deck floor. There was even people having picnics with food out on the deck. So tacky.

Went and asked for information at the desk and again a stone cold faced women barely spoke to us.

For the price they charge and the service they provide it is not worth it. Staff are rude and the place is like an airport terminal.

review_text:
I had a very disappointing dining experience at the restaurant on the 55th floor of this supposedly “luxury” hotel.

I was invited to dinner by a friend who was staying in one of the VIP suites. The restaurant is not open to the public and is exclusively for hotel guests, which made the experience feel even more exclusive—until the service completely ruined it.

Shortly after we began our meal, a staff member informed us that the dining time was limited to 90 minutes. That seemed fine at first. However, well before the 90 minutes were up, we were rushed by the same staff to finish our meal. I politely asked if we could have a little more time, as we were still eating slowly, and I noticed that two other tables who arrived before us were still enjoying their meals as well.

Eventually, they agreed to extend our time by 30 minutes and sent another staff member to apologize. I then asked again, “Isn’t the restaurant open until a certain time? Can guests eat until closing?” The person who came to apologize said, “Yes, you can stay and dine until the end.” So why was I being pushed out before our time was even up?

What shocked me the most was the attitude of the first staff member—it felt cold and unwelcoming, as if we were not entitled to be there. Was it because we weren’t the registered guests, but just friends of a VIP guest? If so, that kind of discriminatory service is completely unacceptable in a hotel of this standard.

The environment and view were wonderful, but the service left a sour taste. Dining should be about hospitality and respect, and unfortunately, this experience had neither. I hope management takes this feedback seriously—this is not the level of service one expects a high-end establishment。

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of those places you have to experience at least once in Singapore — it’s more than just a hotel, it’s an icon. The views from the rooftop are legendary, but here’s the insider tip: instead of paying for a full-day pass, make a reservation at one of the rooftop bars or restaurants. That way, you get the same incredible skyline without overspending. Sometimes staff will let you walk around after dining, but it’s not guaranteed — so booking a drink or meal is the safest bet.

The food here is truly exceptional. From high-end restaurants to casual bites, everything feels curated, and you don’t have to break the bank if you plan wisely. Downstairs, the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands mall is stunning — a mix of luxury brands, unique boutiques, and even a canal with gondola rides. Don’t miss the wine and whisky collection store; it’s like walking into a museum of rare bottles.

At night, the free Spectra light and water show at 8:00 and 9:00 PM outside the mall is a must-see — a dazzling blend of fountains, lasers, and music against the backdrop of the bay. Inside the hotel, the architecture itself is an experience: the world’s largest rooftop infinity pool (hotel guests only), soaring lobbies, and restaurants that rival any luxury destination.

Fun facts:
•	Marina Bay Sands opened in 2010 and cost around $5.5 billion USD to build.
•	The rooftop SkyPark spans all three towers and could fit four and a half A380 planes end to end.
•	The infinity pool is the longest elevated pool in the world at 150m.

Tip: Book a restaurant in advance for sunset, explore the mall before or after, and stay for the evening light show. It’s one of the few luxury experiences where you control how much you spend — and it’s worth every minute.

The food here is truly exceptional. From high-end restaurants to casual bites, everything feels curated, and you don’t have to break the bank if you plan wisely. Downstairs, the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands mall is stunning — a mix of luxury brands, unique boutiques, and even a canal with gondola rides. Don’t miss the wine and whisky collection store; it’s like walking into a museum of rare bottles.

At night, the free Spectra light and water show at 8:00 and 9:00 PM outside the mall is a must-see — a dazzling blend of fountains, lasers, and music against the backdrop of the bay. Inside the hotel, the architecture itself is an experience: the world’s largest rooftop infinity pool (hotel guests only), soaring lobbies, and restaurants that rival any luxury destination.

Fun facts:
•	Marina Bay Sands opened in 2010 and cost around $5.5 billion USD to build.
•	The rooftop SkyPark spans all three towers and could fit four and a half A380 planes end to end.
•	The infinity pool is the longest elevated pool in the world at 150m.

Tip: Book a restaurant in advance for sunset, explore the mall before or after, and stay for the evening light show. It’s one of the few luxury experiences where you control how much you spend — and it’s worth every minute.

review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Staying at Marina Bay Sands was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience that exceeded every expectation I had. From the moment I walked into the grand lobby, I could already feel that this was not just a hotel, but a world-class destination in itself. The scale, the design, and the atmosphere are breathtaking. Everything is built with such attention to detail that you immediately know you’re in one of the most iconic hotels in the world.

The highlight, of course, is the infinity pool at the SkyPark. I’ve seen it countless times in photos and videos, but being there in person is something else entirely. Swimming at the edge while overlooking the Singapore skyline is surreal—it feels like floating above the entire city. Day or night, the view is spectacular. In the morning, you get the calm and fresh energy of the city waking up, and at night, you’re treated to a dazzling skyline with lights that make the entire experience magical. It’s easily the most unforgettable pool I’ve ever been to.

The rooms are spacious, modern, and luxuriously comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows give you an unbeatable view, whether it’s the Gardens by the Bay or the city skyline. The beds are so comfortable that it’s almost difficult to get up in the morning—except you know you don’t want to waste any time staying in when you’re in such an amazing place. The bathroom amenities are top-notch, and everything feels meticulously maintained and spotless.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is also an experience of its own. The selection of restaurants is phenomenal, from celebrity chef restaurants to local-inspired cuisine, ensuring there’s something for everyone. Every meal feels like part of the luxury experience, with flavors that are memorable and presentation that’s on point. The staff across all the restaurants are highly professional, attentive, and genuinely welcoming.

What makes Marina Bay Sands stand out even more is the service. Every staff member I interacted with—from reception, concierge, housekeeping, to the restaurants—was friendly, helpful, and professional. They really go the extra mile to make guests feel taken care of, which is the hallmark of true 5-star hospitality.

Beyond being a hotel, Marina Bay Sands is practically a city within a city. The integrated resort has luxury shopping, the ArtScience Museum, theaters, and direct access to Gardens by the Bay, making it incredibly convenient to explore. The location is unbeatable, with everything you need either within the resort or just a short walk away.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel stay—it’s an experience. It’s luxurious, iconic, and unforgettable in every sense. Whether you’re traveling for leisure, business, or a special occasion, this place leaves a lasting impression that you’ll treasure for a lifetime. If you want to experience the best of Singapore, there’s no better place than Marina Bay Sands. Absolutely worth every dollar, and I can’t wait to come back again.

review_text:
A Review of the Sands Premier Suite at Marina Bay Sands
If you’re looking for a rejuvenating, luxurious holiday then you should definitely consider a stay at the prestigious Marina Bay Sands hotel!
Recently, me and my family had an amazing experience staying in the Sands Premier Suite of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff were very helpful and polite. They immediately helped us with our luggages which made me felt very welcome.
The entire hotel, from the ceiling to the walls are designed with lots of thoughts in mind. Because we arrived way earlier than the check-in time, they arranged a temporary key so we could enjoy the infinity pool while waiting. From the infinity pool, you could see the whole skyline of Singapore. The water temperature is just cool enough to make you feel relaxed but warm enough so that you won’t have a hard time getting out.
After lunch, we came back to check-in and receive our room keys. They had 3 check-in counters, the “normal” one, the VIP one and the Paiza & Limosine one (which is like the Super VIP one). Because the “normal” check in counter was way too long, we got escorted to the Paiza & Limosine to check in. The receptionist there are very kind and quick, she got us our room in less than 5 minutes. Even though I booked the Sands Premier Studio, we got upgraded to the Sands Premier Suite (for free!).
The room was much bigger than a standard hotel room, with a separate living area that had a comfortable sofa and a large TV. The bedroom was also spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. I really liked the floor-to-ceiling windows, which offered a stunning view of either the city skyline or the Gardens by the Bay. I chose the city view, and it was breathtaking, especially at night.
The bathroom was very modern and felt like a spa. It had a big bathtub for two people, which was a nice touch. They also provided very nice toiletries from Jo Malone. The room also had a walk-in wardrobe, which was very useful for keeping the room tidy and getting ready.
In conclusion, I would highly recommend the Sands Premier Suite. It’s a very luxurious option that offers excellent comfort, great amenities, and beautiful views. While it is quite expensive, the experience is worth it if you are looking for a special treat.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is, without a doubt, one of the most spectacular hotel experiences I’ve ever had. From the moment you walk into the grand lobby, you’re immersed in luxury, elegance, and impeccable service.

The infinity pool on the 57th floor is every bit as iconic as it looks in the photos—floating above the city skyline, it offers jaw-dropping panoramic views of Singapore. Watching the sunrise from the pool with a coffee in hand was pure magic.

My room was spacious, sleek, and sophisticated, with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking either the bay or the city. Every detail felt premium—from the plush bedding to the advanced tech and luxurious bathroom amenities.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a culinary journey. I had the pleasure of enjoying a world-class dinner at one of the celebrity chef restaurants and also loved the more casual options throughout the property. The buffet breakfast alone is worth writing home about—an incredible spread that caters to every taste.

The hotel is also in the perfect location—connected to high-end shops, the ArtScience Museum, and just steps from Gardens by the Bay. Whether you want to shop, sightsee, or just unwind in style, everything you need is right there.

It’s definitely a luxury stay with a luxury price tag, but in my opinion, it’s absolutely worth it for the once-in-a-lifetime experience. Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel—it’s a destination.

review_text:
Got nothing to do during night in Singapore? Try marina bay!

It's a really really good place to enjoy the evening and experience the night life in Singapore. Take a walk around the marina bay and seeing all the crowds and lights are really hyping you up.
The skyline is also amazing here, you can spend the night just chilling watching the skyline or seeing what the crowds are up to, sometimes there's a performance from dance groups all over the city there.

One thing that you shouldn't miss is definitely the spektra light show. It's an amazing light show with water and laser projectors creating an amazing show that runs about 10-15 minutes. A perfect night with family or partner

review_text:
Didn’t get a chance to stay at Marina Bay Sands, but just seeing it from the outside was a stunning experience. The architecture is iconic and instantly recognizable — it truly dominates the Singapore skyline in the most elegant way.

The way the SkyPark spans across the three towers is incredible to see up close. At night, the building comes alive with beautiful lights and reflections on the bay. The surrounding area is also lively with great views, walkways, and photo spots.

Even without staying inside, it’s a landmark worth visiting — a must-see when in Singapore.

review_text:
From the moment you step into Marina Bay Sands, you’re wrapped in pure luxury. Every detail is meticulously thought out — from the grand lobby with its sweeping architecture to the impeccable service that anticipates your every need. The rooms are elegant and spacious, with breathtaking views of the city skyline or the bay, and the plush beds make it hard to leave.

The iconic infinity pool alone is worth the stay — floating at the top of the world with Singapore stretched out before you feels like a dream. The restaurants are world-class, offering everything from fine dining to global cuisines, all served with precision and flair.

Whether you're shopping in the high-end boutiques, relaxing at the spa, or simply soaking in the beauty of the design, Marina Bay Sands doesn’t miss a beat. It’s more than just a hotel — it’s an experience in flawless luxury and stunning attention to detail. Absolutely gorgeous from top to bottom.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Mall is truly a world-class shopping experience. From the moment you step in, the architecture grabs your attention  tall glass ceilings, polished marble floors, and a layout that blends elegance with ease. It feels more like walking through a luxury art gallery than a mall.

The range of shops is impressive from global designer labels like Louis Vuitton and Gucci to fine watch boutiques,handbags and jewelry stores. If you want to treat your self with luxury brands ,this is the place.

One of the best parts for me was the canal inside the mall, where you can take a gondola ride a lovely touch if you want something different. The waterfall feature in the middle adds to the charm.

The food options are diverse: from high end restaurants to casual bites and a food court downstairs with local and international cuisines.

The location is ideal too connected to Marina Bay Sands hotel, ArtScience Museum, and just a walk away from the Gardens by the Bay and the Spectra Light Show.

review_text:
This is a review of MBS Hotel’s newly launched Aperitif Hour at 6 different restaurants based at MBS
————————————————————————-
In Jun 2025, MBS launched the Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ) at 6 restaurants based at MBS hotel and mall. This replaces the Evening Canapés ( which was available only at MBS hotel ).

The Aperitif Hour ( 5pm-7pm ), plus Breakfast ( 6.30am-10am ) and afternoon tea ( 3pm-5pm ) are made available FOC to guests staying in certain room types.

In the past 5 weeks, I have tried 5 of the restaurants that participated in the Aperitif Hour. Of the 5 restaurants, I tried 2 of them twice, because they are just so good.

My reviews, in descending order of ranking , are as follows :-

1.Bread Street Kitchen ( BSK )
———————————————-
I tried BSK twice over 5 weeks.
Of all the Aperitif Hour participating restaurants, this is the BEST ! 👍👍👍

Even though it was only 5pm, the restaurant has a busy and vibrant feel, with courteous staff attending to the needs of diners, who are happily chatting away. This is a happy place 😀😀😀.

Being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, the food is, of course, very good. I am very happy that they served their in-house focaccia bread ( with humus ) first, before the arrival of our main orders of Sunday Roast Yorkies, Mini Fish & Chips, and Wagyu Burger Sliders. The delicious focaccia and humus makes the wait for the main orders so much bearable 😜.

Even though it is supposed to be Aperitif Hour, the food BSK served is of such a good size that we skipped dinner thereafter.

The Wagyu Burger Sliders are so good, that we ordered it both times we are there. ( My dining companion thinks it can give Cut’s Wagyu Sliders a run for their money, but I have to, ahem, differ lah 😅 ).

Even though we did not order any alcoholic beverages ( it’s part of the package ), I note they have a wide selection for connoisseurs. The non-alcoholic Ginger De Pooh, and Belini Junior are refreshingly good.

I will return to BSK for Aperitif Hour or a main meal during my next stay at MBS. 😋😋😋

2.Wakuda
—————-
I also tried Wakuda twice over 5 weeks.

Wakuda has an understated and quiet elegance. At 5pm, it’s not crowded or busy ( unlike BSK ), and I think many diners may like Wakuda exactly for that.

Being a sister restaurant to Waku Ghin, its food is very good. I have dined there many times, so having Aperitif Hour at Wakuda allows me to have a different experience there.

I really like their Wagyu Cigar, which is yummy 😋. Their Karage Chicken is extra crispy and delicious .

Wakuda is a really good restaurant.
I will definitely return for a sumptuous dinner with close friends and family… soon.

3.Koma
————-
When I am served with the food , I am blown away by their presentation… it came on a mini version of their iconic bridge ( which is the backdrop of countless photos of many diners there ). What a nice touch. 👍

We had the Aperitif Hour at the Bar Lounge instead of the main dining area. The wagyu slider is very good but the portions are relatively small.

I look forward to return to Koma for a main meal again.

4.Yardbird
——————
The quality of the food is good, and the portions are big enough that I skipped dinner thereafter.

I am surprised by the quality and spread of the food at Yardbird, which I have never visited before. I may now visit Yardbird in the near future.
At 5pm, the restaurant is relativity quiet.

5.Maison Boulud
—————————
When I arrived at 5pm, the service staff  assigned me a seat near a window which is scorching hot from the afternoon sun.

The food portions are very small and the quality average.

The restaurant itself is very quiet, with only 2 staff serving customers at 5pm.

Comments
——————-
The newly introduced Aperitif Hour is a brilliant idea !!!

This gives the hotel guests a chance to try the excellent food served by the restaurants based at the mall and hotel. Also, it provides the restaurants some business during the quiet hour of 5pm-6pm. A win-win-win for all. 👍👍👍

I look forward to Aperitif Hour being introduced at Cut, Spago, Black Tap etc. 😀😀😀

review_text: We had to checkin early because of our flight and upgraded to a suite which was the best decision ever. This hotel is the definition of a 5 star. You really need a whole day or two just to explore the hotel. Its massive! And the hospitality is amazing 🤩

review_text:
This hotel is perfect. Check in couldn’t have been more helpful. We were given and upgrade as it was my birthday along and as we were just staying one night and had a late flight the next day we were offered a replacement keycard for the next day to access the facilities as well as a bookable shower room so we could freshen up before heading to the airport.

The room was not huge but was so comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was gorgeous and everything felt fresh and brand new. The tech worked well including wireless charging on the night stands, auto opening curtains and the largest tv I have ever seen in a hotel room.

We had a great view of the city but immediately changed to try out the infinity pool which is better than I could have ever imagined. The staff are kind but some of the servers could do with a little more training as quite a few mistakes were made. Food and drinks came from nearby Wolfgang Puck Spago and even simple things such as a Caesar salad or burger were really excellent.

It is open 6am until midnight and we went three times to visit. Don’t forget the hot tubs on the other side of the pool deck.

The hotel itself is absolutely huge and has a large number of restaurants within it, also a massive shopping mall, nightclub and casino. It is a city within a city.

It is also close to Gardens on the Bay and a walkway goes through the hotel towards it. But you can’t access the walkway from the hotel and have to exit the hotel and take a small lift and then walk back into the hotel at walkway level. A small detail.

The location is not great for the city but there is a metro stop nearby and of course it is perfect for all the attractions around the Marina Bay. One day was not enough. I can’t wait to go back.

review_text:
Went to access this hotel while on my recent Singapore stay.
I didn't stay at the hotel, so am not offering a critique of the rooms/suites.
At 11.45-12pm, the lobby/foyer was insanely busy, there were hundreds of people checking in/out or hanging around.  Only black taxis( the expensive ones) were around and the valet and doormen were over whelmed. When I was leaving the cost for the black taxi to go to the airport was insane.
Overall, the crowd put me off immediately to even consider staying at this hotel.
There are so many instructions on how to get around the hotel, and which lifts to use.
I chose to have lunch at the foyer restaurant, as it's seafood buffet had been suggested to me. The restaurant is nice and the staff wonderful. The selection in the multi cuisine buffet stations is excellent, unfortunately with the exception of the seafood station. Prawns, lobster, crayfish, scallops arrive frozen from origin, then thawed and place on ice. All these were soggy, tasteless and chewy. I would avoid these.
The Sushi/Sashimi station is excellent.
The food in rest of the stations was also excellent.
I visited the pool, which was again very crowded. I don't care how good a view a pool has, the crowd here was intolerable.
The top level restaurants and bars have a lovely view, so lunch or dinner would be a nice experience.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort and landmark located in Singapore. It's a massive complex that has become a major destination for business, leisure, and entertainment.
Key Features and Attractions
* Three Cascading Towers: The resort's most distinctive feature is its three hotel towers, topped by the Sands SkyPark.
* Sands SkyPark: This extraordinary rooftop platform connects the three towers and offers a 360-degree panoramic view of the city. It's home to the world-famous Infinity Pool, as well as restaurants, bars, and a public observation deck.
* Infinity Pool: The iconic 150-meter-long infinity pool is the world's largest at that height. Access to the pool is exclusive to hotel guests.
* The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands: A luxury shopping mall featuring a wide range of high-end international brands. You can also take a Sampan boat ride along the indoor canal within the mall.
* ArtScience Museum: The museum's unique lotus-inspired design hosts permanent and rotating exhibits that explore the intersection of art and science.
* Sands Expo and Convention Centre: A major facility for meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibitions (MICE).
* Casino: A large casino with a wide selection of gaming tables and slot machines.
* Celebrity Chef Restaurants: The resort is home to a number of acclaimed restaurants run by world-renowned chefs.
* Spectra Light and Water Show: A nightly outdoor light and water show at the Event Plaza, which is free to the public.
Nearby Attractions
Marina Bay Sands is situated in a prime location with easy access to other major Singapore attractions, including:
* Gardens by the Bay: A stunning futuristic park known for its Supertree Grove and cooled conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest).
* Helix Bridge: A unique pedestrian bridge with an architectural design inspired by the structure of DNA.
* Merlion Park: Home to the mythical Merlion statue, a symbol of Singapore.
* Singapore Flyer: A giant observation wheel that offers breathtaking views of the city.
Practical Information
* Hotel Access: To use the famous rooftop infinity pool, you must be a registered guest of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
* Observation Deck: The Sands SkyPark Observation Deck is open to the public for a fee, offering a chance to see the views without being a hotel guest and get a glimpse of the pool.
* Getting Around: The location is well-connected by Singapore's excellent public transportation system, including the MRT (subway) station at Bayfront.

* Infinity Pool: The iconic 150-meter-long infinity pool is the world's largest at that height. Access to the pool is exclusive to hotel guests.
* The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands: A luxury shopping mall featuring a wide range of high-end international brands. You can also take a Sampan boat ride along the indoor canal within the mall.
* ArtScience Museum: The museum's unique lotus-inspired design hosts permanent and rotating exhibits that explore the intersection of art and science.
* Sands Expo and Convention Centre: A major facility for meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibitions (MICE).
* Casino: A large casino with a wide selection of gaming tables and slot machines.
* Celebrity Chef Restaurants: The resort is home to a number of acclaimed restaurants run by world-renowned chefs.
* Spectra Light and Water Show: A nightly outdoor light and water show at the Event Plaza, which is free to the public.
Nearby Attractions
Marina Bay Sands is situated in a prime location with easy access to other major Singapore attractions, including:
* Gardens by the Bay: A stunning futuristic park known for its Supertree Grove and cooled conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest).
* Helix Bridge: A unique pedestrian bridge with an architectural design inspired by the structure of DNA.
* Merlion Park: Home to the mythical Merlion statue, a symbol of Singapore.
* Singapore Flyer: A giant observation wheel that offers breathtaking views of the city.
Practical Information
* Hotel Access: To use the famous rooftop infinity pool, you must be a registered guest of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
* Observation Deck: The Sands SkyPark Observation Deck is open to the public for a fee, offering a chance to see the views without being a hotel guest and get a glimpse of the pool.
* Getting Around: The location is well-connected by Singapore's excellent public transportation system, including the MRT (subway) station at Bayfront.

review_text:
Our visit to Marina Bay Sands was a memorable one, especially the experience of going to the top and witnessing the spectacular views of Singapore’s skyline. The coordination by the staff was commendable. Although we initially faced a small issue with our ticket not scanning properly, the team handled it with genuine warmth and professionalism. They reassured us not to worry, quickly sorted out the problem, and welcomed us with a friendly smile, which really set the tone for a great experience.

Once we reached the top, the view was undeniably impressive—stretching across iconic landmarks like the Singapore Flyer, Gardens by the Bay, and the endless expanse of city and sea. Everything was immaculately maintained, from the observation deck to the common areas. Cleanliness and upkeep clearly seem to be a top priority here.

That said, there are a few areas where the experience could be elevated further. Tourists today look for more interactive and immersive elements. Simple additions—like informative or engaging video displays inside the lifts (similar to what Burj Khalifa offers)—can really enhance the journey upward. Even having touch-screen installations at the top showcasing the history or stories of the buildings in view could add value.

Also, visiting during the daytime can be quite uncomfortable due to the harsh sun and heat. Some shaded or misted zones, or even cooling stations, would allow visitors to enjoy their time without feeling the need to rush through it.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands offers an iconic view, with a great team on the ground—but with just a few tweaks, it could offer a more memorable and comfortable experience for all.

review_text:
This was the highlight of my Singapore trip in early 2024.
Marina Bay Sands truly earns every single star of its 5 star rating.
The rooms are spacious, spotless & the main lobby is huge.
The service is top notch. We only stayed there for 1 night as it's quite expensive & I'm usually quite a budget conscious person, so I don't usually stay at 5 star hotels, but the MBS hotel service is second to none. After getting there, we were immediately offered assistance with our luggage by staff, which was brought upstairs for us. The check in & check out process is seamless & straight-forward.
I'm not a gambler, so I didn't go to the casino, but I do like to keep my fitness up whilst I'm away, so I do recommend their gym. It is a fair walk from the rooms, but the variety of equipment was fantastic & it's a 24 hour gym too.
Obviously, you also can't go past the Infinity Pool whilst you're at MBS. Just remember to take your hotel key card with you when you go up.
Overall, despite the high price tag, I do recommend MBS if you do stay in Singapore, even if it's just for 1 night.

review_text:
I stayed at Marina Bay Sands from July 3rd for five days and four nights with my family. Unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience.

On the first day, we waited for two full hours during check-in because the hotel said our room had a smoke odor. As compensation, we were given USD 150.

However, on the second night, we noticed the room still had a strong smell of smoke. The manager brought in a machine, saying it used a “natural solution” to remove the odor. I told them this was unacceptable—we have a child, and we couldn’t tolerate this for the rest of our holiday. I requested a room change or an upgrade, but the manager only said they would report it and then completely ignored us afterward.

This is the second time this year we’ve stayed here as a family, but sadly, it will be the last. A hotel of this level should take better care of its guests.

review_text: Booked a staycation for my parents birthdays and anniversary this August. We were warmly greeted by the hotel staffs upon arrival, and a heartfelt compliment goes to Tiffany Tan who was the concierge staff that attended to us and settled our check-in. We were pleasantly surprised when Tiffany had offered a room upgrade to celebrate the occasion if we don’t mind waiting a bit longer to get the room ready. Whilst waiting she offered temporary guest cards so they have access to the observation deck and pool which was much nicer than waiting at the lobby. On top of that, we also found a delicious chocolate cake in the room! My parents were beyond delighted by this sweet gesture, and I can’t thank Tiffany enough for being so attentive in making this absolutely memorable for them. The room was of course immaculate, the view stunning and the experience exceeded expectations. They enjoyed their stay and will definitely be back! Thank you once again to the amazing team at MBS.

review_text:
The design and architecture of Marina Bay Danza are truly impressive – the property is visually stunning and very well thought out in terms of style. Unfortunately, the overall experience does not match the beauty of the place.

Service is consistently poor, with little attention to guest needs and very limited customer care. The room amenities are disappointing for a property of this level, making the stay far less comfortable than expected.

The pool area looks beautiful at first glance, but quickly becomes a letdown. There are no sunshades provided, the sunbeds are placed extremely close to each other with no sense of privacy, and once again the service around the pool is lacking.

In short, while Marina Bay Danza scores highly for design and atmosphere, it falls short in almost every other aspect that makes a stay in a 5 star hotel.

review_text:
Had an amazing wedding anniversary stay on  at Marina Bay Sands! Huge thanks to Aini at the front desk for the warm welcome, and to Ryan the pool lifeguard for being so friendly. Santhosh from housekeeping quickly sent up items when we needed them. The Express Service team from the call centre was super helpful and responsive throughout our stay.
We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms, and it was fantastic—the suite featured a curated design, spotless finishes, and upscale smart tech. It came with a Dyson hairdryer in the closet, an automated smart toilet (it opens the lid as you approach!), and wireless charging pads built right within the tabletop. The room was absolutely spotless and super comfortable.
A special shoutout to the Front office team and in‑room dining team for arranging a cake and red wine to celebrate our wedding anniversary—such a thoughtful and memorable gesture. Thanks to everyone for making our stay truly exceptional!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Hotel Suites: The Best Birthday Ever! (4.5/5 stars)

Ratings:

•	Accommodation: 5/5 (Breathtaking suite, spacious, impeccably designed, stunning views, plush furnishings)

•	Service: 4.5/5 (Generally impeccable, friendly and attentive staff, minor delay in room service)

•	Amenities: 5/5 (Exceptional dining options, unforgettable Sands Skypark infinity pool)

•	Overall: 4.5/5

The best birthday ever! My amazing boyfriend, Donkey, surprised me with a stay at the luxurious MBS Hotel Suites, and the entire experience was pure bliss! From the moment we arrived, we were enveloped in an atmosphere of unparalleled elegance and sophistication. The suite itself was breathtaking & spacious, impeccably designed, and boasting floor to ceiling windows offering stunning panoramic views of the city skyline and Gardens by the Bay. The plush furnishings, state of the art amenities (I especially loved the deep-soaking tub!), and the sheer opulence of the space created an unforgettable experience. Simply relaxing and enjoying the breathtaking views was pure bliss. The service was generally impeccable, the staff were friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with a smile. Dining at one of the hotel's many exceptional restaurants was a highlight, and the Sands Skypark infinity pool provided an unforgettable backdrop for a celebratory swim.  The only minor drawback was a slight delay in room service, we requested shower gel via the in-room TV system and waited approximately 45 minutes before having to call directly to expedite the request. However, this small inconvenience was easily overshadowed by the overall magnificence of our stay. Overall, the MBS Hotel Suites delivered an extraordinary experience, making it the most memorable birthday celebration ever. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking a truly luxurious and unforgettable getaway.

review_text:
An Unforgettable Experience at Marina Bay, Singapore!

Marina Bay is truly the heart of modern Singapore. The skyline is absolutely breathtaking, especially at night when the city lights reflect beautifully off the bay. The entire area is impeccably clean, safe, and well-organized—perfect for a relaxing stroll or a romantic evening.

Highlights for me included the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark with its stunning panoramic views, the Spectra Light & Water Show, and the Gardens by the Bay, especially the Supertree Grove. There's also fantastic dining nearby, from street food to fine restaurants with amazing views.

It’s a perfect blend of nature, technology, and luxury. Whether you’re a tourist or a local, Marina Bay offers something memorable for everyone. Highly recommended!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel — it's an experience.

From the moment you walk into the grand lobby, you're treated to luxury, modern elegance, and world-class service. The iconic three-tower structure connected by the SkyPark is an architectural marvel and a symbol of Singapore itself.

🌟 Highlights:

✅ Infinity Pool – The rooftop infinity pool on the 57th floor is everything it’s hyped up to be. The view of Singapore’s skyline while floating in the pool is unforgettable and perfect for photos. (Note: pool access is for hotel guests only.)

✅ Location – Perfectly located at Marina Bay with direct access to Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. Everything is walkable or connected via MRT.

✅ Rooms – Spacious, clean, and luxuriously comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows offer stunning city or bay views. Bathrooms are high-end and well-stocked.

✅ Dining – From celebrity chef restaurants (Gordon Ramsay, Wolfgang Puck, etc.) to food courts and local cuisine, there’s something for every palate and budget.

✅ Shopping & Entertainment – Endless luxury shopping, live shows, the casino, and even Sampan rides indoors! It's impossible to be bored.

✅ Staff & Service – Professional, friendly, and attentive. Check-in and check-out are smooth even when the hotel is busy.

review_text:
To celebrate Kitty's birthday, I treated us to a suite at the iconic Marina Bay Sands, and it was an absolutely unforgettable experience. Knowing the suite was a significant investment, we decided to maximize our time indulging in the luxurious amenities and breathtaking views from our room. While we did venture out, we primarily focused on enjoying the comfort and elegance of our suite, interspersed with a special dinner at the Paiza Sky Residence.

The suite itself was incredibly spacious and elegantly appointed, offering stunning panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay. Kitty particularly loved the sheer size of the room, commenting on how much space there was to relax and unwind. The luxurious bedding and amenities were top-notch, but what truly impressed her was the luxurious bathroom. The enormous bathtub with a built-in jacuzzi was a standout feature, and the in-built bathroom TV added an extra touch of luxury.  She spent a considerable amount of time luxuriating in the tub, enjoying the jets and the in-bathroom entertainment.  We also made use of the in-room karaoke system (KTV), enjoying a fun and relaxing night of singing.

Our dinner at the Paiza Sky Residence was, without a doubt, a highlight. The service was impeccable, the food exquisite, and the ambience sophisticated and elegant. The panoramic views from the Sky Residence were equally stunning, offering a different perspective on the city skyline compared to our suite.

Even the little details were impressive. Kitty particularly enjoyed the high-quality toiletries provided. The  body lotion, hair shampoo, and conditioner all smelled divine. The complimentary drinks and fresh fruit in the room were a welcome touch. Everything was immaculately clean and seamlessly arranged, adding to the overall luxurious experience.

While we did briefly explore The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands and the SkyPark Observation Deck having a short swin at the infinity pool, the majority of our stay was spent luxuriating in our suite and enjoying the exceptional dining experience at the Sky Residence. It was a splurge, but for a special occasion like Kitty's birthday, it was absolutely worth it.

review_text:
If you’re visiting Singapore and looking for an unforgettable experience, Marina Bay Sands is the place to be. From the moment you step inside, it’s clear why this hotel is one of the most iconic landmarks in the world.

The architecture alone is a marvel — three soaring towers connected by the breathtaking SkyPark, which offers panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay. The infinity pool on the rooftop is perhaps the most famous in the world, and swimming there feels like floating above the city.

Rooms are spacious, modern, and impeccably maintained, with floor-to-ceiling windows that bring the stunning skyline right into your suite. The service is top-tier, blending warmth and professionalism in true Singaporean fashion.

What makes Marina Bay Sands truly unique is its integration with luxury retail, entertainment, and dining. The hotel is connected to a high-end shopping mall featuring the most prestigious brands globally — Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Dior, and more — along with a curated selection of fine dining from celebrity chefs like Gordon Ramsay and Wolfgang Puck.

The casino, ArtScience Museum, and regular light shows at the Spectra waterfront add even more dimension to your stay, whether you’re here for business or leisure

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most iconic and breathtaking destinations in Singapore — a true architectural marvel that lives up to the hype. The moment you arrive, you're struck by how clean, modern, and well-maintained the entire area is. It’s obvious the government has invested heavily in making this part of the city not only efficient but also visually stunning.

The complex itself has everything: a luxury hotel, a massive shopping mall, world-class restaurants, the ArtScience Museum, a casino, and the famous SkyPark Infinity Pool with panoramic views of the city skyline. At night, the entire bay lights up beautifully, creating an unforgettable atmosphere. The nightly light and water shows are truly a spectacle, adding to the area’s magical charm.

Marina Bay Sands is also very tourist-friendly. Once you’ve walked around a bit or used the MRT nearby, getting your bearings becomes easy. The area feels safe, accessible, and full of energy.

We were incredibly lucky to visit while Singapore was preparing for its 60th National Day celebrations. We witnessed military rehearsals, fighter jets soaring overhead, and stunning fireworks lighting up the bay. Combined with the elegance of Marina Bay Sands, it made for a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Highly recommended for any visitor to Singapore.

Let me know if you want to add hotel-specific feedback or highlight anything else like shopping, food, or the pool!

Went there a couple of days ago for the fireworks display during the NDP rehearsals. It was so well organised despite being super crowded.

I drove there via the south parking entrance and we were directed to park our cars in the expo hall/loading bay. They opened all the expo halls and converted it into a massive carpark instead 😆 the staff members allocated spaces to each car so the process was very quick and efficient.

After the fireworks display, to facilitate human traffic and to maintain safety, they closed some doors in the middle of the mall so that people don’t rush in from all directions from outdoors to indoors and have to follow the same direction for exiting.

review_text: Thanks guys. You guys don’t even take care of your workers- a relative of mine who has been working for your company as a cleaner for almost 8 years has just been told by his supervisor that because he’s “sick” which he isn’t, he was told he had no job when he turned up to work, and not even given a formal letter of termination. He was told that he would be contacted by HR on Monday which is astonishing. We’ve contacted your front desk and from what we’ve been told, HR is on it but we don’t know when we’ll be called. We have contacted MOM about this because the situation is beyond unfair- this is a man who’s elderly and who is getting his eye fixed. He’s not blind or sick. This smacks of unfair termination, and his supervisor should’ve gone through the right channels and or tried to help him. He knows that his only issue is his diabetes which doesn’t make him ill. Well, we hope that the Hr will get back as soon as possible. Either way, we have contacted MOM about this unfair treatment and we hope that this issue can be solved soon. Imagine doing this to an elderly person who has worked hard for your company for ages, is always early and makes sure he’s on time. This is awful.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands (MBS) is Singapore’s most iconic integrated resort, opened in 2010. It features a luxury hotel, convention and exhibition facilities, theatres, celebrity chef restaurants, a casino, and the famous SkyPark with its infinity pool overlooking the city skyline. It has become both a global tourist attraction and a hub for international events.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is without a doubt one of the most iconic landmarks in Singapore, offering a luxurious experience from start to finish. The architecture alone is breathtaking—three towers connected by the famous SkyPark, which offers stunning panoramic views of the city skyline, Marina Bay, and beyond.

The Infinity Pool on the rooftop is world-famous and truly lives up to the hype. It’s only accessible to hotel guests, but if you get the chance to stay, it’s worth it for that view alone. There’s also a public observation deck if you're not staying at the hotel.

Inside, MBS features a high-end shopping mall with luxury brands, a canal with gondola rides, and a wide variety of restaurants—from celebrity chef fine dining to local delicacies. The ArtScience Museum and nightly Spectra light and water show at the promenade are great additions that make it a complete entertainment destination.

It’s directly connected to Gardens by the Bay via a beautiful pedestrian bridge, and the Bayfront MRT station is just below the complex, making it super accessible.

Whether you're staying the night, coming for a show, or just enjoying the views, Marina Bay Sands offers a world-class experience in the heart of Singapore.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is a landmark that has become synonymous with luxury and innovation since its opening in 2011. Located on the waterfront of Marina Bay, the resort features an iconic design with three interconnected towers, topped by the Sands SkyPark, which boasts the world’s largest infinity pool. This rooftop area offers stunning panoramic views of Singapore’s skyline, creating a unique experience for hotel guests.

The resort offers 1,850 rooms and suites, ranging from elegant Premier Rooms to the ultra-luxurious Paiza Collection. The rooms are designed with modern sophistication, featuring plush furnishings, marble bathrooms, and the latest in-room technology. Guests staying in the Paiza Collection enjoy exclusive benefits, including butler service, private lounge access, and enhanced privileges at the SkyPark.

Marina Bay Sands is also home to an impressive selection of dining options, with over 80 restaurants and bars. Renowned chefs like Wolfgang Puck, Gordon Ramsay, and Tetsuya Wakuda have established eateries here, offering a variety of world-class culinary experiences. The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, an upscale shopping mall, features more than 300 luxury stores, while the ArtScience Museum offers an intriguing mix of exhibitions that combine art, science, and technology.

Entertainment options at the resort are abundant. The light and water show, Spectra, is a nightly spectacle, and the MARQUEE nightclub adds to the vibrant nightlife scene. The casino, along with a theater hosting international performances and a large convention center, ensures that there’s always something to do. For those looking for relaxation, the Banyan Tree Spa provides a range of luxurious treatments, and the fitness center is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities.

One downside to consider is the resort’s sheer size, which can lead to crowded public areas, especially during peak seasons. Guests have occasionally mentioned longer wait times for certain amenities. Despite this, the vast array of services and the exceptional level of service offered at Marina Bay Sands often outweigh these inconveniences.

Marina Bay Sands is a top-tier destination for travelers seeking a luxurious all-in-one resort experience. Whether you’re enjoying the infinity pool, dining at world-class restaurants, shopping, or indulging in the entertainment, the resort offers something for everyone, making it a standout choice when visiting Singapore.

review_text:
The most luxurious shopping mall I’ve ever been to. It includes the world’s first floating Apple Store and the world’s first Louis Vuitton Island Maison.

Easily accessible via Bayfront MRT station, the mall is huge, extremely clean, and well-maintained.

The signage in the mall is clear and easy to understand, making it simple to find your way around. There are many tourists, yet it doesn’t feel crowded because of how spacious the mall is.

The mall also has clean and modern restrooms and well-planned escalators for easy movement between floors.

It features a luxury hotel and was deemed the world’s most expensive standalone casino property in 2010 — though I didn’t have the chance to experience those myself.

Overall, it’s an impressive and unique shopping destination that combines luxury, convenience, and thoughtful design — definitely worth a visit even if you’re just exploring.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel—it's an icon that defines the Singapore skyline and an immersive experience in luxury, architecture, and entertainment. From the moment you enter, you're surrounded by a sense of scale and grandeur that few hotels in the world can match. The triple-tower structure, connected at the top by the SkyPark, feels futuristic yet harmoniously integrated with the Marina Bay waterfront.

I stayed in a Premier Room on a high floor, and the view from the floor-to-ceiling windows was absolutely unforgettable—overlooking Gardens by the Bay and the Singapore Strait. The room itself was luxurious yet understated, with thoughtful design touches, a spacious bathroom with a rain shower, and everything you’d expect from a world-class 5-star property.

Of course, the highlight was the infinity pool. It's reserved for hotel guests only and lives up to every bit of hype. Watching the city skyline glow at dusk while swimming 57 stories up was something I’ll remember forever. The SkyPark observation deck, accessible to the public for a fee, is also fantastic for views and photos.

Dining was equally stellar—LAVO had one of the best Italian meals I’ve had in Asia, and breakfast at Rise was generous, varied, and well-executed. The integrated shopping mall downstairs (The Shoppes) has everything from Louis Vuitton to artisanal coffee shops. You’ll also find the ArtScience Museum here, with its lotus-like design and rotating exhibitions.

Yes, it’s expensive. But for what you’re getting—the architecture, the views, the facilities, the sheer wow-factor—it’s one of those places worth splurging on at least once. Tip: Book early and request a higher floor with a pool-facing view

The customer service team had incorrect information but this is a very fancy hotel.
Also, everyone including people staying were rude and snobby.
Glad we left.

review_text:
It was a surreal experience, which was good. It is expensive to dine within the hotel at various venues. Drinks were very expensive too. A buffet breakfast was included, but oh my goodness, it was extremely busy no matter what time we attended. One day, there were over 70 people in the queue waiting to be seated. We sent an email to the hotel, as one day, our allocated table was next to a door for anyone to go outside into the garden dining area. This particular breakfast wasn't enjoyable as it was a constant thoroughfare with so many other guests squeezing past. We received a phone call within a few minutes of sending our email. They understood our issue but didn't offer any solution. We weren't offered this table again 🙏 The said table was still in place the following day! We also sadly noticed the huge amount of food being wasted from a lot of guests.
We had a couple of issues having to wait, one was for some wine we had ordered for our room, we eventually after almost an hour of waiting received a call to advise the wine wasn't available!
The room itself was lovely & the views were beautiful. Overall the staff were extremely polite & very helpful.
The main thoroughfare near to reception is extremely busy, with anyone being able to access not just guests staying at the hotel as the shopping mall/cinema/casino/restaurants, etc, are accessible from here.
We do hope the infrastructure is being carefully considered whilst Tower 4 is being constructed, as the number of people moving through & around is extremely busy!!
The infinity pool was amazing though & enjoyable 😎

review_text:

We immediately liased with your Concierge staff who immediately got security involved and were able to quickly ascertain the taxi company and driver and make contact with them. The phone was promptly returned adding to our positive experience at your property.
Tinakaren # 842099 was absolutely exceptional with his service and patience, making several calls to track down the phone whilst consistently talking us through the process whilst also liasing with his security staff, the man is a multi tasking guru.
Tinakaren #842099 professionalism, kindness, and understanding went far beyond what anyone could expect. The fact that we weren’t even staying at Marina Sands makes his efforts even more remarkable. He is a true credit to the hotel and a shining example of outstanding service.

Our heartfelt thanks go to Tinakaren #842099 he truly set the bar high and is a role model for everyone.
