The only downside is that the hotel used to have a sauna and steam room, but it is no longer available.
The hotel does offer free access to the fitness center, which is located near the hotel, short walking distance.

reviewer_name: Alice Lau (Girl in a Food Frenzy)
review_text:
One of the most iconic pieces of architecture to ever take centre stage. Love that these beautiful buildings can be seen at different vantage points around the city.

We visited three times, to the hotel and lobby bar. To tower three for a fine dining experience at Spago on L57 and to the shoppes for casual dining, shopping and the Sampan boat ride which is a must do.

Pro tip, book in advance at a restaurant or bar on L57 so you can enjoy the million dollar views, along with the establishments observation deck (which is) often private and for patrons only.

Skypark observatory seems to have massive queues (and) for slightly more than you’d pay for the fee (you) can enjoy a beautiful experience instead.

review_text:
For such a massive mega-hotel, the Marina Bay Sands executes quite flawlessly.  The room was beautiful and has some of the most impressive latest technology and the service is truly quite amazing.  And of course  - the rooftop infinity pool is one of a kind in this world.

We were fortunate enough to stay at the room facing Gardens by the bay with a large walk-out balcony. While the room was quite small, it was jam-packed with all kinds of tech features that even blow the Japanese hotels away.

The  service was absolutely remarkable. Any need was fulfilled within 10 mins or less from the call, and the staff truly cared about ones comfort.

The breakfast had the "quantity over quality" feel to it. As to be expected,  the spread was quite massive, with quite massive crowds to boot. Best to go before 08:30am to avoid any lines.

Of course, the rooftop infinity pool is a 10/10. Incredible in every way, a true modern marvel. We visited several times through several days and even at night and found plenty of loungers available. Staff was there to provide quick drink and snack service as well.

Overall , I was left impressed with the MBS. The room was impeccably clean and showed zero signs of wear. Its quite impressive how such a large enterprise can keep the service level so high. And the service was amazing, but one does feel a bit like a number based on the size of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
A seaside hotel that captures the imagination often blends natural beauty with human-centric design, creating an immersive escape from the mundane. Here’s a multidimensional portrayal of an ideal coastal retreat:

**1. Symbiosis with the Ocean**
- **Boundless Vistas**: Perched atop a crescent-shaped bay, every suite features 270-degree floor-to-ceiling windows. The tides become a living mural, while the "Golden Hour of the Sea" during dawn and dusk offers a private visual feast.
- **Exclusive Shoreline**: A private 800-meter white sand beach pairs with a tidal monitoring system that alerts guests to optimal tide-pooling times. Guided explorations reveal hidden intertidal ecosystems at low tide.

**2. Architectural Poetry**
- **Cultural Reverence**: Inspired by traditional fishing village dwellings, the terraced structure boasts a façade embedded with millions of recycled seashells, their undulating textures shimmering like sunlit waves.
- **Liquid Aesthetics**: The lobby dazzles with 3,000 hand-blown glass jellyfish lamps. Ocean breezes animate the space, casting rippling shadows that transform check-in into an aquatic overture.

**3. Sensory Sanctuary**
- **Smart Ambiance**: Beds auto-adjust to body contours, while voice-controlled systems cycle through soundscapes like "coral reef white noise" or "dolphin frequency." Mineral-seaweed aromas diffuse via circadian-rhythm scent systems.
- **Marine Interaction**: Balconies house underwater periscopes; UV night mode unveils bioluminescent plankton. A cabin journal logs daily sightings of rare marine species.

**4. Reimagined Ocean Experiences**
- **Tidal Gastronomy**: A 18-course "Marine Evolution" tasting menu evolves with daily catches. Glass-floored dining platforms frame schools of fish darting beneath diners’ feet.
- **Abyssal Meditation**: Collaborating with oceanographers, transparent submersible pods host singing bowl sessions at 20-meter depths, where humpback whale songs resonate through the hull.

**5. Sustainable Innovation**
- Tidal energy meets 60% of power needs; greywater nourishes vertical algae walls that filter CO₂.
- The "Coral Adoption Program" lets guests plant reefs for carbon credits, redeemable for eco-experiences like nocturnal squid tagging.

More than a hotel, it’s a portal to marine consciousness—when bare feet touch moon-warmed sands and smart tidal bracelets pulse to signal a bioluminescent bloom, worldly identities dissolve with the receding tide, leaving only the true self in whispered dialogue with the eternal sea.

review_text:
An iconic landmark of Singapore and a must-visit destination. The architecture itself is breathtaking, and the views from the SkyPark Observation Deck are absolutely stunning—especially at sunset when the city skyline lights up. The infinity pool at the top is world-famous, and for good reason, offering one of the most unique swimming experiences in the world.

Inside, Marina Bay Sands offers everything under one roof: a luxury shopping mall with high-end brands, a wide range of restaurants (from celebrity chefs to casual dining), a casino, and even a museum. The Spectra light and water show at night by the bay is a highlight not to be missed—free and beautifully choreographed.

While it is on the pricier side, the experience is unmatched and worth it at least once. A true symbol of modern Singapore.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks and a symbol of modern architectural brilliance. The complex consists of three towering hotel blocks connected at the top by the SkyPark, an engineering marvel that offers panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay.

One of the biggest draws is the world-famous infinity pool, located on the rooftop. Reserved exclusively for hotel guests, the pool provides an unforgettable experience—floating above the city while enjoying spectacular views. Many visitors book at least one night’s stay just to access it, and while prices can be high, booking during off-peak periods or through special promotions can help you save significantly.

Beyond the pool, the resort is home to a large shopping mall, a casino, and a wide variety of dining options ranging from food court fare to high-end restaurants by celebrity chefs. The quality of food across the property is consistently excellent.

What makes Marina Bay Sands truly special is its dual perspective: you can enjoy stunning views of both the futuristic Gardens by the Bay and the dazzling city skyline, especially at night when the lights come alive.

Whether you’re staying overnight, dining, or just visiting the observation deck, it’s an experience that’s absolutely worth having at least once in your lifetime.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Singapore truly exceeded my expectations during my short stay. The iconic property boasts breathtaking landscapes that immediately transport you to a world of luxury and elegance. While my visit was brief, I was able to immerse myself in the grandeur that Marina Bay Sands is renowned for.

Upon arrival, I regretfully missed the opportunity to dine at their Italian restaurant due to its closing hours. Nevertheless, I was compensated by the exceptional service and warm hospitality extended by the staff, making me feel welcome and valued throughout my stay.

One highlight of my visit was the casino experience, even though I am not a gambling enthusiast. Watching my friend revel in the excitement of the baccarat table was a joy in itself. The refreshing lemonade cucumber tea served at the casino instantly became a favorite, earning the amusing moniker "hot mountain dew" from us.

While exploring the expansive mall area, I marveled at the architecture and design surrounding me. The sheer scale of the mall was impressive, filled with an array of stores and amenities that cater to every need and desire. Although I missed the chance to fully indulge in retail therapy due to the late hour, the ambiance alone was enough to leave a lasting impression.

Despite the closing time of most establishments in the mall, we found solace in dining at the exclusive club restaurant. The culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional, offering a delectable array of dishes that tantalized our taste buds and left us craving for more. The impeccable service and attention to detail truly elevated our dining experience to a new level of luxury.

One cannot help but appreciate the intricate beauty and craftsmanship that permeates every corner of Marina Bay Sands. From the lavish decor to the stunning views of the surrounding cityscape, every aspect of the property exudes sophistication and opulence. The meticulous attention to detail is evident in every aspect of the hotel, ensuring a seamless and unforgettable experience for every guest.

The unparalleled views from the observation deck left me in awe of the panoramic vistas that stretched as far as the eye could see. The expansive skyline of Singapore, coupled with the stunning waterfront views, created a mesmerizing backdrop that encapsulated the essence of urban beauty and modernity.

Throughout my stay, I was consistently impressed by the level of service and professionalism displayed by the staff at Marina Bay Sands. Their dedication to ensuring the comfort and satisfaction of guests was commendable, making me feel valued and appreciated at every interaction.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a true gem that offers a luxurious and immersive experience like no other. From the exquisite landscapes to the world-class amenities and exceptional service, every aspect of the property is designed to exceed expectations and create lasting memories. My short but unforgettable stay at Marina Bay Sands has left me eager to return and indulge in all the wonders this iconic destination has to offer.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is a stunning destination that combines luxury, innovation, and functionality. During my recent visit, I attended the STACK Conference organized by GovTech, held in its expansive event spaces. The venue is impressively large, with state-of-the-art facilities that can accommodate conferences and workshops seamlessly. I organized a workshop for 40 participants, and the spacious, well-equipped room made the experience smooth and productive.

Beyond the corporate side, Marina Bay Sands also doubles as a shopping haven, with a sprawling mall featuring high-end brands, fine dining, and entertainment options. It's an exceptional venue that effortlessly blends business with leisure, offering something for everyone.

The location is great, since you have walking distance to the Gardens by the Bay, shopping and great restaurants.

review_text:
An Iconic Luxury Experience

Marina Bay Sands is nothing short of spectacular. From the moment you arrive, you’re enveloped in luxury and grandeur. The architecture is iconic, and the view from the SkyPark is absolutely breathtaking, offering panoramic vistas of Singapore’s skyline that are worth the visit alone.

The rooms are spacious, modern, and well-appointed, with many offering stunning views of the bay. The infinity pool is the star attraction—swimming at the top of the world is an experience that you simply can’t miss. It’s a bit crowded at times, but the view and atmosphere make it worth it.

Beyond the rooms and pool, the complex has everything you could need—high-end shopping, world-class dining, and a casino. The staff are attentive and ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible.

Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel; it’s a destination in itself. Whether you’re staying here or just visiting, it’s an experience that defines luxury in Singapore. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in the best the city has to offer.

You can modify it based on your personal experience or preferences!

review_text:
In November 2022, we took our friends visiting from Australia to Marina Bay Sands, and it turned out to be one of the highlights of their trip. We started by strolling through the luxurious mall, where they enjoyed browsing the wide range of shops. The atmosphere was vibrant, and the architecture itself was impressive, adding to the overall experience.

After exploring the mall, we took a leisurely walk through the surrounding areas, which offered stunning views of the city skyline. The walk across to Gardens by the Bay was particularly enjoyable, as it provided a perfect blend of modernity and nature. Our friends were captivated by the seamless transition from the bustling mall to the serene gardens. Marina Bay Sands is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the best of what Singapore has to offer!

review_text:
S i n g a p o r e s . F i n e s t .
This was my second stay at Marina Bay Sands, and it’s now my absolute favorite! I opted for a suite room overlooking the breathtaking Gardens by the Bay, and it truly took my experience to the next level. The suite itself was exquisitely detailed, every inch of the room designed to perfection. From the plush bedding to the sleek bathroom and high-end amenities, the attention to quality was second to none.

The views were beyond spectacular, and it felt like the gardens were an extension of the suite, creating a serene and unforgettable atmosphere. But what truly made my stay exceptional was the staff. They were incredibly attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to make sure my stay was perfect. Nothing was too much for them—each request was met with a genuine smile and impeccable service.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands is the ultimate hotel experience. It’s a place that leaves you inspired and looking forward to returning. If you’re looking for an unforgettable, luxurious getaway, this is where you need to be!

review_text:
It’s new and shiny and Singapores version of Vegas. Ultra flashy retail (anyone need to pick up a Patek Philippe before dinner?), fancy dinning options etc, but decidedly Singapore. So more hushed tones, politeness and order than the average casino resort.

Roof top pool is actually epic, and staff super friendly and attentive. Looks as good as the pictures.

Room was very nice, well sized, all the tech and a TV as big as a house. We had a balcony with a view of the gardens and would say that is a great option.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is truly an iconic destination! The architecture alone is breathtaking, and stepping inside feels like entering a world of luxury. The infinity pool on the rooftop is simply stunning, offering panoramic views of the Singapore skyline that are worth every moment. The rooms are spacious, modern, and well-appointed, providing a high level of comfort. The range of dining options is impressive, with world-class restaurants that cater to every taste. From high-end shopping to the spectacular SkyPark and ArtScience Museum, there’s so much to experience. Marina Bay Sands offers a complete, unforgettable experience that perfectly blends elegance, luxury, and entertainment. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore!

There for NYE celebrations 🍾.   Amazing experience.

Only issue was the mass confusion of how to exit the venue after the fireworks. Entries and exits were locked and couldn't find a way out to the street.  0,000s of people were cramming to enter the MTR.

Fluked finding the underground carpark, still not knowing how to exit the venue.  If not for a generous local, who had parked there, offering to drive me home, I'd probably be stuck there for hours!! With all the locked entries/exits that night, I'm concerned as to how they would have evacuated visitors had there been a fire.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is nothing short of spectacular. From the moment I stepped in, I was struck by the luxury and attention to detail in every corner of this iconic hotel.the highlight, of course, is the infinity pool.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands was also a treat. With a range of world-class restaurants and cafes, there’s something for everyone. I tried a few options within the complex, and each meal was delicious, albeit a bit pricey (which is expected given the location).

The hotel is perfectly located for exploring the city—just a short walk or ride away from major attractions like Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. The convenience and experience were well worth it.

review_text: Of course, everyone needs to see and visit the Marina Bay Sands when they go to Singapore!! It’s a phenomenal building and just as impressive in-person as it is in photos. The staff is very kind and efficient since they have an outrageous number of people coming to stay or visit each day. The rooms are lovely with good views no matter where you are. The pool is also incredible! Staff is friendly there as well though reasonably strict about only allowing guests through (do NOT lose your room key!). The biggest downside is that it is truly flooded with people. The lobby, the restaurants, the bars, the pool, everything is crowded so it’s hard to fully appreciate the hotel and its amenities.

review_text:
We stayed in Marina Bay Sands to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel staff was amazing and they went beyond our expectations to make our experience a very special one 🙏

The room was both beautiful and highly functional in ways that actually matter: High-end Audio, automated lights, curtains, HVAC all controllable from the TV.

Our stay in MBS by itself made the trip to Singapore totally worth it.

The location is perfect, views amazing and there's top notch shopping, dining and entertainment in the same building.

If there is one nit that I think can be improved on:
It would be amazing to offer a wider food menu for room service, or to offer in-room dining experiences from some of the high end restaurants in the MBS complex. Allowing guests to enjoy top notch dining in a top-notch room with top-notch views.

And I didn't even get to the insane infinity pool on top of the building 🙂

If you're thinking of booking one night, strongly consider booking two to have one full day without worrying about logistics.

review_text: The Sands Exposition Center and Mall is probably the most impressive mall that I have ever seen.  I don't know how much money it took to build this, but they thought of a lot.  First, they have the best food court that I have ever been to.  I've been here several times now and the prices are slightly higher, but the cuisine is really good with all booths.  It is like a high quality Hawker Center or something.  Plus, there is a Subway that goes right through the middle of it.  The Downtown line comes directly to this mall! Plus, in case you didn't know this already, you can actually walk on top of this mall!  There is an elevator to the top, and the view from here is amazing!  Not only that, but you can also walk directly to the Supertree Forest, via a special walkway which they have built between the two locations, saving you all kinds of time.  There is a lotus lake outside which almost nobody visits, which is a great place to enjoy some Tea or Coffee.  There is a casino here, and a lot more.  But you have got to see this place to believe it.

review_text:
Superb hotel in terms of view, architecture and service. The infinity pool is stunning, at day and night.
Towers are immaculate to walk through, the adjacent mall has one or more stores of almost all important designers. We only noticed Zimmermann who wasn't present.
Make sure to get their member card, if you plan on buying anything or eat at black tap burgers for example.

Their staff was extremely friendly, they even lined up our shoes and folded clothes that we threw on the couch. After using most of our complementary coffee capsules, they even gave us one more of each and plenty of sweets. Minibar is well stocked with a good variety of snacks, softdrinks and even a shaker to make your own cocktails. Even the size of the coffee was adjusted to match their cups.
Rooms are clean and of high quality interior. You can control all lighting, do not disturb and Ac from each side of your bed, which was a nice add on. When we left they put a number of glass cleaning clothes and even a cable organizer + amenities to take with us.

Probably the best city hotel I have ever stayed at. Definitely worth the money, don't look any further.

Thank you for having us!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is an iconic luxury destination that offers a unique combination of world-class hospitality, stunning architecture, and exceptional experiences. Located in the heart of the city, it is renowned for its striking design, featuring three interconnected towers topped by the SkyPark, which provides panoramic views of the Singapore skyline.

The hotel boasts opulent rooms and suites with modern amenities, elegant furnishings, and floor-to-ceiling windows that showcase breathtaking city or sea views. The service is exemplary, with staff going above and beyond to ensure a seamless stay.

The highlight of Marina Bay Sands is undoubtedly the Infinity Pool on the SkyPark, which is the world’s largest rooftop pool. Floating on the edge of the pool while gazing at the cityscape is an unforgettable experience. The SkyPark also houses observation decks and restaurants offering gourmet dining, further elevating the luxury quotient.

For entertainment, Marina Bay Sands has something for everyone. The integrated resort includes a high-end shopping mall, an impressive casino, and the ArtScience Museum, which hosts cutting-edge exhibitions. The theater regularly features international performances, adding to the cultural allure.

While the experience is undoubtedly luxurious, it comes with a premium price tag. Some guests might find the property bustling, especially during peak tourist seasons. However, the overall ambiance, impeccable service, and unmatched facilities make it worth the splurge.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands is more than just a hotel—it’s a destination in itself, perfect for those seeking indulgence, entertainment, and iconic memories in Singapore.

review_text:
A Sky-High Experience with Spectacular Views

We visited hotel’s observation deck. This observation deck offers a panoramic view of the city that is truly breathtaking.

The primary draw of the Marina Bay Sands Observation Deck is, of course, the view. From this vantage point, you get an unobstructed, 360-degree view of Singapore’s stunning skyline, the bustling Marina Bay, and the vast expanse of the sea stretching into the distance. On a clear day, you can see as far as Indonesian lands.

The view encompasses some of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks. You’ll see the lush greenery and futuristic structures of Gardens by the Bay, including the Supertree Grove and the two glass conservatories. The sight of the Marina Bay area from above, including the Merlion, the Esplanade, and the Singapore Flyer, is particularly striking. As the sun sets, the city transitions into a vibrant display of lights, making the evening visit a magical experience. The colors reflecting off the bay and the dazzling city lights make it an ideal spot for photographers.

The Observation Deck itself is expansive, offering plenty of room to move around and take in the views from different angles. Unlike other observation decks that might feel cramped, this one provides ample space for everyone to enjoy the view without feeling crowded, even during peak hours. The deck is designed to ensure safety while providing an open, airy feel.

One of the unique aspects of the deck is its open-air design. Unlike enclosed observation decks with glass barriers, the Marina Bay Sands deck offers an unobstructed view, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the surroundings. The feeling of standing 57 floors above ground, with the wind in your hair and the city sprawled out beneath you, is exhilarating.

To get the most out of your visit, I recommend timing your trip to coincide with sunset. Arriving about an hour before sunset allows you to experience the transition from day to night. Watching the sun dip below the horizon, casting a warm golden hue over the city, is a moment of pure beauty. As day turns to night, the city’s lights begin to sparkle, creating a mesmerizing scene that’s perfect for capturing on camera.

Another highlight of an evening visit is the nightly Spectra Light and Water Show at Marina Bay Sands. From the Observation Deck, you get a unique, bird’s-eye view of this show, which combines dancing fountains, colorful lights, and music in a spectacular display. The view from above adds an extra dimension to the experience, allowing you to appreciate the choreography of the water jets and lights in their entirety.

The Observation Deck also offers a few additional amenities that enhance the experience. There’s a small bar where you can purchase drinks and snacks, allowing you to relax and enjoy the view with a refreshing beverage in hand.

It’s worth noting that the open-air design means it can get quite hot during the day, so bringing sunscreen and a hat is advisable if you’re visiting earlier in the day.

review_text:
My recent visit to Singapore was fab, and the highlight of this incredible journey was undeniably my stay at Marina Bay Sands. From the moment I set foot in this iconic hotel, I was spellbound by the sheer beauty of the bay area and the rich cultural experiences that surrounded me.

The first thing that left me in awe was the breathtaking view of the city skyline from the rooftop infinity pool. The sight of the glittering skyscrapers and the stunning Marina Bay was nothing short of magical, especially during the evening when the city lights up. I could have spent hours just soaking in this incredible panorama.

The Bay Area itself is a sight to behold. The calm waters of the bay, juxtaposed with the bustling cityscape, create a unique and captivating atmosphere. A leisurely stroll along the bay promenade allowed me to absorb the vibrant energy of this place and appreciate the blend of modernity and tradition that Singapore so perfectly encapsulates.

Overall, my visit to Marina Bay Sands in Singapore was nothing short of extraordinary. The hotel, the bay area, and the cultural experiences exceeded my expectations and made my first trip to Singapore a memorable one. If you're seeking a blend of luxury, culture, and breathtaking views, this is the place to be. I left with a heavy heart, but with memories I will cherish for a lifetime.

review_text:
My recent stay at the iconic Marina Bay Sands in Singapore was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I arrived, I was thoroughly impressed by the level of service and attention to detail that the resort provided.

One of the highlights of my stay was the unexpected room upgrade I received, which afforded me breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline and Marina Bay. Being able to wake up and enjoy the stunning vistas each morning was truly a treat. Swimming in the infinity pool was an experience I'll never forget.

What really sets Marina Bay Sands apart, though, was the exceptional level of service. The resort provided me with temporary cards that allowed me to access the swimming pool and reserve time slots for the shower facilities, even after I had checked out. This thoughtful touch ensured that I could continue to enjoy the resort's amenities on my final day, without any hassle.

I cannot recommend Marina Bay Sands highly enough. Whether you're visiting Singapore for business or leisure, this iconic resort offers an unparalleled blend of luxury, service, and unforgettable experiences. I left feeling refreshed, rejuvenated.

review_text: Loved our stay here! On the expensive side, but decided to splurge for a two night stay after our cruise! Room was big and clean, however, it looked a bit tired with nicks and scratches on the furnishings! I expected being that it is a highly praised and visible hotel that everything would be on the luxurious side, but I have seen better. On the brighter side, the hotel is centrally located with all the highlights of what Singapore has to offer within walking distance. The hotel also boasts a high-end mall with food court. It does get extremely busy so plan accordingly if you'd like to get something to eat and to see any light shows, need to show up at least an hour before to get prime spot. Any the infinity pool was amazing overlooking the city! We went at 6 am in the morning for a swim and no one was around until about 6:30 am then the crowd started to build up. All in all, it was an amazing stay and would still recommend the hotel!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is not just a hotel; it’s a destination in itself—a place where luxury, innovation, and grandeur converge to create an unforgettable experience. From the moment you approach this iconic structure, the stunning architecture captures your attention. The three soaring towers connected by the breathtaking SkyPark have become synonymous with the Singapore skyline, and the reality of staying here exceeds every expectation.

The rooms are nothing short of spectacular. Whether you’re enjoying panoramic views of the city skyline, the bustling harbour, or the lush Gardens by the Bay, every window offers a postcard-perfect scene. The interiors are sleek, modern, and impeccably designed, providing comfort and luxury in equal measure. The attention to detail is evident, from the plush bedding to the high-tech amenities that ensure your stay is seamless and indulgent.

But what truly sets Marina Bay Sands apart is its unparalleled range of facilities. The SkyPark infinity pool is a must-visit—swimming at the edge of the world, with the city sprawled out below. You are an experience that’s hard to match. It’s not just a pool; it’s a statement, a place where you feel like you’re floating above the city.

Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a journey through culinary excellence. The hotel houses a plethora of world-class restaurants, each offering unique and exquisite dishes. From celebrity chef establishments to more casual yet equally delightful dining spots, the options are endless and cater to every taste. Whether you’re in the mood for gourmet cuisine or a quick, delicious bite, you’ll find something to satisfy your palate.

For those looking to indulge in some retail therapy, the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands offers a luxurious shopping experience, featuring high-end brands and designer boutiques. The integrated resort also boasts an impressive casino, a theatre showcasing world-class performances and an art-science museum, ensuring that there’s always something exciting to do.

The service is top-notch across the board. The staff are attentive, professional, and genuinely eager to make your stay exceptional. From check-in to check-out, every interaction is smooth and pleasant, making you feel pampered at every step.

Marina Bay Sands isn’t just a hotel; it’s an experience that leaves a lasting impression. Whether you’re in Singapore for business or leisure, this iconic landmark provides the perfect blend of comfort, luxury, and entertainment. It’s a place where every detail is crafted to perfection, making it an absolute must-stay for anyone visiting this vibrant city.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of Singapore’s most iconic landmarks, a luxury hotel that is more than just a place to stay—it’s an experience in itself. During my recent visit, I was left in awe of its architectural grandeur, world-class amenities, and stunning views. Adding to this, my dining experience at LAVO Italian Restaurant & Rooftop Bar was a highlight of the trip, though there were some areas where it could have been better.

**Marina Bay Sands Experience:**

From the moment you arrive at Marina Bay Sands, the sheer scale of the place is impressive. The hotel consists of three massive towers connected by a SkyPark, which offers one of the best panoramic views of the city. Checking in was seamless despite the large number of guests, and the staff were attentive and professional throughout our stay.

The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and offered floor-to-ceiling windows with breathtaking views of Singapore’s skyline or the bay. The attention to detail in the rooms, from the plush bedding to the luxurious bathrooms, made our stay incredibly comfortable. The location of Marina Bay Sands is also unbeatable—it’s situated near many of Singapore’s key attractions, such as Gardens by the Bay, the ArtScience Museum, and the Merlion, making it perfect for tourists looking to explore the city.

However, what sets Marina Bay Sands apart is its world-famous infinity pool located on the 57th floor. Floating in the pool while taking in the views of the city skyline is an experience you won’t forget. It’s worth noting that the pool area does get crowded, especially during peak hours, so it’s best to visit early in the morning or late in the evening for a more relaxed atmosphere.

For entertainment, Marina Bay Sands also boasts a world-class casino, high-end shopping at The Shoppes, and an array of restaurants, bars, and cafes. The hotel’s wide variety of dining options ensures there’s something for everyone, from casual eateries to fine dining.

**Dining at LAVO Restaurant:**

One of the dining highlights at Marina Bay Sands was our dinner at LAVO Italian Restaurant & Rooftop Bar. Situated on the 57th floor, LAVO offers stunning 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline, and the ambiance is unbeatable. The warm lighting, plush seating, and open-air terrace create a sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere. Whether you’re seated indoors or outdoors, you’re in for a visual treat.

LAVO’s menu is an impressive mix of Italian-American cuisine. We started with the *Fried Calamari* and *Meatball*, both of which were delicious. The calamari was perfectly crisp, and the meatball was tender and flavorful, served in a rich tomato sauce. For our main course, we ordered the *Spaghetti Carbonara* and *Lobster Ravioli*. The carbonara was creamy and flavorful, though slightly on the heavier side, while the lobster ravioli was a standout dish, with perfectly cooked pasta and generous portions of lobster.

However, as much as we enjoyed the food, the prices were on the higher side, which is to be expected given the prime location. The service, while friendly, could have been more attentive. It took longer than expected for our orders to be taken, and the food arrived slightly later than anticipated. While the ambiance and views made up for the slight delays, it’s something that could be improved for a more seamless dining experience.

The rooftop bar at LAVO is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy cocktails with a view. The drinks were well-crafted, and sipping a cocktail while watching the city lights come to life was a memorable experience.

**Conclusion:**

Marina Bay Sands is a premier destination in Singapore, offering a luxurious stay with unparalleled views, world-class amenities, and a range of dining options. The infinity pool alone makes it worth the visit, and its location is perfect for exploring Singapore. LAVO Restaurant, with its stunning views and delicious Italian-American cuisine, is a great dining spot, though a few tweaks in service would make it even better. Overall, both the hotel and restaurant was amazing.

review_text: A beautiful hotel to stay in. Our newly renovated room was awesome with great views of the Gardens by the Bay day and night. The Infinity Pool on the roof was, well the most standout of them all.  Pools were separated for the adults and kids section, so for all us adults could enjoy the views and food/drinks in peace and harmony without screaming and jumping kids.  All staff at all levels Inc pool staff were great, very friendly and professional. It was great to have direct access to the gardens by the bay and the shoppes at Marina Bay.  If you ever visit Singapore, you have to visit Gardens by the bay even if you don't stay at the hotel, but if you do stay at the hotel,  the views from our room were magnificent.

review_text: I recently had an extraordinary stay at Marina Bay Sands in Singapore. The breathtaking architecture, coupled with impeccable service, created an unforgettable experience. The room's luxurious amenities and stunning views of the cityscape made every moment enjoyable. The SkyPark's infinity pool, a true highlight, provided a unique and breathtaking perspective of Singapore's skyline. The diverse dining options and vibrant atmosphere in the hotel added to the overall charm. Marina Bay Sands exceeded my expectations, offering a perfect blend of opulence and comfort for an indulgent getaway.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is renowned for its iconic architecture, luxurious accommodations, and breathtaking views of the city skyline. Visitors often praise its infinity pool, which offers a stunning panoramic view. The hotel's impressive facilities, including its diverse dining options, shopping mall, and entertainment choices, receive high marks. However, some guests note that it can be crowded due to its popularity, and the prices might be higher compared to other accommodations. Overall, it's a top choice for travelers looking for a lavish and unforgettable experience in Singapore.

review_text: The hotel itself and all the facilities look incredible. We didn't stay here, but anyone who comes to Singapore will pass through it's doors. The only reason that I'm giving it 3 stars is really because we went up to a restaurant at the top of hotel on the platform. The SGN 30 per ticket is redeemable on for and drink. It was fine, in terms of the food and drinks on offer, but it was overcrowded and the staff, salary, didn't really offer a great service. So in some ways, I wish we'd just paid to be on the actual viewing deck. It's a thing to do, but it's a coin toss whether to dine or do just the viewing deck

review_text:
Luxury on luxury! My favorite watch brands Patek and Piguet are here - bring your deep pockets if you want to hang out here.
Food- better than what we had everywhere else in the city but we didn't visit a lot of high end restaurants to compare. Ce La Vi is worth for the view! Make sure you have reservations.
Service - it is a hit or miss- at times you feel pampered and cared for, at times ignored.
Give yourself some time to eat from one place to another. The towers are quite massive and it takes some time to figure out and get from one point to the next. Definitely try the pool- an insta opportunity!
Is it worth the hype - absolutely (especially at night).
Is it worth the big price tag?-mmmm, not so sure!

Give yourself some time to eat from one place to another. The towers are quite massive and it takes some time to figure out and get from one point to the next. Definitely try the pool- an insta opportunity!
Is it worth the hype - absolutely (especially at night).
Is it worth the big price tag?-mmmm, not so sure!

review_text:
Outstanding hotel. I don't have any complaints about it, only compliments:
- professional staff (for welcome, restaurant, room service, etc). Also did their best to accommodate us as soon as possible
- the rooms are excellent, great amenities and automations for everything, high tech
- the infinity pool, one of the best in the world: very high up in the sky with great views. Fruits refreshments throughout the day
- great and complete main restaurant, both breakfast and dinner buffets
- luxurious overall, like a mini mall with various stores and restaurants
- good location, various nearby attractions: Gardens by the Bay, Singapore Flyer, Spectra show, etc, nearby the MRT subway too

My advice: get a room with gardens by the bay view, both day and night the view is nice and calming, during the night you can also see the Gardens lights and music show. On the opposite side you have the city and the lake below, I personally prefer the Gardens view

Overall I would not recommend it, there are many much better hotels in Singapore for the same price or even much cheaper.

review_text: The hotel is great in industrializing the 5-star experience. Do not attempt online checkin, because then your stuff won’t reach your room from the drop-off and there will be issues with the online deposit. This simply does not work as you would expect. The room is quite nice on higher floors, but they started some maintenance next to our room and as they left an emergency exit open and blocked the beeping noise was quite disturbing in our room during the night. We were offered a new room, but as we would had to move our staff the night before our checkout, it did not make any sense. We would have expected much more from such a high ranked hotel and considering these it does not worth the money. Maybe one time to check the pool. I never had to call or contact the front desk so often in any other hotel like here, and we are not picky at all. The service is nice and the staff is polite but not flexible at all. Mixing business people with people on vacation is also not a great idea.

review_text:
We feel like all we do is wait at this hotel. We are checking in to the Orchid Suite today after a day in the Premier King room. We've been waiting 15 minutes in line to get a table for breakfast, no one had time to serve us at breakfast, and the food was not very good, we waited in line to check in, we waited in line to check out, the restaurant makes mistakes on the order at lunch. The check out-person told us we could keep our access to the first room while waiting for the suite to get ready, but our key cards stopped working so we had to spend another 30-40 minutes with the check in counter to get access to our luggage which was still in the old room. Finally, after spending $1,200 for a night in their suite we were asked to walk to an ATM to withdraw $2 for stamps so they could send two postcards for us. OK, thanks

It is evident that the service as a Premier Room customer is low. The service level as a Suite customer is much higher - use Club 55 as much as possible! The service at Club 55 lives up to our expectations and service at other great hotels and Club 55 together with the pool is what gives this hotel 3 out of 5 stars. This was a nice change after the first day. We have stayed at 7 hotels in the past 30 days, and even though the service level increased a lot after booking the suite, this hotel comes in at rank 6 out of 7 hotels (second last).

The top floor pool is amazing, though. Amazing views from the top! A must see!

Tickets are 36 SGD, better to book online on marina bay sands website since counter tickets are sold much earlier in the day. They take a nice pic at the entrance however they charge quiet a bit for hardcopy of the photos. If a digital copy be sent to guest on there email or whatsapp for minimal price or for free it would just be a very nice memorable experience. Overall it’s a must visit place on your Singapore trip.

review_text: It is one of the tallest building in the Marina Bay Sands area and the observation deck at the top gives a fantastic view of the iconic place of Singapore. You can almost see the country from the deck and is feast to the eyes. Better to visit in the evening. But be cautious while booking the ticket(book open dated) because you can't predict the weather in Singapore and they won't allow if it is cloudy. Must visit place in Singapore.

We didn't want to leave. Such a wonderful experience.

A light and sound fountain show happens Fri - Sun.

Lovely lovely place!!

review_text: We were concerned about the scale of the hotel and the number of guests and how that might impact our stay, but from even before reaching the hotel, we were so wonderfully assisted by a personalized check in staff as part of premier check-in services that we didn't need to worry about a thing. The luggage magically came to the room and left the room without us needing to supervise, thanks to the very able luggage staff and the exceptional operational management. It is worth staying in the suites for this premiere experience. Each dining option offered by the hotel is just fabulous, with the stunning views from Club 55, the beautifully crafted cakes and savouries at Renku, and especially the widespread and delicious breakfast selections at Rise. The ease with which the scale of operation at breakfast at Rise is managed is just remarkable. The swimming pool experience was also memorable, and we managed to go at times when the crowds were a little less. The suite itself was beautifully appointed, with all necessities placed in the correct position. The views were stunning..we were lucky to get a corner room for an Orchid suite, which offered both city and garden views with sunset and sunrise views. The large windows with mechanised curtains truly elevate the experience. The bathroom and all its amenities, including the selection of toiletries, was extremely premiere. And it is extremely easy to access the towers, the mall, and the various dining places due to the logical layout of the whole complex. The only thing thing that needs a bit of improvement is the elevator waiting time when exiting the sky deck. Overall, amazing stay and we will come back.

review_text: The food court service and food standard at MBS managed by Koufu is worse than a hawker centre. Rasapura Masters is the name of this food court at MBS which is managed by the Koufu. This is not the first time we patronize this place and the latest incident really makes me feel pissed off and decided to leave a bad review for them. Firstly, we bought coffee and tea from them, the taste is so bland and diluted. Therefore i return back to the beverage counter asking for more condensed milk to be added. But to my surprise instead of condensed milk sugar was added instead? Is this the correct way to brew and serve a cup of coffee/tea which cost $2.20 to the customer and give substandard quality? We don't mind to pay extra but it is really not worth as hawker centre coffee is even better than them! And the food court executive is standing at the beverage order counter allowing all this to happen? Secondly, we bought ice kacang from the dessert counter and the portion and appearance is totally different from what is display on the signage. I feel cheated as this is not way to do business and it costs $4.30 for this kind of dessert? I approach the staff making the dessert and she rudely told me is like that one, the display is only a photo! Come on shouldn't you make the finished product to be almost the same as display or else this is actually considered as cheating customers. Example if i sell fishball noodles, my signage display is three fishball and some fishcake but the end product i cook out i only put one fishball into the noodles. Is it correct to do so? I don't think so! This foodcourt is simply a disgrace to the customers especially to the tourists and ruined Singapore food and beverages heritage which they represented at MBS...

review_text: Only recommend staying if you are using credit card points to stay for free. Otherwise, skip it cause it costs too much. In my opinion, the hotel is overrated, especially the 57 floor. review_text:
I attended two dinner functions. Last month.

Food was bad. Service staff were part timers. The most amazing and non compliant was the food plate that was served to customers were smelly and it was as though as rinsed and dried using oily water without soap. Both supervisors were made aware and all they could do was to apologies on behalf of housekeeping. We had raised the feedback to the event owner and no news were heard. The plates were really smelly reaks of Stench of sully water.

Despite raising it as food hygiene issues, all the supervisor did was apologies and scrambled to find clean plates. We didn't touch the last3 dishes due to the aftermath of bad smell and taste right on the table.

For the price you are charging, we expected more.

Won't be going back anytime soon.

review_text:

All quality brands cater to classy customers, and security is on, but Singapore here has high punishments for any kind of ignorance, so it's very safe. You should be here to understand the quality of brand, food as well as service, which comes along together. You will love the place.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a luxurious and iconic hotel located in the heart of the city. The hotel features stunning views of the Marina Bay and the Singapore skyline, and offers a wide range of amenities and services to ensure a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, with comfortable beds, modern amenities, and beautiful views. The hotel also offers a variety of dining options, from casual cafes to upscale restaurants, all of which serve delicious and high-quality food.

The hotel also has a large and well-equipped fitness center, as well as a beautiful infinity pool and rooftop terrace that offer breathtaking views of the city. The hotel also has a casino and a shopping mall, which are both worth a visit.

The staff is friendly and professional, and always willing to help with any request or question. The hotel's location is also great, it's close to many of the city's main attractions and also has easy access to public transportation.

Overall, the Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a fantastic hotel that offers luxury, comfort, and great views. It's an excellent choice for anyone looking for a high-end hotel in the heart of the city.

This is one of the best hotels in Singapore located right in the middle of the action area. Everything is just a stone's throw away. There are a lot of shopping options if you are into indulgence. You can also explore nearby options quickly if you are staying here.

It has one of the best infinity pools which is located on the 57th floor and only accessible to hotel guests. The only issue is it would be crowded mostly and You can see a lot of guests clicking pictures and capturing the skyline. It gives one of the best views of the city and they have restaurants like Spago and Lavo right next to the pool which give quite a few and reasonable eating options as compared to the charges of the room.

Overall I would say that the room sizes could be better at the cost that is charged but then again you should be prepared for spending some money if you want to visit and stay in one of the most expensive hotels in one of the most expensive city 😜. Definitely a must go if you have the money to experience.

review_text:
My trip to Marina Bay Sands was nothing short of spectacular, and I can't wait to share my experience with you. This iconic destination in Singapore is truly a marvel.

First off, the architecture is jaw-dropping. The three towering buildings connected by that massive rooftop deck, which includes the famous infinity pool, are a testament to human engineering at its finest. As soon as I arrived, I was in awe of the sheer scale and design of this place.

Now, let's talk about the shopping. The mall inside Marina Bay Sands is a shopper's paradise. You'll find all the high-end brands you can think of, and if you're a fan of luxury shopping, this is the place to be.

But the real star of the show is the view. From the rooftop deck, you get an unparalleled panoramic view of the Singapore skyline. I recommend going up there during sunset – the sight is simply breathtaking. And don't forget your camera because you'll want to capture every moment.

Now, onto the services. They are top-notch, just as you'd expect from such a renowned destination. The staff is incredibly friendly and always ready to assist with a smile. I felt well taken care of during my entire visit.

For those planning a visit, here are some tips. Aim to visit in the evening to catch the mesmerizing light show. Check the weather forecast because Singapore can surprise you with sudden rain. And budget accordingly, as Marina Bay Sands offers a plethora of experiences, and you'll want to make the most of your time here.

In terms of improvements, it's hard to find fault, but perhaps more affordable dining options could make the experience even more accessible to a wider range of visitors.

In conclusion, Marina Bay Sands is a must-visit destination in Singapore. It combines stunning architecture, world-class shopping, and breathtaking views into an unforgettable experience. So, if you find yourself in Singapore, make sure to put this gem on your itinerary – you won't be disappointed!

review_text: This is a stunning hotel and will be landmark of Singapore for years to come. If you can afford to stay it’s a great one I believe, I couldn’t afford so we went in for the deck tour to get the superior view of Singapore from top. Guess it was more than 54 floor and deck is on top floor and went in by a high speed elevator, was not crowded when we went, the cost covers a digital photo and if you need a printed one it’s extra. The view from the deck is stunning and luckily when we went it was not that sunny, so could enjoy the view. The swimming pool is on other side and only residents are allowed and from the deck we can catch a glimpse. Please experience this view if you are in Singapore. Once we were done and got to the reception level we strolled the huge lobby which was decorated well for Christmas and had some snacks at the cafe /bakery there. Taste was awesome and you must try. From the entrance of the hotel where taxi dropped us for the deck tour the gardens by the bay is walkable which is another attraction you should not miss.

review_text: Something special about this place is that it's an integrated resort notable for transforming Singapore's city skyline, it comprises three 55-storey towers of extravagant hotel rooms and luxury suites with personal butler services. The appearance of the Marina Bay resort is what makes it famous. The three huge towers are home to 2,500 hotel rooms and suites, joined together at the bottom by a seamless lobby area. What makes these three towers so unique, however, is the way that they are joined at the top. The view is just to die for! I think this is a place for me to enjoy and forget about all my problems for a while. Do you need a break? Have it at Marina Bay Sands!!

review_text:
Fabulous hotel, staffed by great people. everything about this place is awesome, it deserves its iconic status.
Our room was exceptional; clean, well appointed, nicely furnished (it had two TVs!) and the view was incredible. Pay the extra for a high floor and marina bay view, you won’t be disappointed. Guests have exclusive access to the infinity pool on level 57. It does get busy, especially in the afternoon, but it is open from 6am to 11pm so there are quieter times to visit. NB the pool is not heated and can be chilly!  The pool bartenders are so nice and attentive. I would’ve relaxed here all day but the amazing views of Singapore beckon you.
The concierge team also deserve a mention. Welcoming, informative and really helpful about the hotel and Singapore in general. Ask them anything, they have the answer!
We loved our stay here, the whole experience was amazing.

They offer all on-line check in with MBS smart Traveller app and we never had to wait in line to get a room key.  Everything went smooth.

review_text:
Luxurious Experience at Marina Bay Sands Singapore

Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort that offers a unique and luxurious experience to its guests. The hotel's architecture is breathtaking and the views of the Singapore skyline are simply stunning. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed with modern amenities.

The resort's dining options are top-notch, featuring a wide range of international cuisines and some of the best fine dining restaurants in Singapore. The shopping mall is impressive, with high-end designer stores and luxury boutiques. The casino is also a popular attraction, with a wide selection of games and entertainment options.

One of the highlights of Marina Bay Sands is its world-famous infinity pool, located on the rooftop of the hotel. The pool offers breathtaking views of the city skyline and is a popular spot for both tourists and locals. The pool area also includes a bar and lounge, making it the perfect place to relax and unwind.

The staff at Marina Bay Sands are friendly, welcoming, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure that guests have a memorable experience. Whether you need assistance with your room, recommendations for dining or entertainment, or simply want to chat, the staff are always available and eager to help.

MBs offers  a wide array of food options and amenities!

review_text:
Stayed here 2 years ago. An Iconic hotel with great restaurants, bars, shops, and of course famous roof top pool. The hotel design itself is so different from others, hotel with outstanding view even from the room, the room was so spacious, clean and so luxury. There are plenty things to do around in this arena you will definitely enjoy your time here.
The infinity pool gives amazing view of the entire city, book session for an hour and fifteen minutes for each day.
There is also few jacuzzi which has the view to the garden by the bay. The sky park is also free for the hotel guests.
The staffs are super friendly and very helpful.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a world-class resort that offers a luxurious experience like no other. The iconic architecture, stunning views, and impeccable service make it a must-visit destination in Singapore. The resort boasts a variety of entertainment options, including a casino, shopping mall, and numerous dining options. The infinity pool is a highlight, offering breathtaking views of the city skyline. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, ensuring a comfortable and relaxing stay. Overall, Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a top-notch destination for those seeking a lavish and memorable experience.

review_text:
Such a great hotel!
If you’re visiting Singapore you must take at least one night to experience the hotel.
The hotel is well equipped, there is a gym and spa and casino and a whole new level of shopping experience. Oh and of course the tallest pool in the world (57th floor).
The staff is really nice and helpful.
The views from the pool deck (which is exclusive for hotel guests) is just incomparable. Spent hours there, day and night. The views are just addicting.
There is an MRT station right under the hotel (literally beneath it) so it’s so easy to get by.
The hotel is built from 3 buildings, which are huge, so take a little time to learn how to navigate through this huge complex.
The hotel is a bit pricey but it’s just so worth it.
Would definitely come back again.

review_text:
Not worth the cost $3,800USD for 2 rooms for 2 nights. 1 of 2 rooms wasn’t ready for 1.5 hours after guaranteed checkin time and was full of cigarette smoke. They attempted to say they will “clean” it somehow as they said they were fully booked which we refused as our kids were staying there. After some arguing they agreed to find another room which they did. Not sure how as they previously said they were booked. Later that evening we got stuck unable to use elevators from pool when all our keys became disabled including our 1st room. By 8pm we finally had 2 rooms. This is after arriving at 1pm. Really disappointing for a hotel demanding such a high price.

While amazing views and experience from rooftop pool, I would never stay there again. Wasn’t worth it even with the frustration.

review_text:
Definitely an overpriced place, the facility is outdated and the overall management is poorly designed. If you are there for casino and infinity pool this might be the place for you, but if you are there for leisure and holiday (like us), you might be ended up with huge disappointment. The hotel has no walk-in capacity for stay in guests at any bar/lounge, everything need to be booked in advance. We were planned to stay there for 3 nights but couldn’t find a place for a casual drink at any bar/lounge. The staff there was very friendly and managed to help us made a reservation at one of its bar, but there is a dress code which doesn’t allow any guests entry with slippers and shorts. (For god’s sake we just wanted to have a couple of drinks at the bar, who would wear a formal suit on the holiday with the temperature is around 33 degree Celsius)

I gave 2 star only to the staff there, they are very well trained and friendly. Overall a horrible experience. There are plenty of good 5 stars hotel in Singapore which have better facility/service. For the amount of money I have paid, the experience is not even close to expectations. I would never return there.

review_text: The way to WALK to MARINA BAY SANDS or to SANDS CONVENTION CENTRE is via BAYFRONT MRT STATION...take exit D for SANDS CONVENTION and follow the signage..but that could improve especially  whe getting to the convention centre..the floor of which is covered with the orange-brown-black carpets which shows you are walking in the right direction...the rooms (on the 3rd level) are now named after flowers..like JASMINE etc. Ge one problem I faced was the big crowds attending a popular convention on the ground floor...facing the driveway..where the escalators can bring one down to the MRT station as well but not many signage as symbols shown can be confused and as "buses" bringing people to the driveway...the escalators back to the station are not that visible as they are  blocked if one is near the gallery shops etc..(the shopping floor corridos are not carpeted I think)...so once you get to the escalators to get back to the MRT station is easy

I haven’t stayed here hence no score for rooms or room service however when ever I visit Singapore I always head on over to the hotel as I love the atmosphere
One can do the Skydeck Observation viewing which is fantastic I have done both day and night
I have also visited the top roof bar restaurant for lunch which was a great experience
One can have access to the underground shopping mall food court fantastic restaurants
Access to Gardens by the Bay

Even though I haven’t stayed I have found all those who work here to be so friendly helpful open the doors for you and give directions to find things happily it’s such a pleasure to visit here
Great  efficient taxi service too

I love to visit for the vibe it’s air conditioned a great way to escape the heat & humidity or if it’s a torrential rain pour head to Marina Bay Hotel to explore.

Highly recommend visiting

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands Singapore is an iconic landmark in the heart of Singapore that is known for its luxurious accommodations, world-class entertainment, and exceptional dining options. This magnificent hotel and entertainment complex is an ambitious project that has set a new standard for hospitality and entertainment in Southeast Asia.

One of the most impressive aspects of Marina Bay Sands is the ambition behind the project. The development of the complex was a massive undertaking that required extensive planning and execution. The result is a breathtaking structure that features three hotel towers, a massive shopping mall, a convention center, a museum, a casino, and a stunning rooftop infinity pool. The sheer scale of the project is a testament to the vision and dedication of the team behind it.

The staff at Marina Bay Sands are another impressive aspect of the complex. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted by friendly and professional staff members who go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. The staff is well-trained and knowledgeable, and they are always willing to assist with any questions or concerns you may have. They take pride in their work, and it shows in their attention to detail and the high level of service they provide.

One of the things that impressed me most about the staff at Marina Bay Sands is the way they explain the various features and amenities of the complex. From the moment you check in, you are given a comprehensive overview of everything the complex has to offer, including information on the various dining options, entertainment venues, and shopping experiences. The staff takes the time to answer any questions you may have, and they do so in a friendly and informative manner.

Overall, Marina Bay Sands is an impressive complex that is well worth a visit. The ambition behind the project is evident in every aspect of the complex, from the stunning architecture to the exceptional staff. If you are looking for a luxurious and unforgettable experience in Singapore, Marina Bay Sands is the perfect destination.

review_text:
What you’re really paying for when you stay here is to swim in the infinity pool, which is amazing!!! 5 stars for the pool and the pool staff.
BUT everything else is so average (plenty of much nicer accommodation on the island) and check in is painful. It took almost half an hour once I got to the front of the line and then I was told my room wasn’t ready and wouldn’t be for “maybe an hour” - this was at 3:30pm. You are paying a grand a night for that room, you would expect your room to be ready by the usual 3pm time. Luckily I asked if we could go up and use the pool until we had our room which they allowed and were nice about but they didn’t offer that up front. The staff are really nice but the hotel seems to have some strange and very strict processes which makes the stay feel really not holiday-yee. We loved the pool and staff but Otherwise the feel of the place wasn’t enjoyable. We hoped the experience for the price would be better!!
Must say they were helpful with storing luggage though!

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands is one of the most iconic hotels in Singapore, and for good reason. This luxurious hotel offers an unparalleled experience for guests, with its stunning architecture, world-class amenities, and unbeatable location in the heart of the city.

From the moment you step inside the hotel, you will be blown away by its grandeur and sophistication. The rooms and suites are beautifully designed and well-appointed, with all the modern conveniences you could need, including high-speed internet, state-of-the-art entertainment systems, and breathtaking views of the city.

The hotel's dining options are also exceptional, with a range of world-class restaurants serving up delicious cuisine from around the globe. Whether you're in the mood for fine dining or casual fare, you'll find something to suit your tastes here.

One of the highlights of Marina Bay Sands is its stunning infinity pool, which offers breathtaking views of the city skyline. This is the perfect place to relax and unwind after a busy day of exploring Singapore.

It looked like very simple things were missing.
The hotel is undergoing renovation now and it looks like it will be even more expensive.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands in Singapore is a lively and bustling hotel that may not offer a standard relaxing experience. However, its renowned infinity pool lives up to all expectations. Perched atop the skyscrapers, the pool provides breathtaking views of the cityscape, creating a memorable and unique oasis amidst the busyness. If you're seeking an unforgettable pool experience, Marina Bay Sands delivers.

review_text:
I was here for company 's function. Traffic was bad. Can't find parking. For such a high profile venue, you think they would have done it better. Traffic queue to car park was nearly two hours.
Use public transport if you going to this place. Taxi or private car hire are caught up just as badly! Even if you have expensive car, it's useless when you cannot even get near the car park!

review_text: A luxury mall with tons of stores and fancy restaurants. Don't be like us and miss out on the amazing food court. It's definitely a more affordable side of the mall that includes tons of smaller food stalls at better prices. Similar to a standard hawker centre, you can grab food from different spots and bring them back to the table and share. Just be warned, it's a very popular area so it's usually packed and sometimes difficult to find an open table, especially during lunch/dinner times. But there's lots of very tasty food and incredible teas and drinks.

review_text:
Iconic. This is the only way to describe this hotel. We arrived at 9.30am and yet they still checked us in, allowed us our room and were friendly and inviting. We are in room 3622 (36th floor,  room 22)

The cases were brought to the room within 15 minutes as promised, and the bed (for my 16 year old) arrived and was set up within 30 minutes.

You can arrange everything from the app and the large TV.

The room overlooked the gardens and bay as requested.

The room was large, had tea and coffee machines, a pre stocked and free mini fridge, and snack drawer.

The bathroom had a full set of amenities e.g. shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, tissues, dental kit etc. There were slippers and bath robes, which I noticed people also used around the pool.

The lifts are activated by swiping your room key card before selecting your floor. The room key card is also required to access the infinity pool on the roof, which also allocates you a towel.

The pool is amazing. It is warm and has the most amazing views across the river to Singapore, including the Merlion. The food is amazing. You can sit around the pool with anything from squid sushi rolls to burger and fries (both of which are delicious).

Whilst the pool is only open to hotel guests the observation deck is open to the public.

There is nothing to dislike about this experience. Well worth the stay. The last thing to mention is the staff, every one has been brilliant, friendly and charming.

review_text: Marina Bay Sands is undoubtedly an impressive and beautiful destination to visit, with its stunning architecture, luxurious amenities, and breathtaking views. However, you should be prepared for the fact that it can also be quite tiring. The sheer size of the complex means there is a lot of ground to cover, and the lack of available seating areas can make it difficult to take a break and rest tired feet. Despite this, the experience of Marina Bay Sands is well worth it, as long you take it slow and are prepared to pace  and to take the time to fully appreciate everything this iconic location has to offer.

review_text:
Enjoyed our stay at MBS. Was there mainly for work but brought 3 kids along. We loved the views  and the spaciousness of the room. The shower & bathroom were a great size with lovely amenities from Roberto Cavalli but we did wish there was a bathtub!

Of note was the service quality. We had a dedicated team- Erica & Mark- assisting us with an early check-in. They even arranged for a little cake as they knew it was one of my son’s birthday and a bottle of wine… probably since I was solo-parenting with 3 kids!

The kids visited the pool several times even when it was grey & drizzly as the views were really lovely, and we went to many different restaurants throughout our stay which were all lovely, notably Rise, Spago & Lavo.

review_text:
Such a stay!

The rooms are well designed, and the beds are comfortable. You can add an extra bed for a couple of hundred SG$ if you travel in family. They are comfortable too.
The room service delivers in less than 30 min at 9 PM. It's tasty.

There is no alcohol in the mini bar, but everything is free and refills every day.

The WiFi is very easy to access but not available when you are in your balcony and the windows are closed. Very reliable and fast enough to do everything  you want.

When you are on the balcony in a garden room, the road is a bit noisy. But when you close the windows, you can't hear quite nothing.

Between levels 10th to 20th in the garden side, you'll access twice per night to the gardens by the bay show directly from your room. Very pleasant.

There is a SMRT station in the mole next to the hotel.

There is a supermarket in this mole.

We went 3 or 4 times (morning, afternoon, evening) in the swimming pool and never had to wait: there were always plenty of free spaces.

Easy checkout. (Less than 2 min).

Bad points:
- WiFi not available on balcony
- road noise on the garden side in the lower levels
- 1st price wine in the room service which could be better.
- would love not finding the lights turned on after every room service.

review_text:
This isn't really a hotel, it's a captured resort experience. The rooms are enormous, fabulous and the housekeeping is absolutely top notch; we did not want for bottled water and juices over our 5 night stay.

The views are great if you get a high enough room and if you really want access to the pool then you must be booked into a high enough floor to be allowed. Access to the pool is strictly by one room key being presented per adult.

Where this place really falls down is that you absolutely must place a reservation if you want to eat. We were turned away at every single restaurant on the night we arrived and ended up having to order room service food. Inevitably wth a place this size, even despite the insulated trolley, it was cold by the time it got to us. For those of us who are more spontaneous, this is frustrating.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands hotel is THE best hotel in Singapore.

I’ve stayed 4 times to date. The staff are impeccably professional and truly care about you. All of them. They truly want you to enjoy all that the hotel and Singapore offer. Extremely polite, courteous, professional, warm and they smile and laugh too!!

The facilities are second to none. From the absolutely amazing laundry to the incredible breakfast and dinners, utterly stunning roof top pool to swim, rest, incredible views and lots of pics!!!!

MBS works like clockwork. It’s immaculately clean throughout, the amazingly stunning displays in the atrium and hall created in house, check in a dream and so informative to the incredible caring staff who come over and talk to you.

5 stars isn’t high enough. If you stay in Singapore, stay here. You’ll love it and create memories that’ll last a lifetime.

review_text:
Marina Bay Sands® is a destination for those who appreciate luxury. An integrated resort notable for transforming Singapore's city skyline, it comprises three 55-storey towers of extravagant hotel rooms and luxury suites with personal butler services.

Visitors not staying at the hotel can buy tickets to the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck, which offers you unobstructed 360-degree views of the Singapore skyline.

Designed to be an integrated development, it also houses the Marina Bay Sands Casino, shopping mall, museum, and theatres that even non-hotel guests can enjoy. Some of these require tickets for admission, but the price of Marina Bay Sands' attractions is reasonable, given the deluxe experience they offer.

Smart casual wear is required in the casino (casual short pants, sleeveless shirts, slippers, and flip-flops are not allowed).

Take your enjoyment to greater heights at the SkyPark Observation Deck. 56 storeys up, in the heart of the Marina Bay Area, this scenic view of Singapore's world-class cityscape is uniquely breathtaking.

The resort is owned by Las Vegas Sands in agreement with the Singaporean authorities. Marina Bay Sands was originally set to open in 2009, but its construction faced delays caused by escalating costs of material and labour shortages from the outset exacerbated by the global financial crisis.

Marina Bay Sands - Hotel and SkyPark. Consistently ranked as one of the world's most spectacular pools, visitors flock to the SkyPark for a unique experience. It is the world's longest infinity pool (142 meters) and the largest outdoor pool at this height (650 meters).

review_text:
We decided to check off a bucket list item and stay at the Marina Bay Sands hotel specifically for the iconic pool.  And while I am glad we did, I likely wouldn’t stay there again honestly.  For the price, the rooms were really pretty average.  The view we had overlooking the Gardens by the Bay was great though as you could watch the Garden light show from your (tiny) balcony.  Bathroom was nice and large with good amenities.  Staff was overall friendly. The crowds definitely didn’t make it feel personal.  And frankly staying here felt almost like work rather than relaxing.  You had to remember to request check-in times and schedule pool times a day in advance (hard to do while traveling). Then each person has to have their own QR code—only available by SMS—for the pool, which was a problem because some in our party didn’t have cellular service to get the code. Luckily the pool staff accepted the room key and my confirmation email (likely helped we went early before it was crowded).  The pool was definitely impressive!!  It was also frustrating because they advertise over 90 restaurants but we didn’t know they all required reservations, even for lunch.  Most of these were in the mall (full of all the fancy stores and nothing in our price range!). We had a lot of trouble finding places to walk into to eat and that was just annoying.  It was also very crowded.  We did not visit the casino. Honestly the best way to describe the hotel is that you’ll feel like you are in a busy Vegas hotel like Caesar’s or the Bellagio.  It felt more like that than a 5 star hotel, especially considering it was likely the most expensive basic room I’ve ever stayed in.
Again it was fun to say we stayed there. We don’t regret it. But probably wouldn’t do it again. Just go into knowing to expect waits and crowds and that you are doing it to see one of the coolest pools ever.

I should note that one in my party completed a mid-stay survey from the hotel and got an almost instant follow up call. So they do seem to care about customer service.

review_text: One can’t help but be impressed by the size and appearance of this hotel and its location next to the very upmarket and expensive, casino and shopping mall. The rooftop bar and swimming pool are also definitely worth a look. However what it has in terms of grandeur we felt it lacks in terms of soul. The main concourse feels like an airport terminal except there is nowhere to sit and relax, have a coffee, and catch up with work or watch the world go by. The restaurants are OK but not great and the mall is very expensive and exclusive. We did like the lounge bar though and the gardens are great. If you really want to see Singapore I would suggest staying somewhere nearer to China town or Little India.

The staff (primarily Filipino actually) was amongst the most hospitable and friendly people I’ve ever had the pleasure of being helped by. The rooms are gorgeous and truly have an “awe-inspiring” effect. A stay at Marina Bay Sands can only be described as an experience, and it is absolutely unmatched.

*special thanks to Yancy (bell hop), Rochelle (check-in desk), and Christy (poolside) for making our experience so memorable

review_text: This place is a whole world within itself. It is one of the few hotels which can be compared to hotels and casinos in Las Vegas . The views here of the old and modern Singapore nis unforgettable. The restaurant here is excellent and having a beer here , feeling the gentle breeze and enjoying the views here is an unforgettable experience. I recommend this place for the unforgettable experience it offers.
