review_text:
The famous luxurious hotel which has quite become the quintessential signature stamp of the city or country itself over the years. As much as it's luxurious, it's equally spacious and can accommodate a large numbers of guests too. The hotel looks over the garden by the bay on one side and the marina on the other which is the business district of Singapore.
Considered as one of the marvels of architecture it boasts of a boat design placed on the top of the hotel roof which serves as the purpose of an infinity pool. Not only from inside but the beauty of the hotel can also be viewed from outside and during evening when the entire are is lit up. During holidays, a laser show is also held which looks fascinating and this can be accessed via a boat drive situated nearby Clark quey overlooking the merlion statue.

They probably need to make their shelters abit wider so people can still sit up the top near the pool and enjoy the scenery . It is usually windy up so high. My in laws got an anniversary cake. We received 1 too. Staff are very helpful and nice. One of the staff that helped us downstairs and even got our kids little toys which was really nice.  They helped us check in a bit earlier because the kids were sitting in the wind and needed to nap. Would still go here again but weather is always a worry up so high.

There are things to see and do around vicinity of the property as well.

Had an absolute blast staying here at the Marina Bay Sands, the entire experience was fantastic, the staff were so courteous and nice and after I won $1800 at the roulette table the staff were more than happy to upgrade our room and go all out to make it a night to remember.

The only issue I have is with the allowing of Indian/Pakistani & Bengali men to wear open toe sandals and show an awful lot of poor hygiene, I strongly suggest that the MBS strictly enforces the dress code as its wholly unacceptable and not what you expect from what on its face, service and facilities should be deemed entirely unacceptable, shirts, trousers & shoes should be the bare minimum as is required in Las Vegas's most high end establishments.

review_text:
Awesome, worth the money.
A few cons:
1. Men’s gym’s sauna area is located in the same room as toilets, no doors. Resulting in nasty sewage smell when you bath.
2. Morning breakfast area is huge(Rise restaurant), if you get seated on the outskirts, the food goes cold before you sit down and start eating. That’s how much there is to walk.
3. Some of room utensils are low quality - tooth brush and slippers specifically. The brush easily falls apart and threads get stuck in your teeth. Slippers reek of plastic.
Everything else is good, worth it.

review_text:
Probably the most exceptional hotel I've ever experienced! If in Singapore its an absolutely necessary visit (and stay if possible). The interior design is beautiful and the architecture speaks for itself as one of the most unique buildings in the world, made exceptional but the unique infinity pool experience only available to guests staying.

The gym is also a unique experience alongside the spa and almost unbelievably polite staff.
The rooms are remarkable and have a very unique feature where the curtains automatically open as you enter slowly unveiling a draw jopping view of the banking district and harbour.

The connected shopping mall and subway lines add convenience and put you in proximity to one of the highlight tourist destinations of Singapore.

This place did not meet my expectation of professionalism in service for the price I paid SGD890 /room ( no breakfast)

1) check in was really bad, took us 40 minutes, no welcome drink, to compensate for the very slow check in, we were given mini mineral water and lollipop.

2) we checked in 3.40pm, we book high floor room but it was not ready. Only level 15 was available. If we needed high floor we will need to wait another few hours. As explained by lobby.

3) parking issue. I first called lobby and the lady wasn't sure and send me to conceige to check. Conceige counter says they can't give me a ticket because the current ticket on hand expires. Ask me to go lobby counter, and when I went to lobby counter they say they cant issue the ticket because it expires and I can only collect when I check out. I had to explain same scenario 3 times to different people.... (they don't know their SOP??)

4) balcony in room 15 15 has no lights, what's the point of having balcony? When we want to chill at night.

Colleague of mine had the same experience staying 7 nights. Staff couldn't believe it. After 3pm checkin whole world aka people stopping over in SGN 1 night go to the pool. It's cramped on the borderline of health and safety and simply not hygenic. You cannot rely on people taking shower after long flight.
Never again! If you must because of the view, don't do more than 1night. It's not a pleasant stay, 20mins waiting time for breakfast at the restaurant to sit, 60mins room service. No Gym, you have to go to shopping mall oposite and one pool only. I would avoid at all cost.

review_text: It’s really sad that in Summer 2024 they are making staff wear Covid masks. I don’t know who mandated it, but at Raffles I didn’t see staff forced to wear masks - only at Marina Bay Sands. When I see staff wearing masks it makes me feel as if there is a caste system in the country - the poor are forced to “protect” the rich from their “germs”. It’s really gross to weild this kind of power & enforcement upon the people who are unable to defend themselves because they need their jobs. It also makes me think maybe Marina Bay Sands actually has a huge health & sanitation problem - otherwise why such harsh treatment of workers?  If it’s not just MBS, maybe Singapore is the problem. No hotel worker should be forced to wear a mask.  In the future, I’ll avoid travelling to countries where the poor are forced to mask - it’s a human right to breathe fresh air.

review_text:
Typical casino/convention hotel. It's crowded, there was a long line to check-in, the room was perfectly adequate and had a nice view of the super tree grove, but did not wow. Unlike every other hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon tour of southeast Asia there was no special gift or card awaiting us in our room. Housekeeping did send up a generic box of chocolates later, which was too little too late to impress. It's not a great hotel for a romantic getaway.

We opted to stay here only because of the rooftop infinity pool, which is only accessible to hotel guests. The pool is impressive, but also crowded, with a menagerie of Asian and European tourists taking glamour shots at the edge.

If we did the trip again, I would stay at MBS first, instead of last. MBS is adequate but just can't compare to the personalized service we enjoyed in Thailand and Cambodia.

review_text:
My wife and I stayed here for my 35th Birthday. Being basically THE iconic landmark of Singapore, we had high expectations for the stay and ultimately were let down. Although the façade and much of the shopping/main MBS area exudes a 5-star resort feel, the actual rooms are extremely basic. Nothing about our stay was "5-star", for what the final bill was, I would expect a lot more in terms of room amenities, bed quality, overall service, resort perks, etc. Honestly at the end of the day, I just felt like another number in the que. The 57th floor pool is nice for the view only, after that wears off there really is no substance at all. The menu you can order from is tiny (even though there are 3 restaurants up there, you can't order from them....what), the water is seriously frigid, and the drink menu is lacking. There is really no atmosphere at all up there either, from music to theme, to....anything. You just look at the view and pay  for overpriced drinks and food until you've had enough. The good thing is, there is plenty of options for F&B in the area, so no matter what you are looking for you are bound to find it.

Overall I would not recommend staying here, for what they charge and what you get, it really not worth it. There are several extremely nice hotels/stays in Singapore very much more worth you stay than here.

review_text:
My wife and I stayed at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel for three nights in May of 2022. Would I recommend this resort to a friend? Yes. Would I stay their again knowing what I know now about the resort? Yes.

We had a Deluxe King Sky View. It had great views of the city and skyline. The only reason we stayed at the hot was for access to the roof top infinity pool. It it wasn’t for the pool I would not stay at the hotel. It doesn’t feel like you are staying in a hotel. It feels like you are staying in a mall. The hotel is big and impersonal.

The pool is great. Amazing views of the city. However, my wife and I were wanting to have a drink in the pool and watch the sun set. Sounds great doesn’t it. But the pool area does not have an adult only section or pool. This means that there are always screaming splashing kids around you. Don’t get me wrong, I raised two screaming splashing kids. However when you’re paying $1000/night for a room, an adult only section in the pool isn’t too much to ask for.

Additionally, my wife loves to have a bath before bed and the deluxe rooms only have showers.

WI-FI in the rooms was strong. Free waters and sodas in the room were a nice touch. Also the free ice cream at the pool.

We signed up for the Sands reward club and got free breakfast at Spagos and a free happy hour one night.

If you found my review helpful please let me know by giving me a Thumbs Up.

review_text: We went to the mall in Marina Bay Sands called the Shoppe. It reflected luxury and money. It's a mall when most brands are high end and only very few fall in the affordable zone. From Michelen Star restaurants to cafes it's a place buzzing with people. There is a small waterbody within the mall which can be travered on a boat they call Sampan. This ride would be just about 250 mts and exorbitantly priced. They charge extra to take you to the eye of the waterfall which doesn't work half the time. So best is just walk those 250 mts gazing at those beautiful stores. Very well connected to the metro. Also, there are drone shows that happen here in the evenings which are perhaps worth a watch. There is also a museum within the complex.

review_text:
Fantastic experience! Highly recommended!

This was our second stay in MBS, however, I couldn't post a review previously as we had to cut our stay short due to my baby falling sick.

This time, we had a staycation for 4D3N during CNY2022 and it's lovely experience.
The moment you enter hotel premises, you're made to feel why MBS is worth the hype and more!
Check-in process was smooth despite the large crowd & the staff members ensured everyone is well attended to. We proceeded to our room and the luggage arrived soon after.
Room size was good enough. Very clean and pleasant with a beautiful view from the balcony. All the amenities are high quality and well maintained. Loved the bathroom :)
Services are pretty quick and the concierge/room service respond to calls in almost no time. Very impressive, considering the hotel was almost full capacity.
I was overjoyed to see plenty of options in breakfast for my dietary requirements (vegetarian, allergic to eggs) and they're delicious! The breakfast place is very well maintained with nice & warm staffs. They're very helpful in adjusting to my baby's mood who went bit noisy & started dropping cutlery at one point. Thanks for that and apologies for the inconvenience.
In-room dining service is bit expensive but quality is good with adequate portions. They serve within the stipulated time. No delays.
We also explored the infinity pool and observation deck, and both are totally worth the praise. We've been to observation deck couple of times earlier as well, however, infinity pool was just second time as it's limited only for hotel guests.
We can't wait enough to book another staycation with MBS as it never ceases to amaze us with its grandeur and services which is world class.
Kudos to the team! You're doing a wonderful job!!

Booking for pool session was easy too. Just follow the instructions in the email sent prior to checking in. We enjoyed full 1.25 hour of swim & life guards on duty will prompt you 10 min before session ends. So make sure you are on time. No crying kids cos all had to clear for next session guests to enter.

Breakfast at Level 57 was lovely too. Wait for a table through the staff, orders came really fast & food was nicely presented. Yummy too.

Needless to mention, check out was fast too. Just drop the key cards and that’s all. Wonderful staycation experience. 👍🏻

If you are visitor or resident, a visit to Marina Bay Sands, walking around and inside the mall is a must do activity.

review_translated:
There are many MUST VISIT places in Singapore.

Marina Bay Sands is one of them. The towering structure, awesome shopping, connecting to the Gardens by the Bay...phew...just too good.

The count of  number of photos I have clicked Marina Bay Sands keeps increasing.

I feel Marina Bay Sands shows up unique ways in different angles.

I am yet to stay there or use the casino. The awe is high at just the structure and shopping alone so far.

If you are visitor or resident, a visit to Marina Bay Sands, walking around and inside the mall is a must do activity.

review_text: Everyone there was very kind, even the staff. The skydeck has the most mesmerizing views and the food there cannot be better. The view from the skydeck is better at night than day, so if you wish to go to the skydeck for a great view, go at night after dinner.

review_text: MBS staycation was awesome! Room was sapcious with a lovely city view. We went up to the infinity pool, jacuzzi and Club Lounge. The lunch buffet at the lounge was good, but the evening dinner buffet food items could be better. Had breakfast at Rise the next morning and what a spread! Extremely pricey but it was a very pleasant experience.

review_text: One of the most iconic buildings in Singapore and the World. Beautiful architecture. A man made marvel. A ship rooftop sitting over 3 huge concert towers. Rooms are grand and luxurious. Great amenities. MBS does feel like a self contained resort. You do not need to leave the hotels premises for anything. There are bars and nightclubs like Ce La Vi, restaurants like Lavo and Spago, the famous rooftop infinity pool, several day lounges.

review_text: I came here ten years ago when it was first finished. At that time, I just thought the room was very big and the view was good.  Now Marina bay  sands is basically the standard for tourists, and a large number of people go to the top-floor swimming pool to take pictures.  But when it comes to style and aesthetics, it's really far from it.  It can only be said that it is an artificial super scenic spot.  There are a large number of hotels that are better than this.

review_text: Amazing hotel, wow what an experience. Suzuna and team looked after us so well. All the staff are so friendly from the people in the lobby directing you to your lift to the life guards around the pool and all so helpful too. The view from the pool is breathtaking and a truly unique experience. Everything about this hotel is first class. And their transfer vehicles are top of the range too, our driver to the airport was Azat and he was happy to engage in interesting conversation with us. And the architecture on this place is just unbelievable. Thank you MBS :)

review_text:
It's not your typical western restaurants that just serve steaks and burgers.

They serve modernised versions of those dishes with the ingredients rethought. A great place if you are looking for surprises.

Great selection of wines available as well, I suggest go for wine pairing so you would have the right wine set for each of the dishes.

To be they generally tastes great but not outstanding.

The waiters are nice as well, explaining the wines and the dishes in detail. Only thing is that it's noisier that I would like. But atmosphere is good. There's an Asian lady waiter as well, which definitely do help for those who feel stressed under Western accent environments.

review_text: We have stayed in Marina Bay Sands Hotel for 3 nights when we were on our honeymoon with my wife. It is a huge hotel however, the reception spots (there are more than 3 areas for check-in) are working very fast and the employees are really kind for navigating you around. The breakfast open buffet was really delicious. If you like, you can also go downstairs of the hotel to experience another level of luxury with a lot of shops & restaurants & casino and you would be able to spend quality time around.
